author: {'steamid': '76561197993886755', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1589145058}
review:
This is one of those times where a "maybe" button would be nice.
The things I like about this game I feel are very cool. When all the movement and stuff works together and you do the thing cool, it's great. The visuals for a while are very striking and impressive, and the fact that for most of the game you can look up and see future levels, or look down and see how far you've come, is VERY cool.
However I just personally feel there's a lot of inconsistencies in this game that make it hard to have fun.
Dying is an instant, snappy reset, unless the death is via laser, which makes you wait to look at the particle effect to show how you died. Not a long wait, but a pointless one.
Respawning resets your place in the world, but not the world itself. This means enemy placements will be a certain way the first time, and are more likely to be janky subsequent run-throughs (I had a very large enemy follow me out of his arena to try and box me at my spawn). Some triggerable things stay triggered, others reset when you die, and yet more stay triggered until their timer resets, and there's no real way of knowing which one any particular thing is unless you want to waste time waiting or waste more time dying when whatever it turns off.
Resets also don't put the world back onto a specific cycle or anything, which isn't too huge a deal except for the fact that sometimes you can't possibly get the right cycle to happen unless you're either lucky or do a lot of waiting for (to me) no reason. 
And lastly, at least in the later parts of the cycle certain  elements in the environment just seemed to be giving the fuck up. There's this one part where a pillar with a laser glides from point A to point B while spinning around trying to turn you into french fries, except sometimes the pillar either didn't spawn, spawned AT point B,  or similarly but more irritating, only spawned at point B AFTER I'd already done the jump that would send me careening into the laser.
Also the fact that enemies respawn in place after a second or two is quite irritating. And at least the cube boys will still attack if you touch them while they're inactive, which just sucks when you're in a tight space.

author: {'steamid': '76561198814668534', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1591656268}
review: 手残党也可以玩的很开心，主要飞来飞去的感觉太棒了，不过前面的关卡相对来说比较容易，只有最后几关相对说难了太多了，感觉不是一个层级的。不过确实是个好游戏，打折的话，强烈建议入手~还有这游戏不需要汉化，就那几个按键，除了ASDW和空格，就两个技能，E键冲刺，R键回到原点，简单易懂。

author: {'steamid': '76561198809517079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1617199414}
review:
死に覚えパズルアクションですね
箱コンでは感度を上げても下げても照準あわせが全く上手くいかないので
開き直って敵を片っ端から避けて857回死にながら進みました

5ステージあり、難易度がどんどん上がっていくので最初の楽さで舐めていると地獄を見ます
初見クリアタイムがそれぞれ20分→30分→1時間→2.5時間→4時間で後半がキツかった

特定エリアで重力の方向を変えるフィールド発生装置が登場しますが、多分これが3D酔いする人にはやばい
スイッチを入れてフィールドに突入すると柱に立てるよう視点が90度回転します
フィールドから出るとまた90度回転して元の視点に
つまり地上→柱→柱って飛び移ろうとすると
地上→(90度回転)→柱→(中間は通常空間なので90度回転)→(柱が近くなるとまた90度回転)→柱
自分は混乱するだけで済みましたが、視点の回り方がえげつない上に多用されるので三半規管に自信がないとやめておいたほうがいいです

銃もギミック稼働用で、敵に撃っても3秒程度行動不能にするだけなので武器じゃありませんし倒せません
障害物競走なのでFPSっぽいのは見た目だけなのも注意です
クリアした後に二度とやるかク〇ッタレ！と叫びましたが、アイテム取り残しが大量にあるので多分また走ります、オススメ

author: {'steamid': '76561198099234973', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1590629018}
review:
Very satisfying game. It was neither too difficult or too easy. At most, I had to redo a given checkpoint section maybe 20 times, but considering the span of time it takes to get from one section to the next skillfully this likely took up to 5 minutes or so at any given section. Luckily, these sections were scattered about and they would not put a difficult section back to back. The most difficult section, which was an outlier, is on the last level, the 5th, where 3 platforming 'towers' (there is really only the one main one, but they are summits in themselves) must be reached at the top to activate an individual laser from each to a central location. There is one 'tower' in particular where a checkpoint is far from its predecessor, and I likely spent 20 minutes on that one. Each individual obstacle however is easy enough on its own, there may be a trick to the timing and spacing of abilities, but as a whole they conglomerate make a very quick, enjoyable parkour game. 

The game, as others have said, will take at least 3 and at most 6 hrs to complete, I came around in the middle with about 4h 30 in-game. There are no unfair mechanics insofar as a regular play-through concerns. I have read that some had issues with the anti-grav levels but I personally found them easier than the rest of the platforming. I purchased this game on sale for $2.75 CAD and this is one of the best cheap games I have purchased, hence the reason in writing my second review.

The game itself is beautiful. It is always mesmerizing to look at the clouds and exterior environment, it has an otherworldly effect. It is like looking at renaissance murals.

TL;DR DeadCore is a high speed, enjoyable yet challenging, visually appealing game with a difficulty that is just right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091281119', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1561902038}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070446484', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1592503951}
review:
This game has such great control, and allows you to do the dumbest things. You can jump around the level almost however you want, and there's tons of ways to do it. Do the obstacle proper, jump over, under, off to the side, or maybe to the top of it to blast yourself through a huge chunk of level.

The freedom, and mobility allowed is insane. It's one of my favorite platformers, and it's because it allows for so many paths, by it or yourself. No solution is final, and there's very few limits to what you can do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979543573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1692, 'last_played': 1535060712}
review:
First person platforming is very hard to do well - this is as good as it gets.
Timing (boosted) jumps, shooting switches, avoiding lasers, changing gravity - many elements here are combined again and again in many different facets. The Levels can be tackled a number of different ways; there is no real out of bounds there, they are open for players to try to circumvent parts of them by getting boosts from moving blocks.
The only problem I had was the broken resolution: I had to start the game windowed and then set it to fullscreen or else everything was stretched...

Nonetheless a very good game.

Look for speedruns of this game - they are highly entertaining too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136113375', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1586345879}
review:
Не смотря на моё хорошее отношение к жанру платформеров в целом и от первого лица в частности, я не могу сказать, что прохождение Deadcore вызвало у меня однозначно положительные эмоций. И проблема даже не в какой-то излишней сложности, так как я не имею претензий к геймплею, заточенному на множественные попытки пройти один и тот же участок. Дело в том, какими способами эта сложность достигается и, наверное, в общем уровне продуманности и отшлифованности геймплея.

Цель нашего путешествия – забраться на высоченную башню. Зачем и для чего не понятно, сюжет отсутствует, спрятанные на уровнях записки хоть и присутствуют, но дают очень туманные представления о мотивации главного героя. Мне, честно, было не очень интересно в этом разбираться, игра в первую очередь про платформинг от первого лица. 

В начале игры нам, помимо стандартных двойного прыжка и рывка вперёд, вручают специальное оружие, с помощью которого можно взаимодействовать с уровнем, в основном нажатием на «кнопки» выстрелами некими энергетическими зарядами. Также есть возможность на пару секунд обезвреживать противников и турели, которые будут активно нам мешать заниматься платформингом. Эта штука вносит хорошую долю разнообразия в игру и зачастую заставляет одновременно пытаться попасть в цель и контролировать перемещение персонажа.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1951818090

Первые три уровня игрока откровенно балуют новыми элементами, препятствиями и нестандартными ситуациями, и я даже их с удовольствием перепрошёл повторно перед написанием обзора. Лазеры, трамплины и их различные креативные комбинации не дают заскучать, при этом сохраняя отличный баланс между сложностью и увлекательностью. Но уже тут появляются некоторые тревожные звоночки, например огромные вентиляторы, для отключения которых нужно попасть в точку на краю одной из лопастей, что жутко неудобно делать в условиях постоянного движения.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2052900049

Когда в начале четвёртого уровня мне показали элемент, который при включении меняет гравитацию, позволяя тем самым бегать по стенам и потолкам, я по-хорошему офигел. Это оказалась действительно крутая фишка, которую разработчики обыграли на все 100%. Но, к сожалению, именно начиная с четвёртого уровня всё идёт по одному месту, к большей части новых элементов возникают большие вопросы, и происходящее в целом начинает заметно раздражать. Комбинации существующих элементов и препятствий начинают вызывать чувство мешанины, будто разработчики наполняли игру любыми идеями, что приходили им в голову, без деления на удачные и неудачные. Пропадает баланс сложности, чекпоинты могут быть в обилии расставлены на коротких простых этапах, в то время как на длинных сложных их с огнём не сыщешь. В некоторых местах из платформ образуются ступеньки, которые главный герой визуально вполне может преодолеть, но на деле это не так, приходится преодолевать прыжком. Мелочь, но смерти из-за такой ерунды вызывают злость. Появляются новые странные противники. Например, один из них может убить игрока одним выстрелом, от которого нельзя уклониться, в то время как до этого момента в игре не было смертельных противников, они просто отталкивали персонажа. Другой же управляет скопом небольших «комаров», только отключив которого, можно избавиться от всей мелочи, а выцепить его из общей кучи бывает очень трудно. 

И вот из таких недоработок и странных решений состоят последние четвертый и пятый уровни. Я бы не окрасил обзор в красный цвет, если бы не тот факт, что эти два уровня занимают практически 60% игры. На основе всего вышесказанного, я просто не могу рекомендовать игру кому бы то ни было, её прохождение принесло мне не радость, а скорее раздражение, не могу гарантировать, что с вами не произойдёт такая же ситуация.

review: This is everything I wanted CloudBuilt (and Super CloudBuilt) to be. The movement feels good, it's fast-paced and rewarding, the mechanics fit very well together, and the difficulty is paced nicely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026039547', 'num_games_owned': 5509, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1584293034}
review:
J'étais vraiment tenté par ce jeu, j'y ai joué pendant 30 minutes: malheureusement je dois déjà y mettre une évaluation négative.

J'ai un écran 165Hz, le jeu tourne bien à 165 fps mais les mouvements sont "bridés" comme si on était en 60 fps et c'est très perturbant.

J'ai été bloqué par un casse tête dès le début du jeu avec lequel j'ai été tué une bonne vingtaine de fois et j'ai l'impression que je vais y passer une bonne heure de migraine sur le même casse tête et ça m'a rebuté...

Le jeu avait du bon potentiel mais malheureusement pas très bien mis en place... :/

author: {'steamid': '76561197972394559', 'num_games_owned': 1974, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1584168300}
review:
I can see what the developers were trying to do with this game as there are several exhilarating moments moving through the levels. Then the fun stops as there are countless amounts of cheap frustrating deaths that stop all your flow in its tracks.

Some of the most frustrating enemies that you aren't equipped enough to deal with because you can't kill them only deactivate them for literally 1 second or less, then they are right back on you ready to make you extremely angry.

maybe it's just me but beating all the dev times is an act of madness I had enough of the game after playing each level once and getting frustrated.

Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391790976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1669293112}
review: 冷门神作，几年前玩一半的游戏，重新捡起来通关玩依旧觉得十分有趣。无论是氛围，音效，分散式隐晦剧情还是关卡设计都很出色。在尝试中去思考，去探索，整体难度对于手残党可能偏高，但难度层次设置十分合理，很有挑战性。相比现在很多游戏溢出的浮躁下，只能说这才是游戏。平台跑酷类10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197973154898', 'num_games_owned': 1689, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1583383952}
review: I liked this game but it is HARD. You will die non-stop. Great gameplay and I was able to finish it finally. There are lots of tricky parts where you are jumping on boosts, flying through laser beams, getting attacked by robots, it can get intense. It's a lot of fun, but just know it's not a easy game. If you like a challenge you will probably like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999539671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1537368247}
review: If you're a FPS fan......if you pride yourself on precision and fast reflexes.....If you enjoy looking ahead and wondering how the hell you are going to get to your destination...but you know all the tools are in your hands. Then you will love this game. It's hard at times, but that makes it much more attractive. It also brings with it a sense of freedom in what feels to be open world even though it's a linear game. It's a nice balance. I haven't played it for over a year after completing it, but I felt it deserved my upvote after just seeing it still in my library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033307009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1581177552}
review:
Un jeu qu'il est difficile d'évaluer tant de plaisir à résoudre les obstacles comme de frustration à l'encontre de bugs comme la disparition d'élément important sur le parcours.
Des ennemis placé inutilement juste pour faire chier avec un gun qui ne tire pas droit des projectiles dont la visée sniper ne sert à rien d'autre que de rien voir, une magnification n'aurait pas été de trop, ou le fait que les projectiles vont dans la ligne de mire et pas à 3km de celle-ci.
J'ai décidé de ne plus investir de temps dans ce jeu et de me dire que ça valait la peine  de passer à autre chose sans le finir car en fait je n'en tirais plus de plaisir mais que de la frustration.
Dès lors, inutile de continuer quelque chose qui ne donne pas satisfaction.

L'idée est sympa, la nausée et les flashs lumineux aussi.
Le jeu est pas mal, il aurait pu être mieux. Mais c'est à contre-coeur que je met un pouce rouge pour le dernier bug qui m'a fait faire un jolie alt-F4 puis désinstallation (disparition de plate-forme, faire des dash à gueudin pour essayer de rejoindre la prochaine plate-forme avec ces putain de moustiques de merde qui sont la JUSTE pour faire chier) et peut-être voir avec steam si je le supprime complètement de ma bibliothèque ou pas car je doute que le jeu ne soit corriger dans un futur proche et qu'il reste à l'état actuel.
je met un pouce ici pour l'idée du jeu et le désir de produire quelque chose de sympa.
Mais j'ai le droit de dire ce que je pense surtout quand tu payes ton steak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080185497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1677714265}
review: Es frenético y rápido. Perderás el concepto del arriba y abajo, te confundirás al máximo, te frustrarás, y morirás mil veces. Una estética genial onírica que causa vértigo, un laberinto en el cielo que superar con tus habilidades que intentan satisfacer unas exigencias cada vez más altas. Definitivamente me ha encantado y lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274955057', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1539331292}
review:
Aun siendo un juego que ya tiene 6 años, sigue siendo una pasada, tiene una movilidad y control del jugador pasmosa y muy divertido de jugar, los puzles son interesantes y el parkour muy bien diseñado, tiene cosas que puedes romper (saltar desde no se debe o subirte a sitios que no deberias) pero encaja muy bien con el juego y el 90% de esos casos llevan a easter eggs o coleccionables, asique:
Si te gusta el plataformeo/parkour: RECOMENDADO.
Si te gusta explorar: RECOMENDADO.
Si te gustan los juegos que te retan a ser mejor, y a superarte, no se porque aun no lo has juagado.

Lo compre cuando costaba 20 euros y los vale completamente, ahora esta a 10 euros, hecharle un vistazo los vale completamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040210547', 'num_games_owned': 880, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1578524266}
review:
Ignoring the secrets, the game is a fun 2-hour jumping and shooting experience. I naturally found 15 secrets and could probably go back and find the missing 35 secrets but with the game having the same futuristic look for all 5 levels with no variation, it just doesn't feel satisfying finding them with how similar the levels all feel. The gravity sections are pretty disorientating. I didn't find myself being slowed down by them due to playing games of this nature before, but I can see how would confuse newer players. They feel really nice to get through quickly however and really give you the feeling of being a gravity-bending parkour master. 

The amount of ammo the gun has is fine for most of the game but you start to feel starved for ammo once you get the Charge Blast, although I should mention that there are ammunition upgrades hidden somewhere in the game that I didn't find so you might have a different experience compared to mine. The game is beatable without ammo upgrades as most enemies just try to bump you off the stage but can be avoided instead of disabled with the switch gun in order to save ammo. There might be a bonus ending if you collect everything since the final level ended with the press of a button and everything falling apart with the game hinting at the fact that I missed a couple of things.

Overall, a good purchase if you want a fun first-person platformer. Quick enough to speed through and has some things to hold you for a couple more hours. The level design could use some variety to make finding secrets and exploring a bit more fun but it's pretty difficult to change up the setting when the game is centered around sky towers and robots

author: {'steamid': '76561198066922531', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1578092456}
review:
Celles et ceux qui recherchent un jeu du type "SuperMeatBoy mais en FPS" peuvent se jeter corps et âme dans Deadcore. Le jeu est bien conçu, l'expérience très difficile, la direction artistique inspirée et lisible, le contrôle du personnage principal réussi : les amateurs de speedruns et de défis ardus seront ravis. D'autant plus que le level design et les pouvoirs du personnage permettent de vraiment naviguer à sa guise dans l'environnement et de créer ses propres chemins vers la fin de chaque niveau. 

En ce qui me concerne, bien qu'appréciant des titres comme Celeste, l'ajout de la 3ième dimension associée à des changements de gravité et des passages labyrinthiques dans la seconde moitié du jeu m'ont frustré plus qu'amusé. Pas de la faute du jeu en lui-même, même si j'aurais aimé que certains checkpoints soient moins éloignés les uns des autres, ou que le positionnement des ennemis soit moins aléatoire. Pour moi, ce fut une succession de "try hard pendant 10min pour 1 seconde de satisfaction". 

Je recommande donc ce jeu malgré tout, pour les joueurs expérimentés qui savent à quoi s'attendre. Pour les autres qui sont, comme moi, rebutés par les jeux focalisés sur le "défi pur" et la "difficulté" : passez votre chemin. Pour ma part, je ne toucherai plus au jeu, même pour débloquer la "vraie fin", la fin normale me suffit amplement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000141757', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1576625121}
review:
I got this game in a bundle from Bandai Namco which I mostly purchased for another game. It's made the bundle worth the price I paid in spite of my strong distaste for that other game.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*] Solid first-person platforming. Reminds me a bit of Quake 3 jump maps without the bunny hopping.
[*] Lots of alternate routing seems to be available, with no invisible walls to get in your way.
[*] Seems like it would be fun to go fast in, though I'm not a speedrunner and haven't watched the current record runs.
[*] Flawless native Linux client (I use arch btw.)
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*] The player's aerial hitbox feels quite weird when jumping through laser windows - your entire body is lower than the camera would suggest. [spoiler]This is especially noticeable once you get the dash.[/spoiler]
[*] FoV caps at 90, which gives me headaches after a couple hours. 110-115 would be better. Note that this is a problem with a majority of other current first person games as well, but older shooters tended to provide higher FoV caps and / or allow the player to change it via a console.
[/list]

tl;dr: Gameplay is fun; recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079319586', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6601, 'last_played': 1691358292}
review:
BOOOOOOOOOONJOUR
Boisoir Welcome etc etc....
Ce jeu est vraiment est vraiment bien. Vraiment VRAIMENT BIEN.

J'y ai pas mal joué c'est assez détente. On commence part jouer lentement en se familiarisant avec les controles, puis au fur et à mesure on commence à réfléchir en profondeur et utiliser nos nouvelles compétences intelligement. On se retrouve à tester des choses invraisemblable pour gagner quelques seconde sur le temps Et on se rend compte .. Qu'on s'est bien amusé.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3471, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1574964328}
review:
Deadcore ist ein 3D-Jump'n Run in futuristischem Design. Wir rennen und hüpfen hier durch ein ungewöhnliches Szenario das uns an einer gewaltigen turmähnlichen Konstruktion hinauf in schwindelerregende Höhen treibt. Das nenne ich 3D mal interessant ausnutzen. Optisch wirklich sehenswert mit leichten Plattformer-Elementen, wir kämpfen zwar nicht, müssen aber häufiger auf Schalter schießen um sie aus der Entfernung zu betätigen. Schickes Game für Freunde des gepflegten Rennens und viel Hüpfens. Die Steuerung ist aber gewöhnungsbedürfig, ich hatte anfänglich Schwierigkeiten die Sprünge richtig abzuschätzen.

https://youtu.be/kwj4l-3N86Y

author: {'steamid': '76561198124199208', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1588563759}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090035210', 'num_games_owned': 2207, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1575866233}
review:
Sci-Fiな浮遊施設をひたすらストイックに登っていく3Dプラットフォーマーである

平たく言えば壺男の3D版と思ってもらえば間違いない
ただしこちらにはチェックポイントが存在するので12時間が消え去るといった出戻り感は殆ど無い
その代わり数多くのトラップによって即谷底へ突き落とされる
むしろ死ぬのが仕事であると言って良い高難度死にゲーとなっている
再開レスポンスは良いためその辺のストレスは感じないだろう

鋼の精神を以ってストイックに取り組める人ならオススメだ

author: {'steamid': '76561198145662591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1654560470}
review: This game is pretty amazing! It's a strategic, puzzle, platformer and its centered on this largely scaled tower climb as shown in the image. I'm still in the early hours of trying it out so I haven't quite discovered it all, but if you like platforming and puzzles, this game is a must for you. The music is better than I expected, and the graphics, well they're nothing to get overly excited about, but they did great with what they had. The mix of lightning, wind, varying clouds, color and the like have an interesting appeal, and are a nice touch for the backdrop. The levels start out easy and progressively get more challenging. The level layout and design is very capturing. There are checkpoints scattered all throughout the courses, and each one is timed. Obstacles vary from pitfalls, to lasers, turrets, robots, and gravity vortexes. Overall this game seems very entertaining thus far for the simplicity of it. Very pleased with my purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065962732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 4007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2458, 'last_played': 1686950666}
review:
C'est un jeu que je conseillerais à tout ceux qui s'intéresse au speedrun. On a jeu, qui est loin d'être moche et qui est simple à comprendre. Faut aller de plateforme en plate forme jusqu'au bout de niveau. Il y a des petites énigmes, rien de bien méchant, des chemins alternatifs. Et au fûr et à mesure que vous progresserez vous aurez l'occasion de ramasser des power up vous rendant la vie un peu plus simple et des capacités qui vous seront nécessaires dans la progression (notamment le dash)

Le jeu devient intéressant quand vous l'avez fini une première fois et que vous voulez le faire en mode speedrun car le level design est sympa, car ouais vous avez donc un chemin principal, vous avez des chemins détournés que vous trouverez en observant un peu plus (ou pas) et vous pouvez vous lancer dans le "hors piste" avec des tricks divers et variés, si vous voyez ce que je veux dire. Ce qui est bien c'est que vous n'avez pas besoin d'être un programmeur ou avoir un ultra instinct pour détecter un timing parfait pour commencer à  vous amuser dans ce domaine là, contrairement à d'autre jeux.

Le point négatif, c'est que si vous jouez au jeu d'une manière totalement lambda et casual, les deux derniers niveaux sont infernaux et je n'exagère pas. Assez étrangement le jeu devient plus facile si on emprunte des voies détournées. Certains diront que le jeu est court, mais si on se base sur l'optique que le jeu est orienté vers le speedrun... bah ça va en fait, vous pouvez "travailler" un niveau sans que ça s'éternise, moi j'apprécie

author: {'steamid': '76561198085150472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1566766137}
review: DeadCore is a slick run and jump tower climber. Visually it's a nice sci-fi themed game that reminds me of TRON which I like. But good god is this difficult. From the moment you start the game you need to move with precise timing, control and plan your steps perfectly. The game play becomes more challenging- and frustrating rapidly. One false move or misstep and you are dead. Be ready to die a whole hell of a lot trying to reach the next checkpoint. Each time I made it to a checkpoint I was like thank the baby Jesus I'm here. That feeling of accomplishment quickly wore off as I started the next stage though. For myself this wasn't an enjoyable experience because DeadCore is far more aggravating than fun. If you want a seriously tough speed running video game DeadCore might be the thing you are looking for. Be prepared to throw your mouse and keyboard through the monitor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261589194', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 304, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1565967782}
review:
다 제쳐두고, 이 게임은 사운드가 좋기로 유명한 게임인데, Win 10에서 사운드가 나오지 않는 버그가 있다.
Win 10 이용자는 게임의 재미를 반만 느낄 수 있다.
아무리 2014년작이라지만, 출시 직후 Win 10이 대중화된 걸 생각해 보라.
개발자가 업데이트에 있어 대단히 게으르다는 걸 알 수 있다.
이에 더해 심지어 엔딩 컷씬에서 프리즈 현상까지 있다.

본 게임은 3D FPS 플랫포머 게임으로, 출시 당시엔 신선한 매커니즘으로 호평 받은 게임이다.
그렇다, '당시엔' 신선했다.
당시의 감각으로 본 게임을 리뷰하는 것은 나로서는 불가능한 일이기에, 현재의 관점에서 리뷰를 작성하고자 한다.

상당한 난도의 3D FPS 파쿠르 게임으로, 속도감과 쾌감을 느끼기엔 좋은 게임이다.
또한 맵 디자인이 매우 허술하여 다수의 구간을 스킵할 수 있는 점이 특징이다.
스킵을 통해 엄청난 시간 단축이 가능할 것으로 생각되며, 게임 모드 중에 스피드런 모드가 있는 것도 이해가 간다.
그러나 맵 디자인이 허술한 점이 단순히 장점은 아니다.
맵 디자인이 과도하게 허술한 탓에 중간중간 끼는 버그가 있다.
또한 플랫포머 게임에서 가장 중요하다 말할 수 있는 판정이 애매하다.
속도감을 중요시하다 보니 게임을 날림으로 만든 감이 없잖아 있다.

그래픽 디자인은 소위 '있어 보이는 디자인'이다.
은근한 분위기로 승부하는 디자인이란 소리다.
자세히 볼수록 조잡한 것을 알 수 있는데, 특히 구름이나 번개 같은 배경 디자인은 정말 눈 뜨고 볼 수 없을 수준이다.
그래픽은 최하점을 주고 싶다.

또한 마지막 레벨의 레벨링은 혹평을 하지 않을 수가 없다.
직전 레벨과의 난이도 차이가 너무 심하다.
플랫포머 게임을 어렵게 만드는 방법은 여러 가지가 있다.
본 게임에서는 그 중에서도 최악의 방법으로 난도를 조정했다.
바로 세이브 포인트의 수를 줄이는 것.
맵 자체의 난도를 올리거나 빌드를 짜기 어렵게 만드는 방식으로 레벨링을 하는 편이 나았을 것이다.
세이브 포인트의 수가 너무 적어 한 트라이 한 트라이가 너무 오래 걸린다.
도전의식은 사라지며, 지치기만 한다.
게임을 계속 하고 싶은 마음이 점점 줄어드는 레벨 디자인이었다.

전체적으로 큰 스케일의 속도감 있는 3D 플랫포머라고 말할 수 있다.
하지만 그래픽이나 버그, 레벨 디자인을 살펴보면 화가 날 정도다.
비추천한다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280498438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1564571679}
review: Das Spiel war schon extrem schwer. Doch wenn man den nächsten Checkpoint erreicht hat, fühlt man sich um so einiges glücklicher. An vielen Stellen denkt man, dass diese nicht lösbar wären, doch desto öfter man Fehler macht, desto besser wird es. Ich habe kurz und knapp 6 Stunden gebraucht bis ich es an die Spitze geschafft habe. Klar ist das lang aber sehr viele Gebiete scheinen wirklich unlösbar, bis man sie halt mehrere Male ausprobiert hat. Was das Spiel noch schwerer gemacht hat, als es ohnehin schon ist, waren diese nervigen Würfel, die einen dauernd runtergeschubst haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013990072', 'num_games_owned': 1513, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1564050609}
review:
What initially started as an interesting concept and enjoyable game quickly turned into the embodiment of malice and hatred that I now feel for it deeply.

The 3D platforming concept was neatly executed most of the time, and the game succeeded in keeping the gameplay fresh by introducing new mechanics and mobility tools, all the while keeping the experience simple enough to be easily understood most of the time, while making the game challenging all the way through.

What I definitely liked about the game was the possibility to forge your own path. This includes both multiple routes a player can take to get to the end of the level, taking on challenges more suitable or preferrable to tackle (not to mention it gives a lot of replayability value), as well as the aspect of being able to completely omit the paths presented to you to gain access to the goal via quite unpredictable means. 
One could think the game is pretty linear with their straightforward, although branching, paths, but the game turns more and more freeform when you decide NOT to go the straight path. There's unlockables and upgrades scattered around everywhere, some well hidden, some difficult to access, but being able, and even willing, to find a way to reach and collect them, can completely change the outlook on the game. 
Moreover, the collectibles allow you to access newly unlocked areas of the map by essentially materializing the new sections, further increasing the replayability value and freeform aspects. 
Same goes for dash/jump and ammo upgrades. Although it is entirely possible to get through the game without any upgrades, the game rewards collecting the secrets by increasing your ammo capacity, jumping and dashing distance, reducing the energy cost of the dash etc.
Even though my own playthrough was, for the most part, pretty linear, I've since then watched the video of somebody collecting all of the unlockables, and the way they moved around the map and the areas they've accessed made me realize that despite playing the same level, we were playing a completely different game. Which is very much a big plus as far as replayability value comes.

Now, the game's interesting mechanics and the freeform playstyle possibility aside, there are certain grievances I have about the game.

For starters, the game is incredibly infuriating when it wants to be. The enemies in particular serve to be a nuisance rather than a threat, although they become a nuisance to the point of popping one's vein at times. With the exception of one, the enemies don't kill you, only red walls/floors do. The enemies instead either push you out of the map or hamper your control, slowing you down, breaking your vision, overall just taking control away from the player. That wouldn't be such a bad thing by itself, except for the fact that the game is very particular on how to get through certain sections. If you don't succeed to get through a certain section of the game flawlessly, you can be sure the mobs will screw you over. They are an obstacle as any other, but they purposefully try to block you from progressing through the section. And when you're required to make a dozen split-second decisions to get through a section, a Companion Cube-esque enemy pushing you off the ledge in mid-air can screw over your whole run. It's especially frustrating because it was not because of my own mistakes and poor execution of the section in front of me, but by taking away my control over the situation that I fail during those times. And there's few things as rage-inducing as making me fail not by me failing to execute something properly, but by taking away my control and seeing everything crumble in front of my eyes (That's why people hate Mei in Overwatch).

Another really frustrating thing is how enemies push you off the platform, [strike]and then you have to spend the next 20 seconds falling down the level before you die. It takes a long time, and I sometimes wish the enemies would just kill me on the spot instead of making me sit there and wait[/strike] (Turns out this isn't the case and I'm just dumb, you can click R to respawn immediately). God forbid it happens during a particularly difficult section that you have to repeat 10+ times by itself, [strike]and add to that half a minute long respawn section[/strike], and the swarm rooting you in place while two cubes push you into the wall and down the platform, and you have yourself a perfect recipe for what is cunningly concealed as a platforming puzzle game, but ends up being a rage-game experience comparable to the likes of Geting Over It.

Oh, and I may not have mentioned how the long, split-second perfect requiring sections with a minimum margin of error and a randomness factor from hostile mobs taking away your control need to be repeated all over and over and over again from the very beginning 7 platforms ago because the checkpoint system is really scarce in some of the most absurdly difficult sections in the game.

Another thing I have a problem with is how pixel-perfect the game sometimes wants you to be. It's really difficult to measure the exact size of your character in relation to the obstacles you're seeing. There are certain specific obstacles that especially infuriate me because of it, namely the ones in which you're required to dash through a tight gap between the red walls, and if you do it at a wrong time, a split second too soon or a split second later, you might either get your forehead vaporized, or your legs sliced off. Thing is, you're just a flying gun with no model to represent your body, so you can never really know how close you are to touching the red floor.

What the game often lacks is the clarity of what is happening with the introduction of the gravity field mechanics. In reality, the game has no floor, the platforms and enemies alike fly, and all the rotating mechanisms can appear on the floor as well as on walls and ceiling. And there are sections which require you to switch between multiple gravity fields pulling you in multiple directions, and you really lose the sense of which direction you're going to fall towards when you jump out of it. Granted, some sections are more clear about it than others, but for the most part they're really unintuitive.

I'd give this game a 6.5/10. Overall, the game itself is incredibly infuriating and sometimes quite confusing, it's very particular with its execution of certain sections, requires you to be way too perfect at times with a very low margin of error while introducing hostile enemies meant to break your run at the same time. However, overall I'd say the interesting and fresh mechanics through and through, as well as a freeform approach to clearing the level, not to mention the introduction of collectibles that actually reward the player for the effort of getting them, all in all provide an interesting, challenging, although sometimes clunky and even more often unfair, experience. The game would probably get an additional 0.5 or 1 score if it wasn't for the annoying enemies and/or if it were more clear about the fact that it's a rage game as much as it is a platformer.
developer_response:
Hey 49 Times,

First of all, thanks for the very instructive review! (and buying our game ^^...)

I don't have much to say since it's pretty accurate, but I just wanted to ask you if you knew there was a key to respawn instantly to the last checkpoint? ("R" by default).

If not... well... I guess I didn't do a good job with the tutorial : /

-@

author: {'steamid': '76561198016747572', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1563812644}
review:
１面あたりは普通のジャンプアクション
そこからだんだんと要素が追加されていく感じ
技術で差が出るのがくるくる回る風車のターゲットや軍団で来る敵オブジェクトを素早く打ち抜けるかで
クリアしやすさが変わってくるところ。

後半の重力反転紫エリアとかで進行方向分からなくなったりしやすい
とりあえずラインに沿っていったり、フチをそのまま進めば地面に立てたりする

２週目は能力も最初から開放されてるので
タイムアタックしても
１週目でいかなかった別ルートに挑戦してみるもよし

収集アイテムで世界観の分かるログが見れる感じ

author: {'steamid': '76561198056161411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1563542490}
review: Very challenging parkour game with lots of opportunities to skip some areas of the maps if you're skilled enough. Very pretty game too. Even though the game's not completely linear, you always know where to go next if you pay the tiniest bit of attention to what's going on. This game can be a little frustrating at times when you get stuck in an area, but when you get through it, it feels all the more satisfying. I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358093939', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1575352423}
review:
I got to a level I couldn’t beat and punched a hole in my monitor. Now I have to spend a couple hundred bucks to get a new one. 

Jokes aside, Deadcore is an undeniably fun game with intuitive, easy to learn mechanics. You run, you jump, you shoot, then you repeat. That is the game. If it sounds like it could get a bit boring after, say, 4 hours I would have to agree with you. I capped out at about 5, and haven't played in a while. However those 5 hours I played for were quite enjoyable and worth the $1.19 I payed for the game (hehe I love sales). I'm actually not going to bother giving this game a rating our of 30, Instead I'll just recommend that you pick up a copy if its on sale. So check this game out next time you find yourself aimlessly scrolling through the "under 12 dollars" section on the Steam Featured page.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137753404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1562019530}
review: DeadCore ist ein Platformer in einer Science-Fiction Welt. Man spielt einen Roboter in First Person. Die Mechaniken sind interessant; Doppelsprung, Sprint und die Waffe die man besitzt, um Objekte zu aktivieren, machen das Spiel sehr abwechslungsreich, ganz leicht ist es auch nicht. Die Level sind vertikal sowie horizontal aufgebaut, die Umgebung sieht atemberaubend aus, das fiktive Design der Zonen passt sehr gut ins Bild. Auch wenn nicht all zu lang, für 2,50€ im Summer Sale definitiv einen Kauf wert

author: {'steamid': '76561198119511670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1474, 'last_played': 1479942087}
review:
I originally got this gifted but couldn't redeem it because of region restrictions. I found the game quite attracting though, so I ended up purchasing it. 
Anyway, I did not regret it at all! It's a fun, interesting platformer with great mechanics that unfold as you progress through the game, the graphics and ambient music go well together and will immerse you in neat, different environments each time... 
The only downsides I found are, firstly the lack of a proper game reset (to be able to replay the whole game without any skills or items once fully completed) and secondly, a storyline that's a little bland / confusing. On a gameplay perspective though, it's amazing and it will captivate you (and make you rage occasionally).

author: {'steamid': '76561198144054106', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1561157681}
review:
DeadCore c'est un platformer-FPS avec un gameplay ultra agréable, basé sur la vitesse et l'élan. 

Le jeu est assez beau et a une bonne ambiance, même si c'est un peu dommage d'en avoir qu'une (ou 2) durant tout le jeu. Le level design est vraiment bon, je n'ai jamais été perdu et les indications textuelles sont bien intégrées à l'univers. L'OST est OK sans plus, le sound design propre et le jeu est vraiment plaisant à jouer en général. 

La difficulté est assez bien dosée et demande une dextérité et un temps de réaction un poil exigeants, mais réussir certaines phases apporte ce sentiment de speedrun enivrant. La rejouabilité a été travaillée avec un mode speedrun justement, et un NG+ avec toutes les capacités débloquées qui rend le jeu encore plus rapide. 

On peut quand même déplorer le manque d'histoire intéressante (il y avait du potentiel), quelques glitches et surtout des ennemis qui font vraiment tache et rajoutent un côté aléatoire et frustrant qu'on aimerait bien enlever. 

Ce jeu reste très bon donc bravo et merci aux 5 mecs qui l'ont créé.

review:
What can I say, this game caught me by surprise! It's amazing! I have only played it a couple of hours so I can't comment about the length of the game, but so far I'm really enjoying it! Fast, puzzling, and fun!
Be warned though, this is a game where on some levels you have to respawn and respawn and respawn
If you don't have the patience then do not play this game!
Overall if you're into speedrunning time of games then I fully recommend this little gem!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979345019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1643837675}
review:
This his how the new Doom should handle. Fantastic air control right from the start and what seems to be the best (bar Warsow, perhaps) dash implementation I've seen in an FPS.

While gameplay is fantastic, the technical aspects are not great. It says 150 fps but it looks and feels like 60. Mouse lag and all. This is not how 120 Hz should feel like.

The game is totally worth it. One cannot overstate how it is for people with the skills and patience to play it. I bought DeadCore just as I finished The Talos Principle. I've been having a blast lately

author: {'steamid': '76561198129165949', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1607237663}
review:
I played the Story, took about 5hr 11min, which is pretty good for a $10 game in my opinion. While those 5 hours weren't necessarily all progression (I would be stuck on different parts for about 50-60 minutes of that time), it was still a really captivating experience that had very unique and innovative aspects.

1. Gameplay/Controls:
There are quite a few things to go over here, but lemme just start out by saying this is NOT an easy game, and it is NOT meant for a casual gamer. That's not to say you can't have fun with it if you are a casual player, but I think DeadCore is meant for very patient and skilled players who are looking for a very big challenge and like fast paced platformers. In fact, it's probably the hardest platformer I've ever played. Yeah, it takes some time to figure some jumps out, and ya may die a thousand times on one small part, but that's half the fun, honestly.
Movement in this game is pretty easy to learn. I had the jump height and range, amount of input lag (which feels like literally none btw), and movement speed down some time during the second level. Overall, the controls are VERY responsive and if you wanna stop in the middle of the air, you will stop nearly instantly. Momentum is really unique in this game, which you'll learn pretty quickly.
Difficulty never struck me as over the top, no matter how hard it got. Trust me, it gets VERY hard. The only reason I was able to get through the entire game was through lots and lots of patience, but it pays off when you finally get past that really hard part you were struggling with. The difficulty's pacing works well, too.

2. Artwork/Story:
So the game itself looks alright, nothing super groundbreaking or anything. Where the visuals definitely shine, though, are in the moments where you look up at the Tower in the early levels, and down in the later levels. Seeing all that content on your screen at once just puts a smile on my face. Also, can we talk about these Logs and their concept art?? Absolutely phenomenal and I want to meet the person who made those pictures. Really thought provoking.
The story is where the game kinnnda falls off, with some less than engaging text in the Logs. I would have liked a more in-depth take on the Tower and what this person's objective really is. Why is he climbing the Tower? Who is "Her" supposed to be?

3. Music/SFX
Last but not least is the aspect they did PERFECTLY. The attention to quality with the music and SFX in this game blows my mind. We got like 20 tracks to build a custom playlist with for the Speedrun mode, most of which are musically very interesting, a very good title theme, and even multiple samples for the select sounds in the menu. If I don't enjoy playing the game, I enjoy listening to it.

8/10 - Not perfect, but they nailed so much and I can't say a particularly bad thing about this game. Great work Namco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081224926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1552607072}
review:
Was gonna write a proper review but seeing as this game isn't even worth trying to finish past Level 4 with it's ridiculous design choices, the absurdly perfection demanding hit boxes for switches and the annoying pests that come in the form of flying robots and turrets serving no purpose other than fukkin with your aim...I think I'll pass on that, too.

For the record, my aim is pretty decent with FPS type games but when you can literally miss an object by ZERO PIXELS(yes, I have stood still in game and found this happening) it stands to reason that the devs themselves might either be missing some screws upstairs or they're just complete a.ssholes.

But I digress. I'm sure someone like Shroud would love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151983440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1551959408}
review:
This game is very pretty, and is actually pretty fun to play, if you like FPS / Puzzle games.  However, if you are like me, and have notifications going from Discord or Telegram or whatnot, if you tab out of the game without pulling up the menu, you've just crashed your game.  Oh, and if you try to pull the game back up, you've crashed your computer.

I have tried to reinstall drivers and the game itself to see if I had a corrupted driver or game file, but nope.  Whenever the game becomes minimized, the software doesn't know how to work in the background and crashes.  Only way to fix it is to kill it in Task Manager.  If you do accidentally click back into the game, you better know where the power button is on your computer, cause you're never going to be able to access your computer after doing that mistake.

If you do not have notifications going off, and are just going to play the game and exit it, this is a good game for you.  The music's good, the visuals are amazing, the mechanics are easy to learn.  The only problem that I can find is the crashing issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236759496', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1551429403}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026967461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1555802923}
review: This is really sad. This game has very positive aspects : the overall cyberpunk look, the music fitting ambiance, the pretty original concept ... but why is it ruined by the boring hardcore sequences you need to chain like 30 or even more times before you can reach the next so far away savepoint - when stupidly easy locations are filled of them ? Meaning of "earn reward" is okay but here it tends to be "free frustration" grind. It's sadly ruining it all :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198034855376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1547232370}
review:
вначале вроде норм, но когда начали идти уровни из разряда попробуй 20 раз подряд приземлиться на эти маленькие тоненькие платформы, расположенные в 150 метрах от изначальной точки, попутно отбрыкиваясь от различных лазеров, охраников и прочих становится не очень интересно (а если не получается, то начинаешь  комбинацию в 20 прыжков заного) 
по сути игра превращается в бесконечное сражение с управлением и параллельным поиском а куда же дальше прыгать

напомнило старые аркады на нинтендо (например марио), когда нужно было безупречно перепрыгать врагов, чтобы пройти уровень и всякие старые шутеры на ПК, где ради какого нибудь секрета необходимо было буквально по тоненьким едва заметным колонам/парапетам пропрыгать до какой нибудь заначки. лично я такое никогда не любил.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970083635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1546263225}
review:
This game is what it is. If you like speedrunning and grinding away at the same level until you have it in your reflexes and don't even think about what you're doing anymore, then this is the game for you. But if you want to explore and find out about some kind of story, then this is not a game for you. The game literally has no story, which is funny because you have to play "story" mode to play any other mode.

3D-platforming refined into a niche game that only the most masochistic players will enjoy. 

I'll say this for it: it has no performance problems and looks great. Controls are fine. Graphics are shiny but lacks interesting features. This game may as well have been made 20 years ago just as well. But that doesn't mean much, really, except that is feels outdated.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996720379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1546186978}
review:
パズルアクションというよりはランにFPS要素としてスイッチを銃で押させるゲーム

■良かった点
難易度はやや高いが楽しいと思える程度
リスポンが細かくあり、再スタートも早くストレスがない
クリアだけなら言語関係なくクリアできる
世界観、BGMが良い
■悪かった点
重力床のギミックに関しては切れ目でどうしていいか分かりづらい場面がおおくあまり好きにならなかった
隠しアイテムで解禁される資料などは英語

ゲームとしてはCloudbuiltに似ている、あちらが好きならおすすめ
4～5時間でクリアと少し軽めだが、これ以上あると飽きもあるし十分楽しめた
75点　正規値で十分価値あり、セールなら買うべし

author: {'steamid': '76561198127991795', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1543692905}
review: Nice definition of how a speedrun works, I can't deny it. But if you're a beginner and you're not used to all the speed and tricky moves, just go away. You'll struggle way too much and this game will disgust you. But if you're brave enough, just go for it, this game is worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561197995797795', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1704948532}
review: This is the best game on Steam.  Double-jumps, air dash, gravity altering purple zones, laser grids.  Good story.  Big storm.  All by yourself.  Secrets.  Room to think big, quiet thoughts.  Room to jump.  Higher and higher.  Jump more.  Semper jump.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046897109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1544400562}
review:
The mechanics in the game have potential, but the overall feeling of the game makes it hard to play.

The biggest problem with the game has to deal with a lack of information, leading to mistimed boosts and frustrating mistakes.

If you are looking for a fun platforming experience, play something like Cloudbuilt. This game feels too slippery and difficult due to the game being too tight for an FPS platformer.

review: I had a great time playing this one. It basically has you always climbing upward in more creative and difficult ways. If you are afraid of heights, this would be great therapy for you, heh. The controls are tight as they should be since you will be platforming alot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021405409', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1544036437}
review: Beginning of the game was fun, but when the annoying blind jumping through gravity blocks that deactivate while being bombarded by un-killable enemies that knock you back when they re-activate, while randomly wandering around and not even resetting when you die. They just clutter everyting up and become an additional faux difficulty that was completely unnecessary. Will not be recommending the game because of this, but without the enemies, would have been an extremely enjoyable game to 100% and would for sure have recommended. Let me know if an option to remove the enemies will ever be added, then I will definitely play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156369001', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1565261786}
review:
Ну, я сидел и думал, писать обзор на DeadCore или нет и как вы видите, выбрал первое. Сразу поясню, что я считаю глупым, ставить отрицательную оценку игре за ее сложность, вы вообще нормальные? Кхм. Приступим.

Плюсы:
 -Атмосфера. Не, ну она тут действительно классная, ничего не сказать.

 -Музыка. Она просто божественна, под нее очень приятно играть.

 -Геймплей. Нам заявляют сразу, что ваша цель добраться до верха, преодолевая препятствия и собирая примочки. И в этом игра действительно полностью справляется. Нам не обещали невероятно интересного геймплея с квестами, нпс, тянками и прочим, значит, все хорошо.

 -Разнообразность. Я не думаю, что хоть кто-то впервые запустив игру сможет выполнить истинную концовку (если он заинтересован в ней), значит он будет проходить еще раз и вот тут игра показывает себя великолепно! Путей и разнообразия хватает вполне. Перепройти раза 3-4 идя по разным путям можно и тут снова игра нас не разочаровывает!

 -Оптимизация. Думаю сейчас это мало кого волнует, но все же скажу. Оптимизация на высоте и играть даже на деревянном ящике вполне можно.

 -Графика. Здесь она очень даже хороша. В глаза мыло не бросается.

 -Сюжет. Этот пункт спорный, но все же, мне было интересно собирать отчеты и узнавать что-то.

 -Понравилось то, что помимо сюжетной линии, нам предоставили уровни на время, конечно некоторые повторяли обычные из сюжета, но были абсолютно новые и это радует.
P.S. Хотите сразу потренироваться на уровнях на время и гнуть в сюжетке? Хрен вам! Сначала найди в сюжете эти уровни, а потом играй! Ха! :D

Минусы:
 -Относительная легкость. (ЭТО ТОЛЬКО МОЕ МНЕНИЕ И НА ВАШИ СОПЛИ ПО ПОВОДУ ОЙ КАК СЛОЖНО МНЕ ГЛУБОКО НАСРАТЬ) Для меня довольно таки было легко, в первый раз конечно я узнавал все, но потом стало как-то очень просто, проходил всю карту буквально за час, обидненько.

 -Маленькая сюжетная карта. Опытный игрок пройдет игру буквально за пару часов и этого явно мало, сделали бы на 3-4 уровня побольше, но, увы.

 -Цена. Ну как бы сказать, 300 рублей за 10 часов игры это вообще не дело. Единственный вариант - это брать игру по скидке.

 -Отсутствие какого либо онлайна. Да, там есть табличка результатов твоих друзей, но ало, этого явно мало, можно было бы сделать какой-нибудь двойной режим или что-нибудь на скорость, было бы очень даже неплохо, но как всегда, увы.


Подводя итоги, можно сказать, что игру брать однозначно стоит, она тяжеленькая (для большинства), интересная и красивая, скучно точно не будет. Но брать ТОЛЬКО по скидке, 300 рублей это ей не цена!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050504492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1532913234}
review: This is an amateur production. Everything is decidedly unpolished from the controls, to the obtuse level signing, to the difficulty curve randomly hitting walls and dropping off cliffs, to the glitchy level segments, to the way mechanics stumble over each other. It's better than watching paint dry, but your money is better spent elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025760362', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1667, 'last_played': 1651781653}
review:
A brilliant speedrunning FPS/platformer with impeccable level design that can be brutally difficult but is always fair. Once you conquer the learning curve, you will feel godlike as you shoot, blast jump, and dash through non-linear levels that reward lightning reflexes, clever thinking, powers of observation, and a willingness to stray from the beaten path.

Deadcore is pleasing to both the eyes and ears, featuring vast, abstract architecture, gorgeous backdrops, and an ambient but energetic soundtrack perfect to accompany you hunting secrets or shaving seconds off of your time.

The game is short, featuring five "story" levels and an additional thirteen speedrun maps. While this may not seem like much, the "story" maps feature a plethora of routes and secrets that had me returning to them for more. For what it provides, it's well worth the price tag.

Deadcore is not for everybody. Seekers of a complex story may come away disappointed as the game's lore, while interesting, is vague at best and presented through a series of well-hidden log entires. The environment of metal and neon may feel repetitive to some, but the clever level design and speedrun-focus of the game more than make up for it. Finally, you will die. A lot. Especially when you are only starting to scale the learning curve. 

For those up to the challenge, however, the tight controls, speed, and varied movement options will provide a rush that will keep you coming back for more.

review: Wonderfull atmospheric 3d-platformer, the gameplay aswell as the atmosphere are just an incredebile experience giving a certain "rush" to literlly speedrund this game fullfilling you with enjoyment. the game itself may be a bit short but the speedrun aspect makes up for it. i replayd the game many times due to the "rush" and you will get it aswell. the whole leaderboard system giving the game a competive touch will keep you busy perfecting every course to the best. in my opinion a must have for every parcour/plattformer lover especially for the competetive or those who enjoy great atmosphere and challenging parcouring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120194407', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1514200993}
review:
塔の最上階を目指すFPSパルクールゲー
アクションは二段ジャンプやダッシュ  ギミックを起動・停止させる銃など移動する爽快感は非常に高いです
ゲームの難易度は高く僕は何度か画面に向かって口汚い言葉を吐いてしまいました
ただ、難所を突破した際の快感は中毒性が高くリスタートポイントも多く設置されているので もう少し頑張ってみるかぁ...っとついつい続けてしまいます
アクションが苦手な僕でも10時間くらいでなんとかクリアできました
あと個人的にSFチックな塔のデザインがとてもgoodです

author: {'steamid': '76561198089531410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1664382619}
review: Sieht sehr schön aus, hat aber in meinen Augen ein viel zu hoher Frust-Faktor. Viel zu oft hängen die Spünge bzw. deren Gelingen vom Zufall und von try & error ab. Da die Level auch ziemlich tricky sind, kommt leider auch kein echtes Speed-Feeling auf. Schade. Ich hätte mir einen etwas kulanteren Schwierigkeitsgrad gewünscht, damit man deutlich schneller und frustfreier durch die Levels rocken kann. Leider ist auch die Steuerung nicht gänzlich präzise. Dass das besser geht, zeigen Plattformer wie Refunct. Selbst dort kommt mehr Speed-Gefühl auf als hier. Da hilft dann auch die dolle Grafik nicht...

author: {'steamid': '76561198006203421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1541156362}
review:
Хм... эта игра одновременно вызывает бивалентные эмоции... с одной стороны красивая графика и интересные уровни, с другой стороы может и ничего бы, если бы нее приходилось постоянно находиться в движении. Нет времени постоять рассмотреть, насладиться дизайном уровней, убегая от постоянно преследующих лазеров... 

Может просто игра именно мне не зашла. ))

author: {'steamid': '76561198012344899', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1536794889}
review:
Отвратительная игра. Понравились только первые уровни с гравитацией, все остальное кал. Начало слишком простое, конец слишком сложный. Вернее он не сложный, а дроченый. Ты 30 секунд прыгаешь до сложного места по каким-то даунским ловушкам, и каждый раз когда ты дохнешь на сложном, приходится ретраить. Особенно это вымораживает когда идет инверсия. Времени подумать вообще не дают, пропрыгал до следующего микрофрагмента и просто не видишь куда дальше идти и сразу хуякс, получи лазером, тормоз. Мобы тоже чисто для галочки и создают сложность исскуственно, иногда этот пидор встречает тебя прямо на джамп паде, а иногда его вообще нету. 
Ещё очень радует сама механика передвижения. То тебе едва не хватило деша, то одного миллиметра из-за корявого дабл джампа, то ты попадаешь в гравитационную аномалию и крутишься вверх-вниз со скоростью 180об\мин. Эти постоянные недолетания и искуственное замедление темпа убивает весь "спидран".
А как я ахуел когда узнал что в игре снаряд летит куда быстрее чем мы видим, по этому вентиляторы для меня были адом.
Графон очень слабый. Скайбокс выглядит клево, но такое ощущение что это один большой костыль, особенно на последнем уровне. Анимация пушки полное говно, мододелы в л4д2 делают лучше. 
Я хотел поиграть в эту игру ещё с 2015 года, тогда я даже скачал весь ОST и слушал его, в прицнипе слушаю до сих пор. Музыка в игре вообще не заходит, либо она как-то криво работает. Постоянно какой-то эмбиент, до ДнБ дело почти не доходит.

В общем я крайне разочарован в игре, не рекомендую никому
И умоляю, не сравнивайте эту игру с порталом и митбоем, это не нечто среднее, это куча кала.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042545967', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1622244328}
review:
First person platforming. I won't say it's at its finest, but it's one of those "met my expectations exactly" games. It's good, it's worth the money, I'd say it's nothing special except that there are very few decent games in this niche, which is "first-person platformer." Don't confuse that with freerunning games like Mirror's Edge - this controls like an FPS that's been built for platforming. Because that's basically what it is.

It's a weird game. It's worth the money but it won't be life-changing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970396267', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1327, 'last_played': 1531216086}
review:
FPS Platformer in wich you climb a Tower. Pretty simple and damn good. After your first play through you will have unlocked some new abilities that let you rush through the early levels in no time. On top of your Double-Jump you get a Dash, Rocket-Jump and you will be able to change Gravity in specific places. The levels have multiple routes, some are easier some are harder, but you will check them out to unlock extra levels and music for the Speedrun modus. Some of these routes will only be available with the new abilities.

On your first play through I would recommend to ignore time. Also on your second one. Don't let some hard sections (this game has some) stop you. With a bit thinking, YouTube, or later with your new abilities they will be easy.  Make your self familiar with the levels, try new routes, try to find shortcuts, or make them yourself with your Rocket-Jump and Dash. It is pretty interesting that this game is built to be abused and the normal way to go can completely be ignored. When you know where you have to go, the question how to get there has multiple answers. If you liked Mirrors Ede and Portal, I can fully recommend this game. 9,99€ is a steal if you are into these games and like speedruning and trying to get a better time again and again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029929136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1659833459}
review:
DeadCore is a fast-paced FPS platformer.
The objective is to climb the tower as fast a possible, by dashing, double-jumping, and using your switchgun to disable/enable enemies, traps, or boosters. It consists of five levels, increasing in difficulty and length. I found the difficulty ramp to be perfect, I never felt completely at a loss, or bored.
The sci-fi graphics look excellent, and the electronic soundtrack is interactive with how you progress.

I should also mjention that the game is designed to be a speedrun game, so expect a lot of replay value. My first playthrough took me over 4 hours, but I can now do a run in less than 60 minutes.

A very fun and difficult game overall. Definitely pick it up even at normal price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989754266', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1619349333}
review: Great controls, enjoyable mechanics (mostly, wasn't crazy about some of the later levels' abilities), and a nice atmosphere. Secrets can be devilishly hard, but recovering from a bad jump feels hella badass.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985994639', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1530723225}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065111513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1661098654}
review:
do you like speed running, problem solving, and a crazy archaic mysterious atmosphere?  

Deadcore is a game that combines puzzleplatforming with quake-like movement and shooting using a switchgun, which can both activate elements of the environment around you and deactivate enemies that might hinder your progress.  The game formula is simple, reach the top of the tower (5 increasingly difficult stages) through the acquisition of power ups such as a air dash, double jump, blast shot (allowing for rocket jumping) and a gravity toggle, as well as collectibles such as music, gun upgrades, and sparks which both unlock divergent paths to finish the stages.  

Pros:
- Very reasonably priced game
- immensely clever level design that often left me disoriented but always looking for new routes
- the speedrun mechanic once you git gud
- the music (is fantastic)
- sense of mystery and vertigo

Cons:
-relatively short game (3 hrs on first play thru, but eventually got it down to about an hour) but for speedrunning this is a plus for sure|
- it starts INCREDIBLY TOUGH for those unprepared and only gets harder.  The game ONLY gets easier with the few scattered power ups to increase dash counts and ammo as well as your own skill.
- YOU WILL DIE ALOT.  at least in the beginning runs, you should expect 200+ deaths on a first attempt.  On my speedrun attempt after getting all the sparks, I was able to die less than 20 times.
- Some areas might have some framerate issues, so heads up.

Overall, an incredibly fun game.  The game is very fair in the spacing of checkpoints and the multiple paths make it a delightful open-ended experience which constantly surprises me with the secrets it holds.  However, if you are easily frustrated and don't like dying 50x to the same obstacle, candy crush might be better suited for you.  That said, if you enjoyed Portal 1 and 2 and need something a bit harder with a much higher payoff for getting better at the game, then dig in.  It's a wonderful experience for any puzzle-shooter junkie and I couldn't recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985041082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1664471941}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991103051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1529613371}
review:
This is a speedrunning game and nothing more. There is no story, youll get a few different abilities that you can use to speed run. There isnt any puzzles or dialougue to speak of. The athestics dont change ever which means you really better like black metal cubes and rectangles with some glowing blue bits that are placed high in the sky so that the devs dont have to actually design any kind of environment. The path forward looks the same as the path you just came from and all the random towers and will get confusing on more than one occasion.

If you are not into speed running, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!. If you are, then i guess youll like this?

author: {'steamid': '76561198060367518', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9095, 'last_played': 1707680342}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966073256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1528955070}
review:
Game was great until I ran into the unfixed patch at the generators, which closed the way back if you exit the game.
Thus stuck with no way to complete, and a lack of desire to frustratingly learn how rocketjump or fail 500 more times redoing a path I had already taken just so I could sit for 4 hours trying to do the bugged area all in one go so I could get back out.

I just unistalled and put the game into my crappy games folder to rot (right next to dragon age the game that never let me past the start screen, to actually enter the game. At least dead core was a lot better than that). 

Were it not for the un-escapable generator bug. I would have actually recommended the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263134434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1090, 'last_played': 1591327235}
review:
One of the first ever games I got on steam.

A depth defying 3D platformer. The soundtrack is great, the graphics are vibrant, the controles are easy to master and there are limitless playthroughs. As you play, you feel like every second counts but something also forces you to be play each level with caution, thinking that one error could ruin your score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053450274', 'num_games_owned': 2219, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1527290097}
review: This game is simply great. I went in knowing little to nothing about this game and was blown away by the challenge and creative level design. It's tight platforming, but a forgiving respawn system keeps you pushing forward. The only fault is that the color scheme in this game gave me a headache after extended periods so I couldn't play more than 1.5 hours at a time. So far, I'm loving this game and I wish others knew how great it was. I picked it up in a random Humble Bundle, but I honestly strongly recommend this game, even at $10. If you like being rewarded for exploring off the beaten path and for feeling accomplishment after surpassing a challenging platformer section, you will love this game too!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050930643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1526232716}
review: Great FPS Platformer with a hidden story and achievements abound for those who seek them out. Gameplay is fun and the paths you can take are surprisingly not as linear as I thought when I started. Definitely reccomend to all who enjoy platformers and challenging games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291018940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1613862142}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034168703', 'num_games_owned': 3339, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1487681912}
review:
Перед вами некий аналог deathrun. Прыгай себе по платформам на время, кто быстрее тот круче.
Однако не все так просто, в самом начале все лаконично и тривиально, однако чем выше(уровни идут с "дна" на "топ") поднимаетесь тем больше вариантов пройти тот или иной участок, появляются новые зоны, враги, лучи смерти и т.д. иногда даже можно пройти участок не так как задумывал разработчик.

Для тех кто любит вызовы и сложности.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044918225', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1253, 'last_played': 1525039386}
review:
Great game for speedrunning / time trials. Controls are good, there's a lot of room for freedom in the level design, and optimizing your best times just feels good.

As for cons, the enemies can be a bit annoying sometimes. There's a seemingly frame perfect trick that can save you a ton of time, which makes getting perfect time trials feel almost impossible. And finally, the top times on the leaderboards are all cheated.


Those are honestly minor things to me though. Solid recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212346340', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1580271866}
review:
爱他，就给他推荐这个游戏
恨他，就给他推荐这个游戏
这游戏是人玩的吗！
看评论有些人拿这个游戏和传送门比，但是说实话吧……这游戏给我感觉就是一个跑酷游戏，和传送门差很多
解谜部分比较少，基本上就是玩家不停秀(song)操(ren)作(tou)
游戏画面很炫酷，很有科幻感，动作十分流畅，不停爬塔这个设定也让人觉得很帅，地图设计也很强大
不过游戏很多部分明显可以看出缺乏后期优化更新和修BUG，可能是这个项目没有得到足够的重视吧，毕竟从数据上来看销量也不怎么样。这里只能惋惜一下了

author: {'steamid': '76561198010927241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1518841233}
review:
DeadCore is one of those games that you just.  Can't. Put.  Down.

Starting at the bottom of a -very- large tower, your only task is to climb as high as you can.  Sounds simple, doesn't it?

Not really.  Prepare to have your reflexes tested to their limits.

Twitchy jumps, moving platforms, laser gates, timed switches...muscle memory is simultaneously your best friend and your worst enemy.

Every level gets harder...

Good luck.
