author: {'steamid': '76561198055712441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1520441453}
review:
DeadCore ist ein verdammt schlechtes First Person Jump and Run Game mit kleinen Shooter Elementen.

Die Grafik ist aus meiner Sicht grotten schlecht. Also da gibt es schon einiges besseres. Immer die selben Texturen und alles sieht irgend wie so kantig aus. Also überhaupt keine Runden und schönen Texturen. Obwohl ich eigentlich nicht so viel wert lege auf Grafik, aber mein Gott mir taten nach einer Stunde die Augen weh.

Das Gameplay ja was soll man dazu sagen ist einfach nur verdammt schlecht. Hier und da mal bissel von Würfel zu Würfel springen, mit der Waffe einen Schalter abschießen und Fallen ausweichen. Das war es eigentlich schon. Das was mich an diesem Spiel mit am meisten gestört hat, die Steuerung und einfach diese unfairness in diesem Spiel. Es ist gewollt das der Spieler gefühlt 1000x stirbt und es irgend wann schafft. Ich habe es meistens immer nur aus Zufall hinbekommen nach meinem gefühlten 1000x Rage. Außerdem finde ich das die Steuerung einfach mal ausgesetzt hat. Man drückt springen und irgend wie passiert nichts. Es fühlt sich alles einfach schwammig und überhaupt nicht fertig an.

Aus meiner sicht ist DeadCore nicht mal im Sale sein Geld wert. Aufjedenfall die Finger von lassen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128814102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1556392132}
review: Deadcore is a great platformer that combines ambient puzzle solving and fast paced platforming. the controls are responsive, the levels are really tight and allow exploration without cluttering your mind with too many path ways, I will say this though, the game can bring out rage at some of the puzzles but once you complete them you get this sort of feeling like you just climbed a mountain and every other time you go through the levels you feel like you mastered it, hence the speedrunning aspect. Overall This is a really fun game if you want a challenging but fair puzzle platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193163101', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1619130463}
review:
One of the best platformers I've ever played. The movement is fluid, it feels really good. The OST is just amazing, the speedrun music is the sickest Jungle beat music I know. The difficulty curve is really nicely made, it's made in such a way that it maintains synchronized with your skill progress, so you always find the appropiate amount of challenge. The style is the definition of "simple but effective" somehow minimalistic sci-fi desing that does its work perfectly, not overcharged and not excesively minimalistic. The mechanics are solid, rewarding and really well coordinated with the maps so you feel really comfortable with all the levels. The lore is simply magic, really creative and mostly, really well scructured background story.

Nothing more to say, this game is a masterpiece in the 3D platformer world, you HAVE to buy this

author: {'steamid': '76561198134542868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1530576315}
review:
This game is good, but I definitely wouldn't recommend it over something like SEUM. If you're going to play it for collectables and to speedrun it, you'll get a lot out of it, and I would highly recommend it. If not, you'll be playing a fairly short but pretty well designed platformer.

Pros:
- This game realize its potential as a mechanically sound first person platformer.
- The gravity-switching mechanic feels really fun in 3D levels.
- There are a bunch of speedrun levels that I still have not tried.
- The skybox looks quite stunning.
- The game has surprisingly interesting exploration options for what it is.
- There aren't too many game mechanics, but they are used near their full potential.

Cons:
- The game bugged out, and I had to restart the level (though I was near the beginning of it) to continue. The same bug was posted on the forums two years ago, and I suppose nobody did anything about it.
- Even though the gun is a hitscan weapon, it looks like it launches this projectile beam and it gets really confusing. As a whole, it doesn't feel satisfying to use, either.
- Because you can't see your feet, some of the gravity-switched sections become more confusing than they should be. Your hitbox as a whole is really confusing because you have no reference point.
- In the fifth level, there's an enemy that is introduced that can practically one hit kill you almost instantly, and it feels random when you don't know how to deal with it.
- There are a few places that are just plain confusing and easy to get stuck at for a little too long.
- Story? What story?
- If you're not going to try speedrunning this game, it's really short, so a lot of your time will be spent dwelling on some annoying things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047823973', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1604337023}
review:
Deadcore est un jeu développé par une équipe de malades mentaux, qui ont visiblement confondu "challenge" avec "les 9 cercles de l'Enfer". Je joue à Deadcore APRES avoir fait les deux Hotline Miami et avoir joué à Super Meat Boy. Mais alors pourquoi s'acharner sur Deadcore ? Hum : 
- Scénario qui se veut réfléchi mais complètement torché (des logs par-ci par-là, une fin ridicule)
- Difficulté mal dosée : certains chapitres sont à s'arracher les cheveux (coucou le niveau avec la gravité), alors que d'autres passages sont juste... mous. 
- Les checkpoints : il est possible d'en croiser deux à la suite, ou bien de ne jamais en voir alors que le niveau devant vous est très, très, TRES long. 
- Encore la difficulté : attendez. Dans Hotline ou SMB, le tout réside dans un calcul, le fait de finir apr connaître les mécanismes du niveau pour en arriver à bout ? N'ayez crainte, dans Deadcore, tout repose sur la chance ! J'ai fait un screen vidéo pour être sûr de ne pas me tromper, je les ai superposés (logiciel GLMixer) et... Le même parcours, avec un échec pour l'un, une réussite pour l'autre. 

J'ai eu ce jeu en soldes, et je regrette quand même. Allez, je suis sympa, je rajouter des points pour la "bande-son" qui est passable, et l'univers dont le côté SF rend pas mal. Pour ceux qui veulent du vrai challenge et pas juste un test de karma, n'acetez pas ce titre médiocre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173972686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1518713369}
review: 好像游戏没有明确的指示，玩到哪里算哪里的感觉。玩了9分钟也完全不知道自己在干嘛。大概是一个闯关游戏？跳跳跳和距离控制对于我来说有点糟糕，可能我太习惯于传送门一类的动作感，这一款游戏的相应感觉和其他游戏有一定差异，但是画面很好看啊，到处是科幻经典设计和经典配色，很赏心悦目的。还有催吐的附加功能哦，值得入手。再再附加的功能是，帮助你很好地砸掉手柄和键盘，前者时灵时不灵，后者灵不灵不影响我摔回起点，然后再摔回起点，然后再摔回起点……

review:
Deadcore is great game.
First it has great gameplay with a couple of abilities obsicales and  difficulty increases steadily. 
It has a ok story, that could be improved on and had potential for some fantastic lore. 
All the parts of the game can be speed runned and is very fun.
One bug was on the final level if you go the right path you miss the blast ability entirely and it says you  have it but you don't.

Good game for 10 $ wishing there is a second.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021038078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1515980521}
review: A lovely little platformer with a consistent aesthetic and multiple completion paths.  Honestly a big miss when it comes to storytelling, but the gameplay makes up for it.  This will be appropriately challenging for more casual players but very experienced players might only be put to their paces trying to speedrun, and even then I have some doubts after looking at those speedrun times.  Overall a very positive experience, though, easily 8/10 or better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084045404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1569761507}
review: This is a game that doesn't seem to be as well-known as some of the more popular platforming games are. I admit, this game is by no means easy, and it can get a little frustrating at times, but the music, the graphics, and the gameplay itself are good. This is a fun, albeit challenging game to play. Felt the storyline could have been a little better, but I still had a lot of fun playing it. If you're really into platforming games, I'd say this game is definitely worth a try. If nothing else, it is fun, challenging, eye-candy in terms of graphics, and it has a really good ost used throughout the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115854592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1514728803}
review:
Je suis partagé... le jeu est visuellement très réussi, mais la courbe de difficulté est abominable: dès le niveau 3, le jeu se transforme en die and retry, pusique des pièges invisibles depuis certains endroits se révèlent quand vous tombez dedans. Du coup, Deadcore se transforme en un jeu ou l'éxécution des combos au timing parfait devient votre seule priorité, et on perd rapidement l'intérêt porté à l'histoire ou au level design pourtant bien pensé. Je reste donc avec un arrière gout dans la bouche, celui du jeu qui avait du potentiel mais qui m'a rapidement dégouté.

Bon et puis ca ressemble quand meme beaucoup à Portal hein : mécaniques similaires (sauf celles des portails parcequ'il fallait pas que ce soit trop visible), ennemis semblables aux cubes d'aperture,... 

Pas terrible, vraiment, en promo à la rigueur.

Par contre le mode speedrun est appréciable. Si vous voulez runner le jeu, tentez votre chance, mais il y a plus intéressant je trouve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064620279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1514498578}
review:
TL;DR : There is a reason mixing first person and platforming is generally considered a bad idea. You're too concentrated on what's in front of you to both be aware of your environment and see where you're jumping. It can work when it's a secondary aspect of the game or when every little detail has been balanced and polished to perfection. This is not the case here. After an hour, the game was uninstalled. I don't doubt new game mechanics are introduced later on, but I couln't put up with it any more. It just isn't fun.


Visually, while passable, it looks pretty bland. In a game where all the action takes place in the sky, the least you'd expect is a beautifully rendered skybox. Instead you get a static one, cheap medium-res clouds in-between, and no fancy light effects.

Looking at the screenshots, you could think this has some light elements from Magrunner, The Turing Test or Portal in it, but really this is a parkour game. As such, making every element of the environnment easy to "read" should have been a top priority. Yet, it felt esthetically uninspired and artificial to me, but more importantly, hard to read as everything looks so similar and dark.

Let's talk about physics a bit. See that moving platform or that giant rolling cylinder ? Well, you can jump on them, sure, but you'll stay in place while they slide or rotate beneath your feet, leaving you to fall to your death. In this world, friction and Newton's laws are seemingly optional.

The worst part though is performance. For a game like this, you'd expect, and really, NEED silky smooth framerate. Instead you get constant micro-stuttering, no matter which resolution or graphical setting you choose. Even at 60FPS, this feels like a 20FPS experience. After a few minutes, I was starting to get a light migraine.

Have a look at the discussions if you think this is just a case of bad luck on my part. This has nothing to do with bad drivers, and better hardware won't solve anything. That the devs themselves can't see and won't fix this is mind boggling. To add insult to injury, some random guy found a partial fix : https://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/DeadCore#Stuttering
I say partial because while this makes the game playable, I still found that the game felt smoother when forcing 30FPS+Vsync in the options, which says a lot.

Maybe buy Deadcore on a sale if you're really into the speedrun aspect, otherwise I don't see the point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170909729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1537708749}
review: とりあえずストーリーをクリア。収集要素には手を出さず、ステージクリアを目標にしてやってみた感想としては楽しかったの一言。ただ、ギミックうんぬんは気にならなかったが、敵の配置については不満を隠せなかった。一部敵に囲まれどうしようもないだろうと思うようなシーンがあったのがマイナスポイント。それ以外は疾走感があり、上手くできた時がうれしいのでいいとおもった。画面酔いは序盤はしていたが、後々は気にならなかった。重力のところで酔う人は画面がどう動くか予想すれば酔わない・・・かも？

author: {'steamid': '76561198219032331', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1512332754}
review: I don't really get the story, and I'm not sure if there is a lot to understand about it, but the story doesn't really matter. Deadcore has a nice gameplay and fun movement, and that's what it has been made for. The difficulty was also perfect for me. Now you just have to decide whether about 6 hours (just the main campaign, you can do some extra levels and improve your best times as well) is worth 10 euros.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970288930', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1578, 'last_played': 1687843911}

review:
DeadCore ist für mich endlich einmal wieder ein Überraschungstitel. Ähnlich wie in den Puzzleleveln von Trackmania muss man hier aus der Ich Perspektive durch die immer schwieriger werdenden Level hüpfen.

Da bereits das dritte Level sehr herausfordernd ist, bin ich einmal gespannt, ob ich es bis zum letzten Level schaffe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299860870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1628607486}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062270012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1705939016}

author: {'steamid': '76561198227595440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1592932146}
review: Great game if you like solving puzzles and parkour. The game mechanics share some similarities with Portal, although there is basically no story at all in this game (there are logs that you can find and read for backstory)

author: {'steamid': '76561198083135557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1508790152}
review:
Definitely not a bad choice for my first speed runner game. Both of the soundtracks are amazing (one for the main game, mostly atmospheric, the other for the speed run levels, mostly techno). Various abilities and powerups are acquired throughout the duration of the game, each increasing the complexity of gameplay, making for a long, tough grind. Checkpoints minimise the punishment of mistakes, and are laid out fairly far between, giving a noticeable yet bearable level of challenge.

All in all, highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074041475', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1829, 'last_played': 1509971420}
review:
This is a great game, but it will only appeal to a niche audience
Do you like very difficult (but not unplayable) games? 
Do you gain immense satisfaction every time you finish a level just a little bit faster?
Do you like games in which you are continually moving (because standing still means losing time, i.e. WORSE THAN DEATH)?
Then this game might be for you

However, do NOT buy this game expecting a rich story, breathtaking art, complex gameplay, or a casual way to pass the time
If you think you'd get bored of constantly dying over and over in a sometimes-seemingly-impossible platformer with not much reward except a few achievements and a better spot on the rankings, avoid this game

review: It's hard to say. Initially, the game showed a lot of promise and flowed quite well. However, the platforming puzzles towards the end throw too much RNG and cycle-heavy situations at you that end up making the game dull and repetitive. Only get if you like platformers, specifically the first person variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389744843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1680002639}
review: This game is the best game i've played in a long time. To start with, the mystery of the whole game is what really gives it atmosphere. The soundtrack is beautiful, with DnB to Chill. The idea of the logs with the information on what exactly is going on is genius, and the fact that you have to go that extra bit extra to get those logs and the truth was a brilliant idea. And then the sparks. Amazing idea that if you push a bit harder earlier, things will get easier later. I also have really enjoyed speedruns. They really emphasise SPEED. Its always fun to see who is faster and better. And the final touch, the gameplay. Its so diverse, and the atmosphere around it just helps the frustration of failing to feel better, and keep you going. The mechanics are so unfamiliar and yet so easy to catch on to. Overall, I definitely give this a 9.5/10, as it sometimes runs slow. I would also recommend Valley, SEUM: Speedrunners from Hell and A story abput my Uncle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985250097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1495678044}

review: Super feeling für Geschwindigkeit und Höhe. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist herausfordernd, mit zunehmender Erfahrung wird es aber einfacher. Die erste Runde hat bei mir 12h gedauert, jetzt nur noch 1h. Macht einfach Spaß! Gibt einem das Gefühl fliegen zu können.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012203940', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 432, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1509476523}
review: Platform da speedrunner in prima persona, fatto di acrobazie, velocità e riflessi. Gli ambienti enormi e spesso confusionari non aiutano troppo, così come qualche scatto di troppo per un gioco così semplice; tutto sommato però l'unione di vari generi è riuscita.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281657502', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1509286036}
review:
Скажу сразу игра офигенна
Во-первых о да паркур это тема. В этой игре научился распрыжкам для других игр. А так же это топовая разминка для паркур игр и режимов.
Во-вторых есть секретки- разная дополнителяная музыка которую можно найти на локациях и секреты расказывающие об истории этого места(к сожалению я не нашёл всё)
В-третьих по несколько вариантов прохождения одного участка. А тоесть если вы понимаете что не можете проёти его так пойдите по другому пути или же примените смекалку и пройдите этот же путь по другому.
В-чётвертых ещё про пушечку можно сказать, ведь в этой игре вы научитесь точно стрелять находу, налету, а  так же в особо динамичных ситуациях. А здесь таких моментов когда тебе нужно выстрелить в последнюю минуту,чтобы не снизить своё скорость будет много.
Но конечно есть и минусы
1) Иногда либо боты, либо движущиеся предметы могут толкнуть вас внутрь текстур.
2) В пылу бомбёжки из-за сложного момента хочется разбить свой монитор.
Вобщем игра супер. ВСем удачи в прохождении.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041045224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1633542884}
review: I wish I could love this game, I really do; there are so many good things to talk about with it. But the simple fact of the matter is that it runs like garbage. Even on a very high end rig, the constant framerate stuttering makes this game basically impossible for me to play without developing headaches. It has had this problem since launch, and considering that it hasn't been fixed after 3 years, it likely never will be. Cannot recommend, unfortunately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077718707', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1463781873}
review: Интересный концепт, родившийся в ходе какого-то там семидневного хакатона, и которому можно было оттуда и не выбираться. Ну, выбрался - и хрен с ним. Играбелен более чем, временами испытывает на прочность. И красив, да, только вот декорации и, эм, сеттинг, нагоняют смертную тоску. Пусто и бесцельно тут всё. В нескончаемом геометрическом бреду средь облаков уж очень одиноко.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059627741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1509155644}
review:
Even though the controls, overall, feel smooth, it's impossible to platform when you can't see your feet. Your fast movement speed, which is obviously there to increase the sense of flow, more often ruins the flow when you over-compensate on a jump and walk right off a ledge. The combat makes it even worse, as you're trying to move quickly to avoid being shot.
Also, the game is poorly optimized. I don't have the most powerful computer in the world, I'll admit, but it can run way more visually impressive games than this with no problem. Even at the literal lowest graphics settings, there's still a slight input lag on button presses, which makes the platforming even worse than it already is.
There are parts of this game that I like, such as the use of musical audio cues - as well as the sound design overall - and the unique visual aesthetic, but, unless you have a beefy computer and you like platforming in first person, I can't recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041986283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1508966215}
review: Good game, Good graphics, Good soundtrack, worth it...it's easy at the beginning but after an hour or so, going through the levels takes some skill

author: {'steamid': '76561198038778490', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1552347363}
review:
I'll be honest, I really wish more game devs would make games in this style, vague, airy, and mystic sci-fi-like. The gameplay is challenging but rewarding. Is it hard, yes, quite, but you never feel overwhelmed. It's a game that has excellent difficulty scalling throughout it's levels and has a good incentive for replay if you want to collect all the extras scattered around all the levels, although one that can be said is that looking for said extras can be a bit of a drab, as if you go one checkpoint too far there's a good chance you'll have to restart the level in order to collect the item, as the game has a clever way of not letting backtrack past certain checkpoints. This game also catters to speedrunners, if you're into that. It has a dedicated speedrun mode for those who enjoying blitzing through levels, I personally don't care too much for speedrunning, but the game has a few speedrun-only levels for those wanting to practice thier movement and set good times. My only complaint with the game is that it's a bit too short, each level is around an hour or so, and there only about four or five levels, so make of that as you will.

All in all, Deadcore is an excellent game, if challenging, that you'll probably quite fun and challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117341644', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1555873111}

author: {'steamid': '76561198033488663', 'num_games_owned': 717, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1674834094}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067591718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1571242435}
review:
J'ai jamais trop joué aux jeux de plateformes et je n'aime pas du tout les die&retry, je ne sais pas vraiment ce qui m'a poussé à acheter ce jeux, surement son petit prix pendant une période où je ne savais pas à quoi jouer.

Mais finalement je ne regrette absolument pas ! J'ai surkiffé ce jeu !!!

Ces sensations... du pur bonheur ! Dès que le dash est débloqué le jeu part sur un gameplay trés rapide, trés nerveux et surtout trés fluide. 
Le plus gros point fort pour moi est le lvl design maitrisé de bout en bout avec plusieurs niveaux de lecture et une monté de la dificulté bien gérée. On reconnaît d'un coup d'oeil tout ce qui est suceptible de vous désintégrer, les élements à activer, les checkpoints, les élements de décors, etc. Si au départ le jeu ressemblera à un plateformer "classique", trés vite le choix d'avoir une vue FPS prends tout son intérêt et offre un gameplay trés riche qui exploite bien l'espace avec des mecaniques de controle aérien ou de changement de gravité. Le jeu ce transformerais presque en puzzlegame par moment ^^

Observer son environnement sera trés important. Assez régulieremnt pendant votre ascension vous aurez le choix entre deux chemins, à vous de choisir celui qui vous semble le plus simple (ou le plus rapide ;) ). Vous trouverez aussi des collectables tout au long des 5 niveaux, ça sera des musiques, des logs (morceaux d'histoire), des boosts pour vos capacités ou le plus intérressant, des "Sparks" (2 par niveau) qui vous dévoilerons un chemin bien plus rapide pour arriver en haut mais aussi bien plus compliqué ! 

Si les graphisme ne sont pas fabuleux (bien que tout à fait correct, surtout pour un jeu semi-indé) la DA, elle, est sublime avec une mention spéciale aux éclairages.

Monter au sommet de la tour une première fois devrait vous prendre entre 5 et 8 heures selon votre niveau, c'est peu mais c'est à ce moment la que le jeu commence vraiment, en effet dès que vous finissez un cycle, vous pouvez en recommencer un autre en gardant toutes les capacités et les sparks débloqués et pu***n comme c'est juissif de refaire en moins d'une heure ce qu'on à fais en 6 ou alors de le refaire tranquillement en cherchant tous les collectables !

Ajouter à cela un mode speedrun où vous pourrez refaire séparement chaque niveau pour essayer de vous hissez dans dans les scores mondiaux. Mode dans lequel vous trouverez de nouvelle map débloqué en trouvant les fameux sparks. 
Au final on se retrouve avec une durée de vie tout à fais respectable surtout vu le petit prix du jeu.

Par contre, un scénario quasi-inexistant. Pour ce genre de jeu ce n'est pas important, mais c'est à souligner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142489660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1506542758}
review:
Is unbelievable how good this game is. The challenge is present at all times, but it never gets annoying and always demands the player to know how to use all the abilities learned (different from a lot of platformers that give a ability that you use once or twice and even forget it exists).

I really like how every new power-up is incorporated through the levels, and I particularly loved the gravity one.

If you like a good challenge and platforming, you can't go wrong with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962136607', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1506301670}
review:
This game does a very good job of giving the open world illusion in a 3d puzzle game. The different paths feel interesting and rewarding instead of other choices in games that are there for the sake of choice. The ways the player can maintain momentum as he bounces and dashes around is truly amazing, letting long strings of jumps, dashes and falls feel very rewarding. The difficulty curve is just right, constantly rewarding the player for the next obstacle course well done. 

This is what sonic in 3d should have felt like; bouncing and shooting around as you traverse an interesting world in feats of skill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350285753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1528594749}
review:
Beğendim.
Oyun çok hoş özellikle atmosferi.Oyun bir sppedrun oyunu.Birazcık teknolojik bir görünümü var.Oyuna ilk olarak storyden yani hikayeden başlıyorsunuz.Bir silahımız var.Bu silahla çeşitli noktalardan geçis noktaları açabiliyoruz.
Uzun süre oynandığında bağımlılık yapabilecek bir oyıun.Beğendim açıkçası.
Her pazartesileri steamde belirli indirimler oluyor,bu oyunu rastgele indirime girdiği zamanda denk gelip aldım.İndirime girdiğinde alınabilecek bir oyun.Ama indirimde almanızı öneririm ben 18 lira değer mi bilemiyorum.

Genel olarak güzel,oynattırır kendini yani.Radarınıza alabilirsiniz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013981607', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1506165533}
review:
I recommend this game a lot.
+ good ambientish soundtrack, really matches this aerial, desolate landscape
+ great visuals, the skyboxes arent 360p like in most games
+ responsive controls
+ has replayability, if you aim for that (I'm not the kind of person who plays a game many times to max it out, so dont look at my hours, i skipped many Sparks which make the levels a lot bigger)

- the Sparks are too hidden, i think i would have to waste a lot time exploring the levels i already know just to find the new ones. i know its about exploring, but they should be at least visible to the player sometimes

author: {'steamid': '76561198041251876', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1663460002}
review:
Un jeu comme l'on en voit plus, avec un esrpti et une âme "à l'ancienne" qui veut et pronne le dépassement de soit !!! Et quelle  jouissance de revenir aux premiers niveaux avec les aptitudes et abilités gagnées aux suivants !
J'écris rarement des commentaires, d'ailleur c'est mon premier , mais je dois le faire l'honneur des heures passées dessus.
Un graphisme ayant l'air minimaliste, mais les textures et shaders soignés, donnent libre court à une fluidité nécessaire pour et une FPS maximale pour la vitesse requise à l'accomplissement des missions les plus ardues, sur les plateformes les plus modestes aussi !
Tout ce que je regrette est d'avoir fini le mode histoire aussi vite... Malgré cela, reste le mode speedrun et toutes les autres maps à débloquer ... tout simplement génial !
(P.S. : j'ai juste mis la musique au minimum pour faire jouer ma propre playlist ;=) )

author: {'steamid': '76561198261369442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1506074411}
review:
我必须得说，这是一个相当惊艳的游戏！
尽管我玩了不到一个小时，就来写这篇测评，但它的确给我带来了前所未有的体验！
还记得，在玩蹦极、过山车那些极限项目时的心态吗？
“哦，千万不要掉下去了！ε＝ε＝ε＝(#>д<)ﾉ”
但与众不同的是，这个游戏留下了“怦然心动”或者是“小鹿乱撞”的心理体验，却让游戏的画面、音乐，特效等场景，替代了许多恐惧元素，而带来了前所未有的惊喜与怦动交加的体验
就好像，见goddes前：尽管知道或不知道 可能{一无所获}/{有戏}的情况下，却仍然带着喜悦与勇气去面对时的感动。
又或者，稀饭的女孩，就在旁边的感觉？
卧槽！这游戏还玩出了恋爱的味道？？喵？

嗯，想起来了，那个名词叫“忐忑”再加上”欢喜“，喵~

反正，17块钱绝逼值了，如果我之前玩过，卖7-80或者上百我都乐意。
真的是，前所未见的心理体验。重点是，这种体验居然在一个游戏上呈现了


妙哉！O(∩_∩)O~

author: {'steamid': '76561198168413084', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1507253766}
review: Saw this one when browsing around steam one day and threw it on my wishlist. It just so happened to go on sale last week for 75% off so for $2.50. It reminded me of a platforming portal-esque game (and I love portal) so for $2.50 it was a no brainer. Pretty challenging but not in a rage inducing way but I was having fun with it for about 2 hours until they threw in gravity switching. For me this game mechanic just ruined the entire experience. In my opinion I think it was an unecessary addition to an already challenging game. Throwing the gravity switching in to the mix left me disoriented and unsure of what to do next. This would be almost bearable but, of course, the gravity is on a timer which makes things even worse. I know a lot of people didn't mind this gameplay element but it ruined the game for me. That said I can't not recommend it, especially if you can get it on sale. Just be aware that this mechanic may throw you off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198374795007', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1634741805}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032895244', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1512266350}
review:
Ich hatte das Spiel vor Ewigkeiten mal in einem Video gesehen und dann vergessen wie es hieß und daher nicht mehr wieder gefunden.
Durch einen Zufall bin ich dann vor ein paar Tagen wieder darauf gestoßen und habe es mir gekauft.
Der Anfang vom Spiel erklärt die Spielmechanik und Steuerung ganz gut, so das man schon schnell einfindet.
Später nimmt das Spiel dann aber derart an Schwierigkeit zu, dass es auf einem dauerhaften Trial & Error hinaus läuft.
Es gibt Passagen in dem Spiel wo man sich nach dem 100. Versuch fragt, wie man das schaffen soll.
Bleibt man Hartnäckig und schafft es dann tatsächlich, kann man es oft selbst kaum glauben und freut sich darüber, nur um dann vor der nächsten schier unlösbaren Aufgabe zu stehen.

Auf diesen Faktor baut das Spiel, ähnlich wie Portal und Portal 2, auf.. allerdings mit einer ganz anderen Spielmechanik.
Mir gefällt Deadcore und auch wenn es mir manchmal den letzten Nerv raubt, nach dem Rage Quit starte ich es irgendwann doch wieder um es nochmal zu probieren. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198091607145', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1570472844}
review: Тебя матерят за то ,что ты прыгаешь как придурок в кс и других играх? Тогда эта игра для тебя! Крайне атмосферная игра,которую приятно проходить залпом,соревнуясь в скорости с соником под спидами. Но игра бы не была столь привлекательна ,если бы не то чувство ,когда останавливаешься и оглядываешь мир,который отдает футуристичной мрачностью и необратимой бесконечностью.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1505758145}
review:
Отличная игра! Трухардкорный спидран! Напомнила мне времена, когда я задра чивал в мод к Q3 - defrag. (хотя deadcore и не такая ураганная с первого взгляда)
Очень стильная. Есть что-то общее с трэкманией - такой же безумный дизайн уровней, когда ты не понимаешь, а где здесь выход-то? :D 
Для любителей игр на скорость - defrag, trackmania - рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040191853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1682881172}
review:
This one is unique. The closest game I could compare it to is Portal, yet it's still so different. This is more of a fast paced obstacle course involving a gun that activates switches and deactivates enemies for a few seconds. There isn't much a story, but the gameplay, visuals, sound, and music is where the game truly shines. I always appreciate a good story, but it isn't always necessary to me. Now here's the real warning: THIS GAME IS DIFFICULT! Not quite at the tier of Dark Souls, but I guarantee you'll get stuck often in the later levels. Hidden throughout the story levels, they have music tracks; logs, which contain lore; power upgrades; and sparks, which unlock speedrun levels and the game's real ending. It reminds me of Doom's secrets, and it feels so good to discover them.

Now for some cons:

-Not the best performance in 1440p or 1080p even with all of the graphic settings on low in The Void (level 3) and The Storm (level 4). This is with a GTX 970 FTW+, i7 2600k and 16 GB RAM. (I've noticed a developer say in forums that they built this game with 30 FPS in mind. That's really not a good idea. Most PC gamers want 60 FPS. If we wanted 30, we would go buy consoles.)
-Rarely when loading a saved game, my character is stuck in the ground. A simple respawn fixes it.
-When I try to exit the game, the background of the title screen remains and it never ends. I have to alt-tab and then close it outside of the game.
-Some shadows flicker when facing nearly any direction.

If you aren't afraid of difficulty, then get it. It's cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024872471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1503499349}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042309430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1501224637}
review: From the time I spent on this, its good and responsive. Good starting point for people new to "speedrunning." I like the tools available, forcing you to think of different routes each time you fail.  A little slow for my tastes, kind of like portal, but still challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129675900', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1596306109}
review:
This game is a nice challenge for both casual and hardcore gamers. The game revolves completely around movement anywhere from gravity to speed. The controls feel responsive, which is very good because some quick reactions will save your life very frequently. You will die in this game, several times. But, when you do, you feel like its your fault. Its very easy to learn what you did wrong and figure out what to do to complete a puzzle. The puzzles arent overly challenging, at least not to me. This game was designed well enough so that if youre not meant to go somewhere, you can't. There is a lot of replayability in this in the form of collectables like powerups and lore. The story isnt necessary but it certainly livens up the universe significantly. Thanks to this games mechanics, it makes a great speedrunning game, with built in support for recording times and comparing them.

If youre someone who likes medium to fast paced games, this game is a great buy. Especially for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103880458', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 2380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1618083627}
review:
Haven't seen any platformer that's so lenient with letting you choose your own paths. To everyone saying the level design is counter intuitive and whatever, you clearly haven't played the game enough to see where you can and can't go. As soon as you get the "rocket" jump, you can basically skip major portions of every level as long as you know what you're doing.
The first runs are frustrating because you haven't understood you shouldn't be taking the path they put in front of you at all times.
The 1 hour "devtime" for the main levels from start to finish is rather misleading. There's most likely no way you'll beat that on your first run, as you don't know the levels and mechanics, but once you do, it becomes a joke that they set it so high.
Movements can take time to get used to, and the laser hitboxes are plain wrong for whatever reason(though the issue is probably with the character hitbox instead), but they can be skipped like 80% of the time anyway.
The game has a built in framerate cap, even if you disable vsync and everything, I'm pretty sure there's literally no way you'll get it to go past 45fps, even when the fps counter says otherwise. This was probably done because of how bugs with the physics, which are already bugged with the limited framerate.
The only issue with enemies, that can still be avoided with enough practice, comes up when they stay behind corners and push you off the map as soon as you turn them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993565027', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1503091009}
review:
Starts off very strong. Difficult, yes, but with a certain flow that makes everything feel natural.
Then it throws in gravity switching.
This would be fine, except it seems all manner of flow just got tossed out the window, as things become confusing, and scattered. You're confused, unable to orient yourself, and that lovely feeling of "Let's just go with it and see what happens" is shattered. I believe that was intentional design wise, due to the are you're in also changing to a dark and stormy sky. It jsut feels clustered, the entire game has WAY to much going on in it, and just overstimulates me. 

TL;DR 
Starts great, goes bad

author: {'steamid': '76561198405451734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1618456614}
review:
-Argumento: se detalla mediante registros ("logs") que iremos consiguiendo mientras jugamos. Si bien no está del todo profundizado, en lo personal me atrajo bastante y logró que mi curiosidad se mantenga hasta el final del juego.
-Jugabilidad: para mi gusto lo mejor del juego. El movimiento es muy preciso. No poseemos armas, pero sí un dispositivo que nos permite alterar el espacio para abrir caminos, a la vez que podemos utilizarlo para inhabilitar a los robots de seguridad. 
-Gráficos y Sonido: ambos son geniales. Visualmente es muy bello; ambiente futurista, al estilo ciencia ficción, y sobre todo para nada estático, lo cual da una sensación de inmersión grata. En cuanto al sonido, efectos sonoros que van bien, y la banda sonora acompaña, y en ciertos puntos logra motivarte a completar los desafíos que el juego presenta.
-Dificultad: DeadCore es bastante Hardcore (ja, ja), puedes llegar a estar una hora intentando pasar un nivel por lo difícil que puede llegar a ponerse. Para mí es un punto a favor, puesto que los juegos de hoy en día son demasiado fáciles.

Por otro lado, puedo decir que el modo campaña puede llegar a hacerse corto si logras tomarle la mano al juego rápidamente. Además, como dije antes, el argumento no está bien profundizado, dejándonos con ganas de entender bien qué está ocurriendo, y por qué.

¡Saludos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026235172', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1581, 'last_played': 1608457434}

Jump, dash, die, restart, try again and be better.

If you finished the game, try it again and try to find much faster ways. Example: Stage one first try 20 Minutes, now in lower than 4 Minutes.

Great game with some challenges.

Don't expect Portal, because it's no Portal. It's a classic Jump and run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002435370', 'num_games_owned': 1306, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1698, 'last_played': 1500908028}

author: {'steamid': '76561198107907040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1500365064}
review:
Deadcore is a speed-running-oriented parkour game that can be fun and beautiful, but also finnicky and painfully hard at times.

Pros:
The controls are pretty tight; you can maneuver a lot in mid-air, and it feels great to go fast.
The scenery is beautiful. Up in the skies with abstract towers and cubes
Lots of hidden collectables like logs and songs
The gun is unique. In addition to stunning enemies it's also used to activate switches and jump-pads, and deactivate certain obsticals
The gun has a timer on it so you can tell how good you're doing on a speedrun
They put a surprisingly large emphasis on exploration and choosing your own path. If a set of obstacles is giving you trouble there might be another way you can go

Cons:
It still has its glitches. I didn't have problems with movement stuttering but some do
Sometimes you'll be on the inside of a big rotating cylinder and it'll eat your jump
A few things feel just a bit too precise (in particular there will be tunnels with lasers along the top and bottom that you have to dash through, and you have very little wiggle-room for when you time your dash as to not be too high or too low)
Some of the gimmicks are a bit... gimmicky. Gravity switching in particular felt like it added very little for how disorienting it was, especially when you clip the edge of a gravity zone and get flipped, only to fall right back out anyway, ending up dead AND queasy

In general the difficulty ramp is pretty extreme, starting about when you get the dash ability. You can do A LOT with it, but they very quickly expect you to do a lot of crazy things now that you have the main tool.

All in all I'd say it's worth the 10 dollars, especially if you're into speedrunning or challenging games. Those of you wanting a more reasonable experience are likely better off with mirrors edge or portal (both of which are also good for speedrunning)

author: {'steamid': '76561198102837141', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1632393360}
review:
1小时56分26秒通关
然后发现正版看不了塔顶风景，直接黑屏了，重开游戏存档消失了。
盗版却可以成功的
一次轮回只能看一次啊
我为了录制一遍塔顶风景的计划在正版上失败了
想来想去，还是决定给差评
真的很抱歉
毕竟谁都不想如此
9/10

2017.7.12
------------------------------------------------------------
2019年3月更新

差评更为好评

在游玩DOOM毁灭战士300h后，我成功在1h之内打完了故事模式，顺便把额外的星火跑道也全部解锁通关了。

登上的塔顶，
那一刻...
真的太美了！

工作室很小，好像只有5，6个人吧，很喜欢这款游戏，期待续作，虽然感觉也不可能有续作的可能。
另外剧情很有后现代的味道，真结局主角通升上天空宇宙里....他看到的究竟是什么？
我总是想起终末少女旅行这部番剧，到头主角们什么都没有得到看到，只有空无...

其实根本就没有什么乌托邦和弥赛亚，
到头来只有拉康所言的“主体的空无”....

不好意思...话多了就搞这种过度解释了，总之我真的喜欢这款游戏。
以上。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041177606', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1626115032}

author: {'steamid': '76561198361380121', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1598662908}

author: {'steamid': '76561198280350906', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1502587059}
review: Overall, I like DeadCore.  I would give this game a 9/10.  When this game was originally descried to me, I was told that it was a mix of Portal and Mirror's Edge.  This game really is a bit more than that.  There is lots of neat stuff you can do in the game, it really looks great.  As I was playing through, I noticed the difficulty really ramped up quite fast.  I enjoyed the feeling I got through most other puzzle games that I have played, the feeling of acomplishment each time I passed an area, and I enjoy becoming more skilled after each attempt.  This is a really fun experience and, trust me on this, if you want to get into speedrunning, I would reccomend this game, as it is quite the challenge in the begining to play through it, but it is also just as fun to start another run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100744280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1499407266}
review:
诚然整个游戏给我一部科技感，科幻片的感觉。

可惜这只是一款跑酷游戏，个人感觉游戏模式跟refunct差不多，都是踩砖块，唯一不同这款画面好一些，挑战娱乐性也更高一些。

貌似可以自由选择线路，但我可能不适合玩这一类游戏吧

首先头晕的不行，其次方向操作感不好，老感觉地板滑。。前期没有任何指往哪里走，不过这无所谓，多摸索就好了。

摔死了还特有缓缓降落的感觉，然后喷一屏幕老血，吓尿了有没有？

唯一亮点就是可以站在存档点，一动不动看他自动一直跳，蹦极的感觉有没有？

总之，偶尔玩玩还行，头晕患者，路痴患者，恐高患者，手残患者慎入！

author: {'steamid': '76561198068096048', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1499313655}
review:
FPS is fine but there's a tiny stutter in movement that gave me a headache within the first hour. I'm finding lots of reports on this on internets but it hasn't been fixed in 3 years, so I guess it never will be.

It's a shame. This seems like a great game otherwise. First 2 levels had some great design and the physics felt fine... FWIW. If you're used to playing on 30 FPS or something, it might be playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014408138', 'num_games_owned': 938, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1499173975}
review: The game is a little over 2 hours(the first time through) and it's difficulty isn't set in stone, there is always something you can do to make an obstacle easier, for example you can try to make short dashes through a tunnel in rapid succesion, with every dash needing to be perfect or take about 5 times as long and use a long dash that requires little precision and is very safe. Of course, you won't really care the first time thru, but the real point of the game is to go back, gather collectibles, learn about the Tower and keep beating your last time record.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271796918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1560370334}
review:
This is not your typical parkour game. The whole game is basically one giant level, with lots of checkpoints of course. Even near the top of the tower you can still see the bottom where you started. It's also amazing how they threw some story in there, giving you something to look for. It's also funny how this game gets harder as you go along, but I've returned to early levels and they're still pretty hard. That's probably just me being a scrub though.

Graphics: 10/10
Like I said it's pretty cool how the while game is one level, and if your computer is powerful enough you'll see that the textures are very detailed.

Story: 7.5/10 (10/10 compared to other parlour games)
While the game isn't very story driven, it's a nice touch to an otherwise mysteriously unexplained game.

Difficulty: 9.5/10
This game might be easy for some, but I've had my good amount of frustration and joy of finally getting it right.

Overall: 9.75/10
DeadCore is an above average parkour game, and if you're new to parkour games, DeadCore is a good place to start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075772718', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1499077187}

author: {'steamid': '76561198108552549', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1417885188}

author: {'steamid': '76561198206884055', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1696136369}
review:
DeadCore...What a game! It's about using a gun to activate switches and deactivate enemies to progress as you platform up a huge tower. The story is told through collectibles and it's quite satisfying to jump between platforms. It has a pretty nice speedrun mode too.

The only downside is that the Steam overlay doesn’t seem to work for me, but as no else has any guides on how to fix it, it might just be a problem on my end.

Be warned though, as it (can) be an extremely hard game. The checkpoints...work, but you basically need to learn how to speedrun each section of each level to do it right, and the timing required is often quite awful.

However, if you like irritatingly precise platforming and mouse aiming, restarting 1000 times and very pretty ambience and graphics, it's a very wise purchase. Be prepared to rage quit. A lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000402354', 'num_games_owned': 1050, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1498914210}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123294043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1560522541}

author: {'steamid': '76561198241468108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1698539877}
review:
The first few try's are a guaranty fail on so many levels that the direction is either straight forward enough, multiple upon multiple options that are all about near perfect timing or not very clear how you are supposed to proceed that once you finish a level you look at your total time in utter disgust and have to play some FPS to cool off a bit. Coming back to have a proper go of it you play around with the double jump off the sides of cubes to double jump again and attempt to get the timing down to at least under 4 tries. 
Over all, the music tempo kinda throws off your critical timing a bit but the graphics are really what sell the game in my book. Just started getting to the other levels but know it’s going to be an interesting struggle to keep looking at that blasted total time and think… ya I know I do better but is it really worth it-

author: {'steamid': '76561198194986326', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1525896733}
review: This game starts as being extremely fun and very nice to look at. Paired alongside some tight controls, difficult platforming, and a good soundtrack, I was really excited about what the game had to offer. However, soon the beautiful clear blue skies disappeared and were replaced with dull, dark skies and the platforming became a chore as they shifted from being fun, straightforward, and challenging but rewarding, to gimmicky gravity change mechanics that were at times confusing and always unfun. Also, while the activate gun is a nice touch, I kept trying to reload it by accident and then I'd hit the key mapped to teleport you back to your last checkpoint, an annoying inconvenience if you've just cleared a difficult section.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067158592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1677853080}
review: 作为萌新，一开始不停的死，还不懂收集星火，通关了一次发现又要重来[spoiler]不收集星火你看不到结局就会从辛辛苦苦爬上来的塔上掉下去[/spoiler]。第二次尝试收集却始终找不全，在别人的视频帮助下才找齐。第三次就开始尝试时间挑战，死了更多次，并且把各种能力都升满级了。很有意思的跑酷游戏，当然，喜欢这一类不停死不停跑的游戏的的人还可以去试试另一种风格的super meat boy。[spoiler]时间是假的，刚入正[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198102007954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1496159242}
review:
Rants first:
- Control's a bit flimsy, but I think this is how the game was designed.
- I sometimes can't double jump.
- Fun at first, until the game suddenly think you can jump a mile high.

The good ones:
- Multiple ways finish a level.
- Not a demanding game, so a potato pc can run this.

Fun factor:
- You'll rage. 99.99% of your time.
- You'll die. A lot.
- It is like the Ashen one decides he can parkour and use a weird gun.

10/10 will rage again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040842672', 'num_games_owned': 3000, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1495659087}
review:
DeadCore is a first person platformer with focus on extreme speeds. You jump, dash and shoot your way through futuristic levels.

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
The game has very solid art direction and the visuals look quite nice on the technical level too. There's some slight LOD popping, but overall this is not too distracting. The game could have used some more visual variety, however. As it is, all the levels look quite similar.

[h1]Audio[/h1]
The sound effects and the music get the job done, but neither is particularly memorable.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The high speed precision platforming is clearly the main focus here and it is certainly well implemented. You can double jump and dash through the levels at insane speeds and when you pull this off the game can be incredibly satisfying.

As you progress through the levels the game adds a few new powers and obstacles to the mix but these don't really change the core gameplay much. There are also some basic shooter elements but personally I felt that this aspect was rather poorly done. The few enemies you encounter aren't particularly interesting and frankly I would have preferred the game without them.

Level design is weirdly inconsistent. Some levels are well done with multiple paths through them. Unfortunately there are also sections that rely heavily on trial and error, especially in the last two levels. This problem is exacerbated by the poor placement of some checkpoints.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]
DeadCore is a fairly challenging game and there are no difficulty settings.

[h1]Controls[/h1]
The controls are pretty tight and responsive with mouse + keyboard.

[h1]Story and Writing[/h1]
The story is purely optional (hidden away in data logs) and not particularly interesting or well-written.

[h1]Bugs and Glitches[/h1]
Overall the game was quite polished and bug free. I did get stuck on scenery a few times and one of the map hazards stopped working completely after a while.

[h1]Final Verdict[/h1]
I had fairly mixed feelings about DeadCore. The game has a strong visual style and it's quite satisfying when you finally complete a difficult section. On the other hand the level design has some issues and the storyline is rather weak. I'd still recommend the game, just be prepared for a fairly frustrating experience if you are not very good with precise first person platforming.

I played through the story mode and this took me around 6 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105144358', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1593440091}
review: A game designed for twitchy speedrunning gaming gods. Not really my cup of tea but the visual style and the sound kept me playing until I reached the tower's summit. Such a pity that I cannot return to the summit as a reward. Nope, can't enjoy the view on the summit because I'm expected to relive the nightmare of the rest of the game all over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044215397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1612613397}
review:
Admittedly I have only played 3 levels so far (I'll update my review once I've finished the game), but I am very impressed so far!
I'm having a ton of fun, the levels are nicely designed, offering 2 paths whenever one mechanic pops up that I'm not that big a FAN of (see what i did there?). Progress is earned, and even the shortcuts you can take that make you feel sooo smart never seem like cheating because you figure that's the intended speedrun route and the regular path is for [  ]s.

I can already see the replay value and took notice of some now accessible stuff, so I really want to revisit everything again soon enough!

Great game, such a positive surprise from Bandai Namco!

Also: yes, the game is not for people who quit after dying a few times. It is for the people who enjoy watching themselves develop and showcase badass skills.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996356906', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1650626278}
review:
This is not a game, it's a lifestyle choice.

I've never failed so badly and so often whilst feeling so invigorated.

After 2 hours of play I still haven't completed level 2, but my time for Level 1 has dropped from 20 minutes to 7 after 4 tries.

Usually you can see what you need to do, but doing it is another thing. OTOH, sometimes you really need to think about what you are doing. You can take it slow for some of the game, so don't feel time pressure, OTOH some puzzles require you to move quickly.

And when you finally figure it out, go back and get a better time.

Fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079719282', 'num_games_owned': 1355, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1494761908}

[b]CONCLUSION[/b]: A bit hardcore but could be beaten by any average player . Devs have successfully executed this immersion into this astonishing lanscape and myth! Easy to handle , hard to master, the game worths any cents in my humble opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036733970', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2069, 'last_played': 1664491580}
review:
TL;DR: DarkSouls the platformer.

I'll put the most important point first: THIS IS A HARDCORE PLATFORMER/ SPEED RUN GAME. IF YOU DON'T LIKE THE IDEA OF FLYING THROUGH DEATHTRAPS AT A BREAKNECK PACE, YOU PROBABLY WON'T ENJOY THE GAME.

For those of you still reading: Deadcore bases its gameplay around high speed platforming over a bottomless void. There are things that will try to push you to your death, there are things that will try to push you into laser grids, there are things that will try to flat out murder you. 

Your weapon is a switch gun, which can deactivate enemies and activate objects in the environment. While it is entirely possible to take this game slowly and explore (there are rewards for exploration, in the form of lore, soundtrack and upgrade unlocks) the main goal is to find the fastest way to the exit possible.
To this end, all the levels have unlockable alternate paths that offer faster (and harder) routes to the finish line, giving a high degree of replayability. There is also a series of bonus challenges for when you complete the story.

Basic gameplay consists of running, jumping, shooting stuff to switch it on or off (enemies, jump pads, laser grids, gravity fields etc.). All these elements are brought together smoothly, and while there isn't always a direct explanation for what every new feature does they're quickly demonstrated through level design.

The art design is very thematic, and frankly somewhat bland- there isn't much variation (the main levels have general themes in terms of lighting and sense of space but no other distinguishing visual traits), but in all it helps build an air of focus to the world- this is a world designed to be viewed at very high speed, not strolled through. 

The sound design is somewhat mediocre; while some of the music is enjoyable, I found most tracks to be rather dull and uninspired. Atmospherically the game is very quiet, beyond the whoosh of air passing by or the sounds of enemies there isn't much in the way of ambience, although I personally liked this.

Overall, this game offers a focused, challenging experience that will reward those who respect and appreciate it, and cause those that don't to write angry steam reviews about how hard it is abloo bloo bloo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159200158', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1703785169}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032107167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1554925698}
review:
After trying this for several minutes and getting stuck on only the THIRD level in the game. I have to say that I simply cannot recommend this game to anyone that isn't a god.

#1 This is NOT a game for players with hundreds of hours of video game playing experience.

#2This is NOT a game for players with hundreds of houts of speedrunning experience.

#3 This IS a game for players that enjoy ridiculously hard challenges with the only true goal being to get the fastest time possible.

I Love speedrunning games, playing through games like Sonic Adventure, Jet Set Radio, Mario 64, Mirrors Edge, and more. Yet even I, with hundreds of hours of experience (See number 1) cannot even complete the THIRD level in this game. After a half an hour, I gave up.

What frustrates me the most isn't necessarily the concept, I was fully behind that. No, the biggest problem with this game is the way the game makes things challenging.

The hitbox on your character is too big and hitboxes on targets are too small and sometimes seem to simply not register. This problem is exagerated by the fact that you cannot see either your character or your drop shadow. Honestly, this game would be much better as an OTS-3PS (Over-The-Shoulder Third Person Shooter) where you could see your character and surroundings more clearly and could more accurately make positional judgements.

Also, just to elaborate on how this game's challenge compares to other games:

There are two types of challenge in video games. One of these is exemplified by Super Meat Boy, where the levels contain a myriad of obstacles and one hit kills you instantly. Yet, Its short bursts of challenge and creative design choices keep you engaged for hours. This is "Tough but Fair" which is what difficult video games SHOULD be.

The other type of challenge is exemplified right here in DeadCore, where challenges are thrown at you at a breakneck pace and you are expected to learn from what you did wrong and then do it again and again until you get it right. You are also relying incredibly too much on simply getting "cycles" or simply seemingly random variables. This is not "Tough but Fair" this is just "Difficult for the sake of Difficult."

If you want to play a better, faster, more fun version of DeadCore then go play Cloudbuilt. It's here on Steam and it is what this game wants to be, fun to play and fun to speedrun.

review:
A really challenging platformer*
I like how the game can be fluid when playing speedruns, but also present you with challenges where you are stuck and cannot get a sequencing down. The best part is there are often shortcuts or hidden pathways. Not to mention I have only completed a handful of the story and speedrun levels. So far the game has been really refreshing and not as repetitive as other platformers I have played.
Also The music is a perfect fit for the game.
9/10



*I am not very good at platformers so perhaps it is just me

author: {'steamid': '76561198084042440', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2774, 'last_played': 1450398827}
review:
Vous aimez les  grandes sensations et les vertiges? Vous aimez accomplir des exploits (tout du moins en avoir la sensation...)? Vous aimerez DeadCore. 

Difficultés et challenges sans sentiment de frustration ni 'ragequit'! Personnellement j'ai adoré ce jeu et il mérite amplement ma première review. Pourtant ce n'était pas gagné d'avance car ce type d'univers tron-like n'est pas 'ma came' et les jeux de plateforme en vue subjective, beaucoup se sont cassés les dents... mais l'intelligence du gameplay, les sensations vertigineuses (même sans casque VR) et la jouabilité réglée au dixième de poil de uc', ÇA c'est ma came. Et ça doit aussi être la vôtre. 

N'ayons pas peur Des mots, c'est un chef d'oeuvre dans sa catégorie!

review: Игра хороша. Бегаешь, прыгаешь, стреляешь, прокладывашь себе путь, решая "головоломки", короче поднимаешься вверх по странного вида башне. Музыка отличная, но редка, только в ключевых моментах. Наличие альтернативных путей делает игру интереснее и реиграбельней. Сюда же можно отнести и наличие плюшек, которые надо собирать (или не надо)), открывающих карты, пути, музыку и ведающих историю! Да история и сюжет преподносится текстом в записях. Местами сложна и необходимо запастись терпением, но результат того стоит. Рекомендую, хотябы со скидкой, но преобрести эту игру. 9 расшатанных пробелов из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163033491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1502916091}

author: {'steamid': '76561198121883792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1658359272}
review: This game is pretty fucking sweet to be honest. The level design is literally one of the best if not the best designs I have seen. You look anywhere and you can tell that effort was put into it. When you look down at first you see a storm tornado type thing and you can assume your own theories. As you progress you can look down off the map and it will show the area you previously passed, kinda like you're climbing a tower. As for gameplay and what you have to do in the game it is smooth, a medium priced computer can run it pretty well, (i-5 4570k, gtx 660, 8gb of ram.) What's inside the levels is even better, its like a puzzle, you can feel you're progressing, you can feel that you are getting better at it. There are more and more mechanics added to the levels the further you get into the story, you can play as a speedrunner, or you can play slow as you want. It's a real good feeling when you're stuck on a part so long and you solve it without having to google anything. Makes you feel super smart. I do have to admit that to be decent at this game you need to have good movement and be good with a mouse, also the levels do get much harder so theres that, I like this because it makes it so you can't just skip through the game super fast you have to think (when you're playing through first time) To end this the game is just super beautiful and in depth I would defintely reccomend you get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176916446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 41484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8654, 'last_played': 1699670623}
review:
Note - Please read my full review if you are going to read it.

    I absolutely love this game, though I can see why some players may not like this. This game is my favorite game by far, and it will probably be like that for another year. This game is amazing, though you may want to think before purchasing it.

Pros - 

-Stunning graphics (depending on what you choose, very nice for just medium).
-Stiff controls 
The controls on this game are amazing, I would say that any move ment you do is going to be your fault, even though there are glitches the controls are very accurate.
-Addictive
This game is very addictive after you get all the sparks and beat the story mode, you have so much to do in speedrun mode since you can always improve your time to get a better time. There is always competition when trying to beat someone's time in the game. 
-Glitches 
HOW CAN THIS BE A PRO???? Well, not all glitches are the best, though they do keep a lot of glitches (purposely?) and these glitches make the game so much more enjoyable. One glitch is called the Mega Jump and it can bring you super high. These glitches also speed your time up. 
-For those nerds out there
This game is definitely for those nerds like me.

Pros to me/Cons to others
-Fast paced game
This game is very demanding of you to multitask. You have to shoot things at the same time you are in mid air. Some parts you have to be really smart with or you will die too easily. 
-Challenging
Many people are saying this game is challenging. I will have to agree. A speedrunner myself, this game brought out some frustration in points of the game, the game is demanding, like I said before, of you in multitasking. This game brings out the best of what I can do, as it is a truly challenging game.

Cons - 
-Frustrations
This game is very frustrating when going through your first run. Your first one will be the hardest of your other runs. So, keep in mind, your first run will not be the greatest.
-Only for speedrunners/skilled players
Many speedrunners, like me, will fall in love with this game so easily. It is by far one of the best speedrunning games for us speedrunners. Skilled players probably also fit in this category as this game requires lots and LOTS of reflexes, multitasking and much more. This game is not for players who are here just to play a game and be done with it, or at least not most. If the game seems interesting to you and you are a casual gamer, I am not saying you can't buy the game, though the game targets speedrunners and skilled players. So you may find it overwhelming. After you beat the game once, then beating the game is much easier than before.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197990921513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1486079557}
review:
I wasn't expecting much and that is pretty much what I got.

Not a huge fan of the visuals on this one; I think it lacks personality overall. The gameplay on the other hand is pretty good. It's fast paced, precise enough to ask some real skill from the player but not to the point of being infuriating in every new situation. And the game finds new entertaining ways to be challenging.

That's not to say that it is amazingly well done in terms of "puzzles" or challenge. It can get a bit to disorienting, especially with some mechanics like changing gravity. Even with a FOV at 90, it's kind of hard to fully see where you are supposed to go. And falling to your death dozens of time because you don't see where your next checkpoint is can be frustrating. I think that the game is mostly about traversal and execution, and less about finding the path. When it's about finding the path, the level-design rarely shines in my opinion, due to the lack of visibility. But when it's about traversal, the snappy controls and varied ways of creating problems for the players to solve work fine.

TL;DR
Not a great game by any means, but for 10$ it's an "okay" fast-first-person-plateformer, that renews its challenge quickly enough, and doesn't over stay its welcome. It could be better in terms of art direction though...

PS: if you are into speedruns, this is definitely a game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992438116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 497, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1485714538}
review: Un jeu bien réalisé avec une orientation "Speedrun". C'est simple le perso se déplace comme si il était sous cocaïne et qu'il devait se lancer dans un sprint. Le gameplay est nerveux et le temps d'adaptation est assez court. On monte rapidement en difficulté et en vitesse. Petit à petit on se trouve confronté à de nouveaux mécanismes qui viennent corser les choses et perso je m'y suis un peu perdu. Le jeu reste relativement beau mais je m'attendais plus à un voyage en mode observation alors que le jeu au final demande de la nervosité et des réactions de malade ^^. Un bon jeu tout de même.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988323561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1488703792}
review:
Fun and fast first person jump and run. Difficult and sometimes frustrating but the excellent controls and the Tron like style keep you going.

There is a high replayability, because there are several routes to finish a level.
Recommended.^

I have to warn you about 2 issues:
1) The game is frustrating; the checkpoints are too far away from eachother.
2) They screwed up the rocketjump. It requires 100% precise timing and just doesn't work as
well as e.g. in Q3 Arena.
