author: {'steamid': '76561198122246287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1485596820}
review: I'm going to leave this game a positive review because at the end of the day it's aa decent game. However I feel like it doesn't do what it was meant to do well if that makes any sort of sense. I went into this game expecting a parkour game with some puzzles as thats what was advertised. Not really the case. At certain points it honestly just felt like a platforming bullet hell. And a damn good one at that. But that's not what the game was meant to be. I'll probably get some grief for slapping the term bullet hell on it, but when I'm trying to shoot a robot, while dodging lasers, and immediately having to shoot a moving target while jumping over more lasers so more robots don't push me into other lasers you get the same hectic feeling of a bullet hell all while trying to be accurate. I dont necessarily think that's the point of the game and it's not what I was looking for but it's still an alright game. The world feels very alive with all sorts of moving parts and such. I felt like I often had different directions to go which made it feel less than linear which is always great to see. Worth a try if what I described sounds like your genre

author: {'steamid': '76561198046418282', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1485584535}
review:
This game is in my 'absolutely horrible' category.

Pro
- graphicaly is nice
- some good music

Con
- from the begining there is no tutorial and nothing is explained
- collectables are useless, who needs these ridiculous achievements
- some glitches where you get stuck
- you can avoid some areas completely by jumping high enough and dashing
- no quicksave, checkpoints are placed at places so the dev laughs at you replaying useless sections 10x time
- levels so hard that i thought this was made for asian level
- invincible enemy, and the player is a loser with a weapon with limited munition
- everything is in a rush, timed and cannot be reactivated
- you need to die just for munition to reset or reactivate puzzles
- double jump works when the game feels like it, cant run or duck either

3/10 rating

After dying 100x of useless deaths and getting to the gravity sections, i just said no,
        this is a waste of time, repeating sections that i completed 10x times and still putting me back so far just because
        they think it's funny or a "game mechanic", challenge or i don't know what, it's not a challenge to complete those     sections just to die on the next another 10x so the total will amount to 100x, it's boring, also might point out the fact that not everyone is honest like me and will "fly" trough the level achieving the best times and be at the top ranking not so legit, what's then the point of rushing all the game.
I don't know just my opinion, playing for 20+ years, why should i buy another game from you guys, you actually anoyed me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269262692', 'num_games_owned': 1554, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1771, 'last_played': 1486365965}
review:
必須好評

這遊戲有點鏡之邊緣:催化劑的感覺，不過DeadCore更自由，非常多路線，還有Super Jump、Mega Jump這種特技(雖然很難使出...)
但DeadCore的難度也比催化劑高了不少，就算只求通關、不追求時間還是不容易，全成就更是喪心病狂
存檔點不算多，而且踩了存檔點會使雷射網移動到該有的高度，所以有時不踩存檔點反而可以走捷徑
遊戲中可以搜集音樂和Log，Log好像是在介紹世界觀，二周目的最後一關也有一些故事，但我很不喜歡這種純文字的劇情，而且又是英文，所以直接略過了。真結局有點2001太空漫游的感覺
雖然沒什麼劇情，但玩著絕對不會枯燥，關卡設計非常好，重複性不高。所以有點毒性

整體非常推薦，反正不貴，就是操作難度比較高

另外說明，爬牆特技已經不能用了

author: {'steamid': '76561197978259435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1522461682}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993083569', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1483897166}
review:
Jeu qui pourrait faire penser à Portal au premier abord, il en est finalement très différent. Ici, point de portail, mais des passages à ouvrir, des ponts à abaisser, des murs à éviter, tout ça avec votre pistolet. Sur le papier ça sonne bien, d'autant que la campagne de financement participatif a été fructueuse.
Cependant, une fois que l'on démarre le jeu, on se rend compte du problème, absolument énorme et inacceptable pour un jeu de plateforme : des problèmes de hitbox partout ! Si vous êtes un pixel trop court, hop vous loupez la plateforme et vous mourrez, aucun droit à l'erreur ! Des murs de laser plus larges qu'ils n'y paraissent, sans parler des blocs d'inversion de gravité, qui vont faire hurler, au sens propre.
Bref, jeu énervant non par sa difficulté mais par sa désolante imprécision.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036605015', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1482981864}
review:
Let's keep it short:

Great speedrunning game. You have full control over yourself and you can just blaze through levels if you're skilled enough. You get upgrades along the way that shake up things a bit and allow for even more ridiculous skips. It all runs really smooth and the ambiance, feel and flow of the game are all great.

One thing I didn't like was your character's hitbox. There are some obstacles that require you to be precise while going through them, but if you're too low (even though it looks like you'd be able to go through just fine) you'll die. So the height needed to go through those things is really hard to tell.

Worth a shot, if you like speed games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185451763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1484621442}

This isn't just some indie game, it is a well-done full-game just waiting to be played, i bought this game expecting a little fun for when i was borednot expteing the game to have such great mechanics, i would buy this for $20, so having it for $10 makes it feel like i had a discount. buy this game, you won't regret it!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072717167', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1522710986}
review: mecanicas sencillas da una buena sensación de velocidad graficamente no contiene nada que destacar pero si un buen apartado artistico, la musica es electronica de buena elección de puzzles no tiene nada es un plataformero de gran dificultad muy divertido y recomndable si buscas algo con velocidad y que sea un reto

author: {'steamid': '76561198110425390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1530301983}
review: The combination of platormer and FPS makes this game feel similar to the Portal games. The main difference is the pace of this game. Lots of puzzles require rapid movement, jumps, reactions etc which makes it very intense, and addictive even when you keep falling off the edge. There's quite a few checkpoints in the maps so you don't have to worry too much about going through the same area again and again. I really like the graphics style - appearing as a kind of cross between Halo 3 and Destiny it feels very spacious and high quality. Sounds are non intrusive and also very high quality. The mechanics are easy to pick up, and available hints around the map mean you never have to use google when you're stuck. Speedrunning should be great fun too, now that there's been a patch on exploits. Highly reccomend, I got it on a sale but it's worth the full price! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086670406', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1482558983}
review: Fun platformer game, but it has some annoying parts and the gravity-changing mechanic isn't well polished. You can also skip many puzzles by  jumping through them in non-intended ways, and you can beat many jumping puzzles without really understanding what you're doing very well. I wouldn't recommend this game for its full price, but it's worth $5 or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215166644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1482739653}
review: 打到最后一关过不去，卸了，GG。游戏是个好游戏，没耐心的就不要手贱找罪受了，很上火，一个点复活个几百次会死人的。为了好评才推荐这款游戏，实际上不推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198066613713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1485927151}
review:
Some may complain this game is all too frustrating. It can be, but that does not detract about how challenging and wonderful this game is. You need to time your jumps or you will fail multiple times, but that is the point. It isn't meant to be an easy game, but one where it provides a constant challenge.

The graphics are incredible to look at it too, and the audio effects are spot on. If you want a challenge for a low price, pick up this game. I bought it on sale for $2.49, and I can easily say it's provide more gameplay and fun then games worth $20.

And one thing I also say, if you get frustrated don't give up. And if you're a casual gamer, this game isn't for you. It is brutally challenging, but that is what I like.

 This game is for one who has high levels of persistence and will never give up. If you are this person, again I recommend this game highly. If you do not have these attributes and prefer a casual game, this may not be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157516189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1482618053}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115216359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1482745821}
review: 挺不错的游戏~！以前喜欢玩跳跳乐（激战2)的玩家可以尝试下！ 但相比激战2的跳跳乐，死亡核心有不同的路线，不是只有一条路，每条路是都可以通向前方的，不过游戏BGM方面我觉得略显单调了一点，游戏性我很喜欢，很适合拿来打发时间。

author: {'steamid': '76561198260277723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1494342853}
review:
这款游戏我是圣诞节打折12块买的，玩了一下午，晚上又玩，简直没日没夜。

①首当其冲的评价：难度比传送门系列难多了，这游戏也太考验操作了！

7小时玩到最后一章，估计快到结尾了吧，因为第一次玩光是解谜就已经让我累手酸，只想着快速通关，所以我没去在意收集物品，那些东西我看见的基本是在变态的地方……

越到后期，两个重生点之间的距离越发加大，你得一气呵成地去完成一大段jump、dash配合的动作，并且还要注意jump是不是还有留下第二段，dash能量值是否回复到马上可以施放。

外加到了最后一章，出现了很变态的同一条路往返模式，先从下方很变态的路走过去开启机关，再从和下路差不多难度的上路返回，而且NPC机器人的设置地点简直太绝了，要通关还是需要一定心情的，不然真可能搁置掉不去碰了。

②说一下游戏的其他部分：

1、我基本没感觉到有什么剧情，偶尔见到的log也没去读，从头到尾的感觉就是一直往上爬，都接近末尾了一句语音，一句解说都没碰到过，比较枯燥；只有在地图中出现的闪烁文字提示你这一段你该怎么过。

2、按键设置无法识别鼠标左侧按键，而blast这个功能我现在也没明白除了让boss机器人闭嘴外具体要怎么用，倒是跌跌撞撞一路爬上来了。另外有时候会碰到bug，比如dash冲进墙，结果好不容易通过的部分报废，只能回到重生点再来。

3、环境来说，我印象中一共经历了：风暴层上方的晴朗区域、塔基的建筑内部区域、黑色风暴区域，最终现在站立的地方也和第一章的天气差不多，已经可以看到塔尖了，印象最深的还是我重来了非常多次的黑色风暴层，大得没边的虚空环境对心理很有压抑感，配合一直失败的打击会让人抓狂。

4、略微不适合恐高症患者；这个场景是极其巨大的，上下全看不见边际，这比普通的高处还更可怕，若是踩空坠落，下方就是风暴一样的无底洞。我其实自身是有一点恐惧心理的，而且到了第五章你甚至还能依稀看见你第一章进来的那个地方，要知道你可是爬了几个小时还没登顶的状态。

③最后提一句，我在游戏一半剧情的黑色风暴层那边就解锁了一个成就：Get disintegrated by a laser 500 times.【被激光网分解500次】，而我还有更多更多的马上重来，我可等不及坠落半天再被分解……

几个小时下来手已经酸了，回头有心情我再来玩这游戏吧…虽然我被虐得惨但其实回味起来不坏…

author: {'steamid': '76561198093221503', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1462, 'last_played': 1702942686}
review: Deadcore is a 3D platformer in the 1st person perspective. The goal is to get to the top of a seemingly endless tower by using abilities that you find along the way. The gameplay is very challenging, but you get an unlimited number of tries and frequent checkpoints. The replay value is high, as the game features all sorts of hidden collectibles throughout the levels, as well as stages specifically designed for speedrunning. One thing I particularly like is that no part of the stage is "off limits." There are no invisible walls, and you can stand on basically any physical object you see. The only barrier to speak of exists as a giant laser grid which rises as you progress, which makes sense, as it allows you to die and respawn more quickly if you fall off of a ledge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016659877', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1680479485}
review:
Absolutely amazing first person speed run precision platformer. The sense of speed, control and freedom you get when using your various powers is great.

Level design is amazing. There is a clear path you're supposed to take but you are at no point stopped by any kind of invisible wall. If you find a clever way to skip a section and shave off some seconds off your timer then more power to you.

Soundtrack is great. Artstyle is also beautiful and very fitting with the soundtrack. Performance is solid and game looks and feels great at 144FPS. Only downside I can think of, which is a minor nitpick on the visuals, is the lack of better AA. Since the artstyle is very geometric/TRON-line, there are a lot of straight lines which don't look as well as they could with some better AA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015199712', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1602985557}
review: One of the best single player games I have played in a really long time, there is no way this game is not worth $10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064994074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1497123059}
review:
I have one main complaint about Deadcore: for a first person platformer, it can be excruciatingly punishing if you misstep. And you will misstep. Often. Or you will try to save yourself in the last moment and over-correct your course. Which often will also result in falling. It's a bit Darksouls-y. x)

But all in all, I like the game. The time between failing and trying again is usually far less than a minute (there are exceptions). This motivates you to try again, and again, until you make it, and afterwards, you'll definitely feel accomplished. The challenges themselves come in a broad variety, and you often come across two possible paths you can take. That way you have an alternative if you can't get past one particular challenge.

The story, unfortunately, has to be collected by finding logs, that are spread throughout the levels, so it won't be guaranteed that you actually find them. I would have prefered a different approach to this, but I can live with that.

So, if you like a good challenge and can deal with occasional frustration because of the limitations of the first person perspective, I can definitely recommend Deadcore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045253623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1482152484}
review:
While I like the game's artstyle and I think checkpoints are well paced, some moments are very frustrating. Especially the gravity fields, I was so confused at one point that I had to resort to a walkthrough.

The shockwave drones (are they called Troopers?) are also very annoying, because they can still block your way even when deactivated. And the laser tunnels where you must dash through are quite strict.

Overall, it's a very hard platformer that does not suit everyone. I do not regret playing this game because of the sense of accomplishment it gave me, but I wouldn't recommend it either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140858552', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1530, 'last_played': 1508085898}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111644435', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1509886972}
review:
Если вы считаете, что вы мастер шутеров, то лучше не покупайте данную игру! Я вас предупредил!
Давольно интересный шутерок с необычным геймплеем, цель добратся до конца уровня. Так просто? - спросите вы. Не дождётесь! По пути вы будете встречать лазеры и других противников. (Это что-за летающий куб? ВАТ?! Какого...?) И вы уже летите на мощности своего пукана! Выдержали? Прекрасно, продолжим! Подъём с препядствиями? Легко! Вы не раз будете встречать похожие задачи... Что такое? Уже 5/10/20/50 раз погибаете на одном и том же задании? Смирись и пробуй снова и снова. Получилось? Рано радуешся!!! Это только начало! Вы будете готовы выкинуть клаву, сломать комп или что-то в этом духе... Но знаете, всё-таки игра действительно может затянуть! Игра стоит того, чтобы поиграть. 9/10 за необычный геймплей и приятную картинку на моём старичке! (NVidia GTS 250 + Intel Core 2 Duo) Рекомендую!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052739555', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1660159431}
review:
This is a great FPS platformer.
It is all about using and combining your abilities to overcome obstacles.
Your first playthrough will be a lot of trial and error, but the music really drives you to complete each level and master the mechanics.
It will be very frustrating at times, especially the last level (ascension) where it will feel like the checkpoints are just too damn far apart, but this is the level where you really have to combine all your skills, and it has the best soundtrack running too which should hopefully keep you engaged until the end!
I just finished my second playthrough which was a lot more fun simply because i did a lot less dying and repeating the same things over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again, but don't be discouraged during your first playthrough ;)

Performance is definately more important than graphics quality in this game, especially in level 3 or 4 the fps take quite a hit which makes the fast reflex aiming harder than it should be.
I played this on an AMD A8-7600 and got about 45-60fps(locked) most of the time, except for the level mentioned above where it regularly dropped into the 30's. I played at 1680x1050 on very low.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083824217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1598262105}
review:
Une tour infinie, exhalant des vapeurs électrochimiques et nauséabondes, se dresse devant vous.
Quelle est son origine, et pourquoi vous ferez vous agresser par des tesseracts enragés me direz-vous?

Qu'importe la présence de ces IA informes, car ce qu'elles ne savent pas, c'est que vous êtes le nouveau messie, armé de courage et d'arrogance.
En effet, il se trouve que l'arme trouvée se requiert très utile pour augmenter vos capacités de nano-grimpeur.

Au fur et à mesure de l'ascension, le sommet de cette diantre tour pointera son ombre ou lumière.
Découvertes de journaux électroniques, multiples bonds, brefs élans aériens, tout les moyens seront bon pour gravir le monolithe conducteur.

Ninja du futur, hâte-toi car les portes de la tour electrinfernale s'ouvriront, mais personne ne sait pour combien de temps.
Grimpe, saute, tue, annihile, dépêche-toi...

N'entends-tu pas la haine de la tour? Ne sens-tu pas son appetit de chair, esmoignant de ses pores quantiques?
Dompte-la tour, tour-billonne ou tour-noie mais vite, le temps ne t'a-"temps" pas.

Doom-like (FPS) magnifique, nerveux, plateforme, univers SF, taillé pour le speedrun, hyper bien optimisé.
Valeur sûre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237673034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1450100950}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059497399', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1546103211}
review: Nettes spiel zum durchspielen um dann sich immerwärend an die Aufgabe zu machen gegen die Zeit zu rennen. Super Speed-running Game.

review: Красивая интересная игра. Достаточно динамичная, с быстрым респауном (что при довольно большой сложности уровней очень важно).

author: {'steamid': '76561197993348009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4569, 'last_played': 1692408082}
review:
This is one of the greatest first person plateformer I have ever played. This game is responsive, it's sharp, it has an amazing soundtrack, beautiful graphiques, awesome level design and is worth every second of your time that you'll put in it. 

This game was made to be played by speedrunners. There are multiple pathways, there is a ton of movement freedom and you can quick reset in a blink of an eye. My PB for a Glitchless NG+ is 19:27.12 and I am now aiming to try and do it in 15 minutes.

This game is gets my "Whoooaaaaaaa, dude!" nomination award and it's well deserved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010241475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2634, 'last_played': 1439372591}
review: One of the most challenging, well made, and fun puzzle/parkor games I've ever played. On top of being surreal I was entertained for weeks, maybe even a few months (which is a lot for a single player based game) there are even moments that will get your adrenaline going as a competitive FPS would. if you're a gamer, and you love fast paced games that will put you on the edge of your seat then I highly recommend DeadCore to anyone, it does not disappoint.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994710126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1569785993}
review:
One of my favorite games, challenging and rewarding. Instant fun of speed running and jumping in first person, then get frustrated trying to beat your score.
Great soundtrack as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050473299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1521760633}
review: Honestly, this is a game that most people should know about. It's on the same level as portal or even higher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005253199', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1647040747}
review:
Deadcore is the bastard child of the Defrag mod for Quake 3 Arena, a basejumping simulator, Mirror's Edge and...eeer...Quake 3 gameplay. What you need to understand is that the only thing between the start of a map and a world record is you and how bad you want it.
This is where you need to go fast, think fast, and die to do a better try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995028195', 'num_games_owned': 893, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1639343670}
review:
Amazing running game.

Incredible replay value due to different unlockable paths.

Played through the game 2 1/2 time still haven't found half the different paths.

Sometimes biteing-the-table-hard but at the same time awesome to look at.

Feel like a speed demon once you figure out where and how to get through this mess.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081463550', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1480219739}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070449430', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1664581120}
review:
A beautiful 3D platformer.

The game itself can appeal to both the casual platformer and the hardcore speedrunner.

For the casual-
Beautifully designed levels with a modern theme.
Simple and easy to understand hazards, which can be dangerous in their own rights.
An interesting storyline, almost entirely made of the Sparks spread out through the game.
Wonderful music. Ambient, serene, and still enough to move.
Checkpoints in many places- the casual's best friend.

For the hardcore-
Intuitive level design.
A variety of speedrunning opportunities [b]built in[/b] to the game. (Speedrun mode, high scores, etc.)
Developers who care about the community and actively listen to some critique regarding balance.
The option to run previous versions of the game.
Various straightforward hazards that don't all just flat-out kill you.
The quick-respawn button when you know you messed up.

Great game. Lovely art and music. Nice developers.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198304366633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1479979304}
review: 画面很有科幻感，后期会更刺激

author: {'steamid': '76561197970230422', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1534603584}
review:
DeadCore ist ein großartiger Mix aus FPS und Jump'n'Run. Jeder mit ausreichend hoher Frustgrenze wird seinen Spaß an dem Spiel haben. Hier sind gute Koordination, genau abgepasste Sprünge und schnelles Reaktionsvermögen gefragt.

Die Story kann man zwar als "okay, ist irgendwie vorhanden verbuchen", aber die Herausforderungen und der riesig erklimmbare Turm sind großartig. Viele Passagen haben mehrere Wege und an einigen Stellen kann man sich auf recht kreative Art und Weise auch etwas vorbeischummeln. Die Herausforderungen sind ordentlich knackig und gerade zum Ende hin alles andere als im Vorbeispringen zu machen. Man muss sich auf einigen Stellen auf typisches Trial and Error einstellen. Dafür ist der Triumph danach umso größer.

Für alle Speedrunner, Plattformer und Quake 3 Trickjumper meiner Meinung nach ein Pflichtkauf für schmales Geld.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135823295', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1633722697}
review: Для любителей головоломок, полётов и скорости реакции - это то что нужно. Сюжет на английском языке,но он не играет особо важную роль. Вы можете проверить свою скорость и посоревноватся с друзьями на прохождение уровней.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167688274', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1995, 'last_played': 1570743868}
review: 纯靠走位和运气

author: {'steamid': '76561197962864661', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1415828715}
review: Great visually pleasing first person platformer with right amount of challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969548722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1537328601}
review:
This game is an amazing mix of first person shooter and parkour platforming. To tie it all together you have yourself an amazing sound track and fitting visuals.

The levels unfold seamlessly as you progress in a somewhat linear fashion. The roads may split but providing you with a few different options based off your play style but ultimately your goal is the same.

Get to the end, as fast as you can.

Not much in the way ofstory, but what it lacks it makes up in game play. It is well worth the purchase price. If you catch it on a Steam sale, even better. I really hope the developers continue to add to the game in future updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010187647', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1467243538}
review:
Un plateforme fps, rien que ça mérite votre détour.

Mais ce jeu offre plus, une direction artistique qui sert le jeu et vous donne le vertige, une ost qui tabasse , une replay value avec une emphase sur le speed run.

Quelques moments de gameplay vous retourneront littéralement la tête.

Si vous aimez la vitessse, les fps, et la plateforme, alors essayez deadcore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060342046', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1590480141}
review: First I only played this game, because I got it through a Bundle. But then I started playing it and it was really great. It startet drawing me in and I played through it in no time. If you like fast games then definitly get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108561312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1483547063}
review:
DeadCore is an amazing and fast-paced experience that challenges your reflexes and quick-thinking, but also presents a unique world and atmosphere. There's this feeling of danger and isolation, but divinity and peace at the same time. I think it's hard to describe.

Things I would criticize are some overly frustrating passages as well as the rather half-baked backstory that is told via hidden notes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994256276', 'num_games_owned': 2022, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1630245158}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116861748', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1618132987}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981778962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1478905360}
review:
The graphics are nice in a minimalist way but still have some gloss.
The environment is unique and piques your curiosity for the first hour or so.
Game mechanics only have small variation and miniscule advancements that don't really affect much.
You only occassionally find the "secret" items that reveal what passes for a story making really large gaps in an already meager story and thus ruining any chance of actually engaging the character and motivating them to contunue the increasingly monotonous activity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048502036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1696458287}
review: This is one of the best...no...The Best game of this type I have ever played!  The atmosphere will suck you in to the point where the tension and stress is palatable.  My hands start to sweat as I try and land that tricky jump or dodge those pesky, murderous cubes that try and knock you off the ledge.  What a great game!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035005384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1657486654}
review: Really enjoyed it. Graphics are amazing, the puzzles are varied and nice, some are diffecult but with some practice you shouldn't be stuck for too long. All in all, a good game to have and I think it even has a lot of replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156328384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1695972532}
review:
I wish more people would play this game. It's beautifully desinged, has a great soundtrack, and uses its creative mechanics to create clever levels that branch into multiple paths. Did I mention how much I love the visuals? It's one of those games that has enough challenge to keep you enjoying it longer, but also balances that with the ability to speedrun the whole game. (There's an achievement for beating the whole thing in an hour!) The enviroment is haunting, the movement is liquid and fast, and its an experience any adventure game lover should try.
9/10
(Trust me, the platforming is SO COOL!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198257387558', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1543346911}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025064710', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1520468517}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003221748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1478049736}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051849974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1478009913}
review: So I bought this game for no real reason, out of curiosity. I'm actually not really into platformers. However, I fell in love with the amazing gameplay. It is a fair challange, never too frustrating. Definitely recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991026421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1573471996}
review:
Actual play time is more like 15 hours (offline mode). At first the game seamed gimicky and shallow. But after completeing the game, a slow sensation of magnanimus gratitude overcame me.

This is a near perfect experience. After getting a handle of the controls steep lerning curve, flying through the levels on speed runs is just exhilarating; the game play is really somthing special.

The story mode is such a wonderful experience, with a superbe soundtrack and artistic direction that really brings you in to this slick and vivid atmosphere of a world.

Some track elements can seam a bit contrived, yet the game encourages you to explore and find nice collectables and upgrades. Hence the exploration, some track elemnts can be completly undermind letting you take control of the world; making for a very personal experience. 

I was very luck to get the game on sale, and would have definatly got the game full price if I had know it would be so good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046807512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1640274833}
review:
Se volete passare un paio d'ore della vostra vita dando fondo a tutto il vocabolario di parolacce nelle lingue conosciute e sconosciute giocate a Deadcore.

Contrariamente ad altri commenti, non lo definirei in nessun modo simile a Portal, nè un gioco a rompicapo. Non è la riflessione ma la velocità, la precisione e l'istinto a guidarvi nella sfida. E soprattutto sette quintali e mezzo di pazienza.

Il gioco ha meccaniche platform esasperate al massimo, basate sul trial-and-error, ovvero prova, muori, riprova, rimuori, riprova, finchè non ci riesci.
Non fosse che riuscirci dà una certa soddisfazione mi sentirei di sconsigliarlo a priori, ma visto il bel look visivo e il tasso di sfida posso consigliarlo, ma solo a quei giocatori che hanno un'infinita pazienza e sono appassionati di platform.

Scordatevi gli enigmi, non ce ne sono, si tratta di pura e semplice coordinazione e movimento nello spazio.
Il level design a volte causa qualche morte di troppo per mancanza di chiarezza della direzione da intraprendere (snervante se si è appena usciti da una sezione particolarmente impegnativa). Un paio di rifiniture in più l'avrebbero reso un gran titolo.

Non mi esprimo sulla "trama" e sull'esplorazione, visto che il gioco non invita minimamente all'esplorazione ma solo alla conquista del prossimo checkpoint.

Salta, spara, scatta, evita i laser, suda, cadi, muori, ritenta: questo è Deadcore, e va preso così com'è.

Non si può scegliere la difficoltà, e il livello di sfida è elevato.

Siete avvisati.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960272349', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1477118511}
review:
Great game. Expect to die or restart from a check point a lot. Great soundtrack to keep you engaged. Don't be afraid to go off course, there are so many different paths and skips that you can easily make on your own to beat the game. 

If you like Counterstrike KZ maps this game is definitely for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201495075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1477012106}
review: Juego de plataformas donde debes ir avanzando saltando y esquivando las diferentes trampas que se encuentran por el entorno (laseres, robots enemigos, ...). La verdad que para el precio que lo adquiri de oferta (2,49€) me parece muy buen juego para cambiar y pasar un buen rato, ya que es bastante entretenido y con una dificultad que te hace disfrutar con cada reto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014698888', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1476920672}
review:
This is a FPS puzzle platformer, and it is actually very well made in terms of mechanics, graphics, audio, and the like.  The game also does a great job at integrating the tutorial into early levels.  The first few levels are linear and give you a good feel for how the game plays.  However, after teaching you the essentials of how to play, the game opens up into a maze of pathways, making it difficult to figure out where you are even supposed to go and what you need to do to get there.  I would normally consider this a good thing for most games in this genre, but for Deadcore, it just makes the game more frustrating the fun.

Checkpoints are too far apart, forcing you to repeat difficult sections over and over again until you can perfectly execute a series of precisely timed movements.  I eventually reached one such section that I simply could not finish.  If you enjoy repeatedly failing one small section of a level where you can see exactly what needs to be done but just can't make it happen, then this game is for you.  I don't understand why people enjoy games that are so frustratingly difficult, but that is precisely what this game has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127996759', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1611393672}
review: This game is great, if you are looking for a platforming adventure then this is the game for you. This game does has it flaws but mostly it is amazing. There is not much of a story but it is there if you are interested in it. The game is not that long only about 10 hours at maximum, but its all worth it. Highly reccommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070878982', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1671816592}
review:
Bonne surprise pour seulement 3$ en promo ! Mes 10h ont ete intense avec un sentiment d'immense plaisir au passage de chaque check-point.

Petit jeu simple mais efficace avec une tres bonne ambiance graphique et sonore.

review: F**k this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975259789', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1476574454}
review:
I really don't want to put a "no" on this. The game is smooth, gorgeous, and in many ways amazing. Unfortunately, this game is brutal and meant for a very small percentage of people who like doing speedruns on difficult platformers. 

Basically, if you don't have twitchy reflexes, this will be a very, very frustratng game.

The graphics and the gameplay are actually really well done. Framerates are smooth as glass. (I would love, love, love to see this in stereoscopic 3D!) Often, if you think you've gotten stuck at an area you can find a way to bypass it if you find a few of the basic upgrades early on. Some of the basic item unlocks are actually easy to find and to get to as long as you put a little thought into the layout.

However, this game gets really difficult really quickly in the third level. You will die. A LOT. And unfortunately if you don't have twitchy reflexes, you'll die a lot more. The screen shots obviously aren't really good at explaining the difficulty because it looks like it's simply a different kind of platformer. It certainly is, but if you don't realize from the start that you NEED very twitchy reflexes, you risk getting really angry at this game.

Right now, I'm in the third level, and I can't think of how many times I've died. Unfortunately, save points are quite far apart. I actually felt a strong sense of accomplishment when I got through a difficult section (after dying about 40 times); unfortunately, the difficulty level is getting worse with each section, and there are still two more full levels to go.

I can say right now that I doubt very much that I will bother to finish this game or even the level that I'm currently on. I'm not a speedrunner. I'm not as twitchy of a player as this game demands. I tend to be more methodic and analytical in my approach. This game does not allow that kind of approach and will kill you in later levels if you try.

If the difficulty throughout the game was like levels 1 and 2, I think this would be a very enjoyable platformer. Unfortunately, based on what I'm seeing in level 3 and knowing that there are two more after this, I've come to the conclusion that this game is meant for a very, very small subset of the gaming population. I'm not in that subset, and chances are that you're not either.

Unless you're absolutely certain that you have very twitchy reflexes and you don't mind dying over and over and over again, this game will likely end up being frustrating more than fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123164935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1545057532}
review:
我還沒將這遊戲玩完，但配樂一流、畫面設定一流、邊玩邊欣賞遊戲場景，各種酷炫，而且我這老舊的電腦玩起來竟然還不會卡，太感動了，但只有我覺得這遊戲裡的角色腳實在是很滑嗎?!?!
動不動就滑出軌道摔下去實在很崩潰阿哈哈哈
最神奇的是，摔刷下去後竟然還會碰到下方的存檔點...
然後就要重新從下面再開始往上爬了...冏
天空競技場嗎這...
雖然掉下去的風景也很美但...真的要及時把R按下去阿23333

author: {'steamid': '76561198098659212', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1624976859}
review:
Acheté 2,49 € en promo, énorme surprise!
L'ambiance colle parfaitement à l'action, les contrôles sont réactifs, le jeu est très fluide, et les difficultés s'enchaînent crescendo sans pour autant rebuter.
Il mettra à mal la patience des moins persévérants, mais ce sera du pur bonheur pour les amateurs de challenges!
Si j'avais eu droit à une démo, j'aurais même pu le prendre à 10€ (son prix d'origine).
Un très bon jeu, je le conseille aux amateurs du genre.

review:
Same generic ambiance as portal, shoot a gun to activate things, platform your way to the end of the level (which is never clearly described) get some power ups, not sure that any of them do anything though. the part that really kills me, though i really like this game visually and playability wise, it the never ending attempt to fucking screw you over, just made a dificult jump onto a boost pad, immediatly punished into a death wall. the stun time for enemies is fucking aids as well. literally 2 sec if your lucky. and trust me, the 1-3 types of enemies in the game are fucking pointless. 
Main point of this story is if you want a tedious game that will never recieve an update, buy this.
Best features are that their are no invis walls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002305041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1476036922}
review:
A must for platform games is to make it feel fair.

If you introduce unintuitive hitboxes and parts which feel mostly trial and error, the end result is an unenjoyable experience. Unfortunately, deadcore has both unintuitive hitboxes and parts that feel mostly trial and error. I ended up solving most jumps via muscle memory rather than accurately gauging the height like any good platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072883306', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1476340280}
review:
The negative reviews are what made me buy this game, that and it being on sale for $2.50. Shifting through the negitives I normally find real dirt on the failures of whatever developer constructed the monstrosity I am pondering of purchasing. Once I noticed this game had 2 repeating issues from the thumbs down crowd.

One is this game is not Portal, nor Portal 2. Well, no s$$$, it's called DeadCore. I am under the impression that the connection some find is the puzzles and minor Parkour. Maybe it's the fun one finds when after you faceplant into a loop of epic failures and the that one time you get it right and move past? Who knows, as it's someones personal connection. 

The second "complaint" about this game is the QQ. I mean the real QQ, raw and uncut, 100% pure, Kleneex Tissue by the box QQ. >THIS GAME IS TO HARD<. For the amount of thumbs down due to this game being potentially to hard for some people to play, I pour each Dev a shot and raise mine in salute to producing a game for the non-casual gamer. Not every game needs to be easy and hold your hand. If you find the laser walls move to fast, you need to move faster. If those turrets are hitting you first, you need to shoot first. 

If you cry over this game being to hard, get better at gaming. Go back to square one.
Practice, Apply, Fail, and Repeat until victory.
No one said this is going to be easy

It runs very smooth. Controls are tight, with micro adjustments midair and mouse sensitivity spot on at default. Graphically this game isn't lush forests and blown apart bunkers or cities floating in the sky or space. It is a complex puzzler with Tron stlye graphics, but your not here to enjoy the sunset. Graphics are perfect for their application. Music soundtrack is nicely applied, and not overbearing. Puzzles will make you stop for a bit and look around, but your not searching for the lever behind the mummy on the 2nd floor storeroom for 30 minutes. You will have your goal within 10 seconds. 

I don't understand why someone could give a good game a thumbs down for difficulty, instead of a thumbs up and a warning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156101161', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1504467711}

review: This game is interesting. The mechanics don't really have a tutorial outside of "Press _ to use this feature." One of my favorite aspects is that the game doesn't care how you get the objectives done. It only cares that you do. It's like a sandbox platformer. Definitely get it if it's on sale. Heavily consider it if it's full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056707879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1507643179}
review:
なかなかのアクション。結構シビアな展開が多く死にまくる場所もいくつかあった。
アクションが得意じゃないと厳しいかも。でも、スイッチを作動させ、トラップを停止し、空中を舞い、ダッシュする。
アクション映画さながらの高揚感を味わうことができる！！

昔やったスーファミのドンキーコングをプレイしているような感覚になった。
しかし、こっちのほうが断然アクション感が違う！

自分は、初プレイでガンガン進めて収集やら何やらを無視したが、2時間半でクリアした！
ボリュームがないということではない。単に自分の実力を自慢したいだけである。

とりあえず、おすすめです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198304354002', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1506908464}
review:
I'll keep this short.

Pros - basically everything. Graphics are good, level design is nothing like i've ever seen, etc etc.

The Con.

This game is not for the casual crowd.
You will Die.
You will Die again.
You will Die a lot. Over and Over again. I feel like this game sacrifices fun for difficulty, because about halfway through the split second actions start to increase and the checkpoints eem like they get few and far in between.

Is this a bad thing? Not very, but if you are short in patience and if you don't pay attention to every detail of the puzzel, you wil fail over and over again. Sometimes it feels like a clusterf---, when you have to juggle ammo preservation, enemy movement, lasers, timed platforms, etc. While playing this game I let out a huge sigh of relief every time I saw that green checkpoint circle

I do not recommend this game unless you want to be challenged. I do not recommend this game to the casual crowd.

Will I be happy when I finish the game? Yes, to an extent.

Am I happy that I just restarted what was possibly the final level in the game, when I was halfway done with it?

No.

No I am not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145736464', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1681061702}
review:
What a trip! 
First things first: the look. This is a game with a unique atmosphere that emerges from the cool art style. When you stand high up in the sky, beneath you the hundreds of meters you have already overcome, between flying cubes and moving monolith formations and all of that infront of these epic cloud backgrounds -  you feel like in a stylish sci-fi movie. You can tell: I really like the look of the game. 

The Gamplay - I came, I saw, I failed
This is a great, challenging and fast paste platformer. I don`t get why some people complain about the diffculty. It is challenging, no doubt. But it is not frustrating by any means. The process goes usually like this: You arrive art a new checkpint. You scan the structure of the challenge in front of you. You try, you fail. After failing a few times you start to understand what you have to do to get pass that point and you think: "No way! No fucking way anyone can do this! But you try and you fail. Like a lot. BUT because you restart the second you "die" and and you will always know what you did wrong. There is a great level of fairness to this concept. You don`t get really punished when you die. Instead you get slightly better every single time. Because you get an inch, a beam a platform further than the last time. Because you have a lot of little successes in between, there is no frustration. And then the feeling, you have when you mastered a diffcult passage where you failed dozens of times! When you recognize the skill you developed while failing 5, 10, 30 or even 50 times - this is a good example of "easy to learn, hard to master". Failing. Getting better. Succeed. This is the very core of gaming. So to all of you who think this game is too hard, I have just one advice: get gud! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030589833', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1477090037}
review:
Deadcore is a 3D FPS platformer game that relies on quick reactions to navigate obstacle courses populated by moving lasers, ever shifting platforms, fans that blow you of course and other dangers. 

It's pretty challenging, so you'll have to try again and again to get past the various sections of the game. The big jumps and sense of height and scale is very cool, so this is probably as close as I'm going to get to how Mustang Wanted and his kin feel when they undertake their deathdefying urbex adventures. 

I also like the graphical style and the level design for the most part. This game was built to test your patience. I also really like the quick respawns which encourage that one more try feeling, a la Super Meatboy.  

On the downside, and I can't quite put my finger on why, but I didn't enjoy it as much as I thought: the ingredients are all there, but it doesn't want to make me want to sing from the rooftops about it. Perhaps I found it too frustrating? I don't know. I didn't have that problem with Super Meatboy and that frustrated the hell out of me!

If 3D platforming is something you enjoy, this is definitely worth giving a spin. The ingredients are all there, but for me personally, it didn't quite get me as excited as I hoped. 

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198061064796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1472887483}
review:
Its an fps platformer with some very simple puzzles. When you do well in this game and get the pacing and rhythm just right, oh man does it feel good. But the game quickly ramps up the difficulty and then pacing and fun breaks down; either because I am worse than average at FPS (I have always thought of myself as better than average but it is a possibility), this game is desinged only for hardcore fps players, or the game is simply too particular about players getting timing and movements exactly the way it wants. 

As a result, I cannot think of a single person that I actually know that I could see enjoying this game as more than a quick playtest.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981087823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1475036951}
review:
One of my favorite games I've played this year (and I've played about 30 so far), possibly one of my new favorites of all time. A challenging and rewarding first person platformer. Think of it like a first-person Dust Force. I recommend this for anyone who likes that sort of game and who isn't put off by the first-person aspect or the challenging platforming.

Pros:
+ Atmospheric and well integrated soundtrack (ambient, electronic, drum and bass type stuff). Fits well with the gameplay without making the classic indie game mistake of loud music that's only 30 seconds long and plays on a loop. There's a great variety and it doesn't distract you from the game. The sounds that play as you perform actions in the game even blend in with the music, which is a nice touch.
+ Precise controls. You have a lot of air control. You have a lot of ability to react to things.
+ Lots of variety in how you can proceed through the level. There's a lot of room for creativity, especially once you master all the movement mechanics.
+ Cool atmosphere.
+ Consistently fun gameplay. There's very few pauses in the gameplay. When you die, you immediately get to try again.
+ Great flow. It's hard to describe it, but I just found myself constantly engaged throughout every stage.
+ FOV controls. I get motion sickness pretty easily and it wasn't a problem with this game.
+ Leaderboards and tons of replayability. Even if you don't want to compete on leaderboards, there's plenty of replayabilty in finding all the secrets and collectibles and I think you can even unlock stuff by doing that.

Cons:
- Difficulty in being aware of your hitbox. This is kind of a problem. To mitigate this, I think they tend to avoid situations where your knowledge of the hitbox is the key to getting through a section, and I think you get a sense of it as you play more, but it can still sometimes be frustrating when you collide with something or you miss somethign because you didn't have an accurate sense of where you were. However, I think that being aware of where you are in the world is just a part of the challenge and fun of the game, developing your spatial awareness skills. It's pretty impressive to think that, given only a 2d view, you can still quickly develop a rough understanding of where you are in 3d space.
- Potential for frustration. If you keep trying and failing on the same section over and over, you might get frustrated. They mitigate this by giving you a quick respawn time so you don't have time to be frustrated. I'm someone who gets frustrated easily, though, and I never had any really upsetting moments with this game. However, if you aren't actively noticing and figuring out why you died and what you should do differently, you'll probably get frustrated more easily. If you just play an autopilot and wonder why you keep dying, you may not have a good time with this. If you want to be able to clear certain sections, you really do need to devote some time to thinking about what to do. I think the checkpoint placement is just right, though. It gets farther apart as you get further in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000107679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1474121174}
review:
Good mechanics and tight controls but horrible pacing issues and constant bugs (shots going through the enemy, getting stuck on geometry and the floor) hamper the enjoyment. 

I don't understand why the devs made checkpoints so irregular. On some occasions you have to do multiple tricky jumps or timings to get to the checkpoint and after finally nailing it you are bombarded with checkpoints that can be accessed by doing one jump. It makes for very frustrating gameplay. I also checked out the current speedruns and these "extra" checkpoints that have been placed to the levels after longer segments don't serve any purpose. They only make the game's difficulty curve widly uneven and it seems like the devs didn't playtest the game on newcomers at all.

One more annoyance is that the world-state persists through your respawns and it makes some segments double in difficulty when you can't quickly reset the enemies or obstacles.

The final level / puzzles were neat and the linux version worked wonderfully (apart from the gameplay bugs that I assume are present on Windows as well)

Still, can't recommend for this price. Maybe 5 euros in it's current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027356182', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1509802691}
review:
An amazing game if you enjoy FPS platformers.  This took me back to the days of UT04 trials.  Only took me a little over two hours to beat the game, but it was a great experience.  Entire game was well crafted in terms of the difficulty.

I will say, however, that this a niche game.  If you don't like FPS platforming, or if you aren't good at it, the game will be extremely unforgiving and frustrating for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991362740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1473521002}
review:
[h1]About[/h1]

DeadCore is all about jumping puzzles. The main goal of the game is to get through 5 huge maps filled with all kind of objects you can jump on, can boost you or are there to kill you. Even though timing is key in this game, there are a few areas you can't visit without unlocking some upgrades first. The gameplay is really simple, yet challenging. If you love jumping puzzles and exploration, this game is certainly for you.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] Finally a game [i]only[/i] about jumping puzzles!
[*] You can feel as you get better and better
[*] Decent replayability to hunt down all remaining upgrades
[*] Fitting soundtrack
[/list]
[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] Environment textures and models are repetitive
[*] Disappeasing objects occasionally
[*] Kind of short
[*] Sometimes you lost orientation after turning gravity
[/list]
[h1]Rating[/h1]

8/10 — Very Good

author: {'steamid': '76561198008204482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1590868175}
review:
Игра интересная, и в то же самое время я её ненавижу, порой попадаются такие уровни, которые можно пройти раз этак с N-го(скорей всего трёхзначное число...) 
Очень динамично всё скачется, порой можно игнорировать основную дорогу и пропрыгать как желаешь сам, с другой стороны где эта самая дорога, никаких указателей нет, прыгай туда где что-то видишь, да и цель по сути не очень ясна, но всё равно интересно узнать что нас ждёт в конце этой башни
P.s. Ах да, забыл сообщить, по началу вы  будете прыгать по чекпоинтам, но чем дальше в лес тем больше дров, ведь так, а вот нифига, чем дальше вы упрыгали в игре тем реже вам будут попадаться те самые чекпоинты...

author: {'steamid': '76561198046311355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1627425464}
review:
Deadcore is a mesmerizing little game with a lot of big flaws. This one totally slipped past my radar, and if it was not for the great Humble Bundles I would have taken even longer to experience it. To start out, this game is MADE for VR. When VR hits I totally hope we see more games like this because the idea of jumping around some tower in the sky and doing puzzles in an FPS environment is basically what a lot of people are going to go crazy over in the virtual realm.

Outside of VR, the game is good but nothing all that great. I'd say the first two levels are enjoyable, and then their poorly tested and polished mechanics start to wear on you by level 3. By level 4 some of it becomes absurd to the point it's just RNG BS that I don't usually have time for. The anti-gravity mechanics are incredibly amateurish, and the enemies exist only to throw off your mechanics and actual logical skills, which in the end just serves to do almost nothing. I still don't understand the decision to have the enemies in this game. I would have preferred tougher puzzles with more fair checkpoints. 

The purple anti-gravity boxes are at times horribly implemented in this game, which makes the enemies RNG shots at you even more infuriating when they ruin good runs. The AG boxes grab you sometimes, they can't grab you even though you are in at others, they let you drop even though it clearly looks like you are in, and they switch between letting go and grabbing you if you enter them half the time which creates a seizure effect. They really should have made it so you need a certain amount of your body all the way in before it grabs you because what they have here just leads to frustration. It's my number one complaint, and sadly levels 4 and 5 are just full of this stuff with enemies galore everywhere.

Deadcore has good art direction, though the game was obviously made on a budget. There is nothing really here that is too shocking. You have your collectibles, your random story logs that are too few and far between to make much sense. You have a decent to really nice array of music tracks that are atmospheric and ambient for the most part.

The level design is fairly masterful at times and then horribly obtuse at others. Starting with level 3 there just becomes so many issues with acceleration, depth of field, and map design that I cannot recommend this to any but the hardcore platformer fans. It becomes a mess if you ask me. Try and die becomes the salient mechanism of learning, and yet it's not really fun to repeat a lot of sections in this game. The checkpoints get too spaced out, and you are stuck doing the same easy shit over and over until you finally realize what way you have to fall and jump dash in exactly the correct manner hoping the weird physics and enemies don't boost you somewhere else.

It doesn't help that you basically need to get upgrades that are randomly hidden in places to make these later levels bearable.I had only one ammo upgrade and the rocket+ by level 4, so it was not really all that easy.  Level 4 is a potent reminder that they had very few playtesters on this game. There are way too many large jumps in logic with too little time to make decisions in certain places. And then for the level just randomly ends after way too much BS. The  payoff could have at least been a nice view of what you just climbed through with or without your sanity. Instead it's so random you have to question if deadlines hurt this game. The falling through the blades sequence at the end of 4 into a quick jump and bump ending is just preposterous after the ordeal you just went through. It doesn't respect the player's time.

The mechanics for jumping seem pretty straightforward to me, but momentum and physics are a bit weird on a controller. By level 4 you will be wishing to play other games not from the difficulty, but from the sheer animosity of having to play all the stupid parts again and again to even see where you are supposed to go. It's simply broken level design that doesn't let you have any clue what you need to do. EXPLORE! Yeah, nobody has 20 hours for a game like this, so don't make us spend that much doing absolutely nothing of consequence. That is not to say that parts of this are not brilliant because they surely are. Don't forget that among my complaints.

You can use a controller with Xpadder--I use a DS4--or whatever other combination you want to try. Even though this is on consoles, controls are shit and often ask you to precisely do everything despite not having very precise inputs. Keyboard and mouse controls are obviously there too.

Jaggies are pretty harsh, and there seems to be no way to force supersampling for 1080p users. SGSSAA still has a ton of jaggies somehow. Poor graphical options don't do anything for image quality really. It runs pretty terribly all told.

Now later levels are probably the main issue of the game. It gets too congested and RNG to the point it's a put off to try and get through the game at times. You literally make it to checkpoints and have to ask yourself why was that so pointlessly obtuse? Why are the controls not more precise when they clearly want pixel perfect jumps? IDK. In the end it does bring down the experience when enemies are randomly shooting at you or red lasers are somehow just right there to get you on a nearly perfect run. You can't really see your path half the time in this convoluted design, and that is what makes all the weird timers of the anti-gravity sections explicitly ridiculous with a controller. There is always some kind of wind, laser, enemy, or just poorly implemented anti-gravity section to bring you down. Overall, this game could have used a lot of polishing and tuning.

In the end Deadcore slipped by a lot of people. And that is just too bad, because the platforming here is some of the best when it isn't trying to hamper your fun and enjoyment with a few awful design decisions and extremely poor controller support. I give it a 6.5/10. It's almost there, but I can't recommend this to anyone but fans because of the flaws. But for fans it's a great experience just come prepared. The atmosphere is top notch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171146837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 4458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1679262260}
review:
Deadcore is a game which is set in a metallic world with many hazards and surrounded by fog, and the music goes well with this atmosphere.

The gameplay is hard, you will fail many times but this is not bad because it feels rewarding to finally pass a level, and with more powerups you can go back to a level and get more items like logs, tracks.

So don't be put off by people saying it is too hard, they are challenges to overcome using speed, skill and patience.

So this is definitely worth a try, although it is not a casual play game much so if that is what you like then this may not be for you, if you like the speed, skill side of it, then do it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082985459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1439381321}
review:
I got this game in a humble bundle so didn't pay full price.

DeadCore is a first person platformer that for me just didn't feel right. The game is supposedly made for speed-running but to me that didn't seem to be the case. In a game so heavily focused on precision jumping the fact that i couldn't jump precisely (no fault of my own) isn't very good. Whenever i moved or jumped everything felt badly put together and just had a general feeling of just not right-ness. The in-game world is rather nice i suppose but shadowed by it's poor controls. If you're into speed running then maybe pick this game up but otherwise i'd leave it be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995669781', 'num_games_owned': 2420, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1470551910}
review:
Starts off fun enough! Great sense of speed, the platforming feels solid and like you can always tell where you're going. Figuring out where [i]to[/i] go is a little more challenging, but that's great! Exploration! Yeah!

And then you get to level 3 and there's those laser tunnels you have to dash through. And those take a few tries. Or a lot of them. And as much as fun as the game is, it's starting to get kind of frustrating. But you persevere, because you want to complete the game.

And then you get to level 4 and you get the ability to change gravity and all of a sudden the game becomes so damn disorienting that you have no idea where to go or what the heck is even going on. At least in a 2D platformer, all the information is laid out for you on screen. You are able to make the split-second decisions and reactions because you can clearly see where you are at and where you need to be. In first person 3D? Hah, Good luck with that. Yet, you somehow make it through, and there's moments where the mechanic actually works and is more fun than disorienting. Still, at the end you feel more exhausted than proud.

And then level 5 gives you that blast ability and you're supposed to pull off rocket jumps and maybe the game just doesn't explain the mechanic well enough or maybe you're too dumb for it because even after looking at YouTube videos you can't seem to figure it out and so you just give up because you're done investing time in this game that just doesn't seem to like you at all.

At least that's me. Plenty of people seem to love it. Good job, plenty of other people. Good job being really good at video games. For everyone else that's maybe even pretty decent at video games and has a high amount of patience for them (hey, I beat La-Mulana) but just isn't perfect at video games and does have a limit to their patience (heck no I'm not gonna attempt to beat Hell in La-Mulana), feel free to pick up this game. It's a fun and challenging few hours, but you probably [i]will[/i] walk away from it before you've beaten it, and that, to me, makes it something not worth recommending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156702647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 3449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1635507126}
review:
This game caught me by surprise and, oh my, how I've enjoyed it. Let me tell You. I found this randomly shuffling through games on steam and as soon as I saw the trailer I knew I HAVE TO play it. And I wasn't wrong, not one bit. DeadCore gave me exactly what I needed.

DeadCore is a combination of First Person Shooter and Puzzle game, but it's based on Your reflexes instead being like Portal for example. In DeadCore there is often no time to make careful decisions, You have to act, and You have to do it fast. Controls are perfectly responsive which is a BIG deal for a game like this. You're going to make a split second decisions about where to shoot or where to jump. Some people are talking about badly programmed gravity but it's not true. You'll get used to it almost immediately. Be aware tho, this game requires from You at least some skills in precision shooting. If You fail (And trust me You often will) that wasn't because the stage is designed poorly, but it was Your reaction that was timed badly.

Story mode is not very long, it takes about 2-3 hours on Your first playthrough. You'll likely to spend much more time on Speedrun mode, or looking for upgrades, ammo for Your gun, and what's most important... for Sparks that uncover different parts of the map and Logs that reveal the story. Of course, I won't say anything more to avoid spoilers but, for me, story is very well written and I've enjoyed every bit of it.

The only downside to this are enemies. I know why they were implemented, and the idea itself is good, makes the game more challenging but, oh god they're frustrating as shieet. It goes like this: You spend like 15 minutes mastering a set of jumps (involving gravity flips, avoiding lasers and such) and boosts, there is no checkpoint in sight and when You finally get over it covered in sweat and general hate for everything... You are happily welcomed by the sentinel who without any care in the world, "gently" pushes You off the ledge with his forcefield because You didn't saw him. And You have to do everything from the beginning. Luckily it doesn't happen that often, but still, can be very annoying. Sometimes You'll just have to know where enemies are to prepare accordingly.

I never knew I've waited for a game like this one, until I've played it.
Amazing atmosphere. Cool sci-fi design, very good graphics and fitting soundtracks, one for the Story mode and one for Speedrun mode, both containing different tracks but maintained in the same Ambient / Drum & Bass genres. Speedrun has more DnB since it supposed to pump You up to be as fast as possible. I just love electronic music in games so, to me it's gold.

I'll give this game a score of 8/10, because I often return to it, just to run around like a pro freerunner from the future, listening to amazing soundtrack and climb the leaderboards. I highly recommend DeadCore if You like fast paced puzzle shooters. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198123274922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1452505614}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988045318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1439, 'last_played': 1476468976}
review:
Brilliant platformer, I loved every second *cough* *cough* (mosquitoes anyone?)

The game offers so many possibilities to reach the top of the tower, it's awesome. Some routes are harder therefore faster, some require perfect handling/timing therefore shorter and others can be tricky. Sounds like all routes are hard? Kinda, especially if you are not used to such a fast-paced action. You will have hard times at the beginning but that's not a reason to give up. Controls are intuitive and your first lessons will be done quickly. As longer you play as more fun does it, as easier becomes the game.

I bought the game because it seemed to be a puzzler like Portal 2. The priority of the game is clearly the fast-paced action. Real puzzles are missing also when it gets tricky to figure a path sometimes or when you have to master the handling of your weaponry.

Every game has also its downsides... leaderboards are filled with times which has been achieved while using bugs/exploits. Therefore fight for the best times exclusively between your friends. Also worth mentioning, the game offers way too less content, at least it feels so because you want to play way more levels when you reached the top once.

Overall, definitely worth the bucks, can't wait for a sequel. :lol: Hope is the last thing to die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049520511', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1467631663}
review:
A great first-person platformer with a simple premise, smooth movement system, and a mysterious atmosphere.
Despite having a gun, fear not, as precision aim is not particularlly neccecary in most places thanks to the majority of the targets being large, obvious and easy to hit.
There's one thing that particularly stood out for me when playing this game though, and that's the deceptively open level design. There are many bits of geometry that feel both intentional and unintentional that, in combination with the skills you obtain, frequently allow you to tread outside of the normal path, sometimes granting you a shortcut, sometimes granting you a collectible, and other times being useless but giving you a small sense of triumph (as if to say "Take [b]THAT[/b], level designers!").

Story mode is rather short (beaten in about 2-3 hours), but there are a number of alternate maps in the speedrunning mode, as well as alternate paths within the story levels themselves, and a fair amount of collectibles, to keep you coming back if you should so be inclined to.

If you are, this oughta be worth full, or close-to-full-price.
If you ain't, then I'd wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997899437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1467601496}
