author: {'steamid': '76561197971331262', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1467567271}
review:
I'm torn in this game. It's pretty well made and the puzzles/challenges stay fresh throughout the game but there are a few major issues that could be easily cleared up. 

1. It's super easy to play through the whole game without realizing that you need to collect the "Sparks" in order to truly beat the game. It would seem that about 95% of people don't realize this and don't get the true ending. That said, getting the true ending doesn't unlock and extra level or anything, just a longer outro. 

2. Really this is the biggest issue for me, this game is damn hard. There are time where no amount of skill can help you with the obsticle ahead of you and things are simply left to chance. In one instance I had to run past some rotating lazer things and jump onto another platform with other rotating lazer things that would spawn at complete random right in front of me. No amount of skill could counter that, I just had to play through it repeatedly until I got lucky enough to get through without one spawning on me. There are also not enough checkpoints at time. You'll go through the game feeling like they are all over for a while and then you get to a place where you have to do 10 complex things quickly, in order, and you cant predict any of them, so you have to play it at least 10 times to familiarize yourself with all ten things. 

What this game needs: More Checkpoints. Remove few instances of pure luck based challenges. Make it super clear from the beginning that we need the sparks. 

I reccommend this if you can find it on sale but be warned, this game is seriously difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147211845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1467396515}
review: There are a few bugs (for example you can dash through walls) but it's still a very playable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048002635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1467548308}
review:
[b]DeadCore makes me feel like a speed run master.[/b]

[b]8/10[/b]

[b]Worth the price?:[/b]$10.99 is a decent price for the quality of game, but a sale wouldn't hurt. 

[b]PROS:[/b]
-Very nice visuals
-Plays smoother then silk
-Balanced difficulty curve
-Simple to get the hang of quickly
-Lots of routes and things to collect make levels very re-playable

[b]CON:[/b]
-Menus are bland [i](Only CON I could think of)[/i]

Playing this game is so smooth and enjoyable, it makes me feel like a professional speed runner by how quickly the game makes you feel like you are doing difficult things usually with little effort. Levels have lots of route options and each of those can usually be done multiple ways, some of which can feel like exploits but its hard to say if they actually are, that's how much freedom in your movement this game gives you. The game is fast paced and doesn't time you [i]unless you are going for high scores[/i] so there is no stress of trying to beat a clock, which makes such a fast game relaxing almost. I would recommend this game to hardcore and casual players as it caters to both perfectly. [i]Nyooooming[/i] through this game has been a joy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137447297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1468708130}
review: If your into quick paced puzzle platforming, and tons of trial and error in the process, this game is for you. Just be wary that those who aren't 100% adept at the movement scheme (such as myself) may get a headache along the way. None the less, this game is great, and I don't regret buying it during the summer sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054674251', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 338, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1453916517}
review:
Okay, this is an unfair review.

Let this be a warning to unfortunate people, like myself, who grew up (and continue) to use game controllers for FPS games. I knew there was no controller support when I bought this game, but in the end, I just don't have the keyboard-mouse skill to advance very far in this game.

Maybe I'll be able to pull it off one day... until then: Controller FPSers, beware.

EDIT (in reply to helpfulness of this review):

There's no neutral review, and I'm disappointed that I cannot play this game, so it's a negative. I feel that "negative" reviews on games with an overall "positive" rating (this game, has an 86% Very Positive rating) are more instructive than the "positive" reviews. Potential buyers read reviews before they read the forums in most cases. The caveat of telling review readers my opinion treats the game in an "unfair" manner and describing why clarifies my review rating. 

I'm not hating on the game, or giving a bad review out of buyer's spite. I suck at keyboard/mouse FPS controls and I wish there was controller support. Controller support is within the developer's control. I knew that going in there was no controller support, but I wasn't prepared for the high difficulty level of the FPS platforming. 

The difficulty in the game design is perhaps another point to let people know about. I made it through "A Story About My Uncle" (another FPS platformer) without a controller just fine, and didn't think that it would be a problem for DeadCore. But it was a problem, and I couldn't enjoy this game. I was hoping my experience could help people to understand that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071341001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1467215452}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110010173', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1572159996}
review: This is a superb platformer speedrun game that successfully ties in puzzle and FPS aspects alongside a tremendous atmosphere. The only problem I noticed is occasional lack of direction, but to observant players, this won't provide any trouble. I strongly recommend this game to anyone who likes fast-paced and/or platforming games, especially if you enjoyed A Story About my Uncle as the two games' gameplay are similar. For any sale price, especially the current one, this game is absolutely worth it (and $10 is alright if you buy primarily for the speedrunning aspect). I hope to see even more added to this game in the future. 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198126893757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1429, 'last_played': 1693040638}
review:
One of the best exploration and speedrun games..you're in an futuristic universe and going in a dreamlike adventure to reach a huge tower born from the void and you put your capabilities to the test...while revealing the secrets that lie beneath this mysterious world.
Unique, smart and very challenging game that boasts a personality at the same time modern and retro. If you don't fear its challenge,just give it a try.
-
Some notes for the players who own the game already :
At first, I was playing 1 level everyday & it takes more than an hour. But then, I'm doing well to finish the whole game in 2 or 3 hours.
Later, I saw the achievement about finishing the game in less than 1 hour, I thought it's possible to do it.. & I did it. :D
I just hope for a new version or update to make it multiplayer, not just competing with score & time race..but some levels that need cooperating..just like Portal 2

review: A really interesting platformer-FPS in which you have to navigate the various environments to not only beat your high scores, but also to uncover the story behind why you're here. author: {'steamid': '76561198069587448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1526524655}
review: After one almost 4 hour sitting I can safely say that this game will immerse and engage you...right up until the enemies that push you around bring all pacing to a violent tooth grinding sphincter clenching halt. The levels themselves are quite nice and the game looks great. The puzzles are quite fun as well. However, when you need to complete them n number of times in the hope that all things will align just so is a little maddening. Yes you can time the puzzels themselves, its just the enemies that are unpredictable and will bounce you off the course. Sorry, it's late, rants done. So yes buy it, especially on sale.

review:
Great game. Kept me going for hours.

The story is relatively short (if you could even call it a story) [spoiler] and the ending kinda sucks (even if you get all the 'sparks') [/spoiler],
but that is [b] NOT [/b] why you should buy the game.

You should only buy this game [b] IF [/b] you're a fan of puzzles and speedrun parkour.
As someone with more than 9 hours on this game (at the time of posting), I can tell you it is great for that and will keep you coming back as you try to perfect your time again and again.

Have fun if that's your kinda thing. :-D

author: {'steamid': '76561198010266241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1465766351}
review: Surprisingly fun and well developed indie FPS platformer/speedrunner. Very intense and challenging platform action with some pretty crazy puzzles thrown in as well. It's only 5 levels, but expect a grueling 1-2hrs each to complete levels 4 and 5. I have a great sense of pride knowing that I was able to complete this game that has defeated a slew of casual gamers, haha. The satisfaction at the end is definitely worth the frustration as you grind your way through from checkpoint to checkpoint. At times I noticed my elevated heart-rate from the intensity of playing this game. Pretty decent visuals, great music, and a heck of a fun challenge if you have it in you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994385979', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1466373346}
review:
This game is stupidly difficult, punishing, fast paced, but completely fair. There's no point in the game that I've found where it kills you and it's not totally your own fault. And it kills you. A lot. There are rare moments when the game is not actively trying to kill you.

Super Meat Boy level masochism is required to play and enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022364815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1465113590}
review: Very annoying game. Not afraid to put obstacles in your way that require you to know them before hand. Not fun, coming from somebody who likes speedrunning things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057100534', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1465109191}
review: If you like hard and frustrating games then this is the perfect game for you. Imagine a really tough minecraft parkour map with slow shooting turrets whose bullets just push you, laser walls, moving laser walls and flying cubes that can use a wave attack that simply pushes you. And that's just from what I've experienced in the short time I spent playing this game, I shutter thinking of what other obstacles they've added to the game. If you see this and like what you've read thus far then don't think, just buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068982092', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1434255441}
review:
I just don't like this kind of platformer/speedrun game. It feels like a fps custom map rather than a game about speedrunning.

If you wonder what I mean, check out Cloudbuilt. It has features like wall running, boosting and grabing ledges that make it feel like a much better speedrunning game than jump, crouch and shoot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042030755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1512080316}
review:
I feel slightly conficted on this game. I like the visuals, controls and puzzle aspect of DeadCore, but I don't like the emphasis on trying to complete levels as fast as possible and flawlessly. It feels like if Portal 2 had less thinking involved, a ton more cognitive coordination required, and an emphasis on speeding through each level. 

Something else rather critical to point out: there's not really a story from what I've seen so far. Basically there's nothing to motivate you to complete the game beyond just for the sake of beating it. The bare gameplay mechanics are not enough for me to keep coming back to complete it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064375483', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1487857137}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992814416', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1464136371}
review: I enjoy games with simple mechanics and an emphasis on speedrunning. But this game suffers from the same issues as Cloudbuilt in that it is far too complex. I only managed to get up to level 4 and I gave up half way through it because rather than offering lots of small simple levels, the levels are vast and complex and a nightmare to navigate. It is not easy (at least for me) to find which way to go as there are lots of paths. There are also far too many environmental death traps to navigate. By the time you get to level 4 it's no longer about being quick, but actually just getting through the game. Where Cloudbuilt fails because of its complex environments, extreme pace and many enemies, it at least manages to keep levels short and makes it clear that being fast is what's important. Deadcore, on the other hand, fails because it offers collectibles and long levels. The only thing that makes it remotely apparent that this is a speedrunning game is the timer on your weapon. I'm not sure if I misunderstood the game, but it seems to be that this is more of a "deathtrap navigation puzzle" game than one in which you are under time pressure; at least in the first run. The core mechanics are very promising, as is the general aesthetic and design. But it suffers from complexity which makes it difficult to enjoy and recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143034343', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1455311825}
review:
Challenging platformer with enigmatic story. Very well done.

There is a puzzle element to obtaining the collectibles, but DeadCore focuses mostly on execution. It is really cool to watch a speedrunner play this game. The world is oddly beautiful just as it is portrayed in the story. Overall, worth a play, but if you're not great at platformers and you want the story, get a friend who's good at platformers to play it for you, so you can marvel at the beautiful level designs and enjoy the music while they do the hard work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005899343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1463792257}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021996469', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1463307704}
review:
A very well made speedrun focused first person platformer. The graphics are appealing, the movement feels great and it has some very satisfying levels. It took me about 3 hours to complete the campaign of 5 levels (time will vary for a game like this of course), but there is replay value added by the speedrunning component. 

If you don't like dying a lot and gradually perfecting your route, DeadCore probably isn't for you. If you are at all interested however, I would recommend picking it up considering it's price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033260153', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 3165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1215, 'last_played': 1561587308}
review:
Je suis un amateur de jeux de plateformes et je peux dire que celui-ci ne m'a pas déçu ! Une fois le dash débloqué on retrouve des sensations de vitesse et de fluidité vraiment plaisante. A l'instar de SuperMeatBoy le jeu n'est jamais frustrant et on prend du plaisir à recommencer encore et encore les différents passage.
Chose importante à noter, la diversité des chemins possibles. Bien souvent deux itinéraires sont possibles mais on peut en trouver bien d'autres en utilisant intelligemment le décor. Le jeu met donc notre réactivité, notre inventivité et notre dextérité à rude épreuve si l'on veut réaliser de meilleurs temps.
Au niveau des graphismes, le jeu ne déçoit pas et propose des rendus magnifiques, surtout pour un jeu semi-indé. Mention spéciale aux éclairages tout à fait sublimes.
Les commandes sont paramétrables et un mode speedrun est disponible si jamais on veut tenter de se mesurer aux autres joueurs du monde entier sur un rank mondial.
Quelques petits bémols sont à noter cependant, bien que subjectifs peut-être : la répétitivité des ambiances, le peu de niveaux disponibles, une bande son un peu en retrait malgré le rythme soutenu du jeu.
C'est une très bonne pioche pour les amateurs de jeu de plateforme !

author: {'steamid': '76561198071097389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1461165390}
review:
a tratti snervante. cattivo e senza pietà. concepito per mettere a dura prova la pazienza del giocatore. un videogioco vecchia maniera.

leggevo che qualcuno lo paragonava a portal.. in realtà non c'entra niente, eccezion fatta per il designe del "fucile", simile ma manco troppo..
comunque questo è un gioco di ABILITA', non di logica.

gameplay adrenalinico, impetuoso e mai noioso (nonostante le centinia di respown ad ogni livello) e, come già detto, sempre molto impegnativo.

ottimo il level designe, spesso offre più strade per raggiungere l'obbiettivo, se a queste poi si aggiungono (rare)scorciatoie non previste, scoperte un pò a cvlo un pò per rassegnata disperazione che ci porta a cazzeggiare per il livello di turno, si avrà quindi che ne risulta un gioco meno lineare e molto rigiocabile.

la colonna sonora è decisamente varia e ben contestualizzata, con la possibilità di sbloccare nuove tracce ad ogni livello.

ogni tanto si presenta qualche strano bug, solitamente passeggero(scompare dopo un pò da se), ma il più delle volte facilità semplicemnte il compito del giocatore e quindi lo si perdona volentieri :D

ps. il gioco lo si può finire anche senza trovare nessuno dei potenziamenti nascosti, ma di sicuro male non fanno:P

author: {'steamid': '76561198054902790', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1413927306}
review:
DeadCore s'adresse à un public très particulier, un public qui est doté de patience, de persévérance et pourquoi pas d'une passion pour le Speedrun. Le jeu est loin d'être insurmontable mais jouera très certainement avec vos nerfs. Il est néanmoins extrêmement gratifiant de réussir à terminer un niveau quel que soit le temps mis pour le faire. Les fans d'exploration seront également conquis avec quelques objets à collecter au sein des différents niveaux aux univers variés. On regrettera que seuls cinq parcours soient proposés mais pour la dizaine d'euros demandée ce jeu vaut clairement le coup si vous remplissez les critères susmentionnés tant il offre de possibilités.

Test complet : http://aquab0n.fr/2014/10/test-deadcore.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198083930000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 1363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1459082266}
review:
본인처럼 발컨트롤을 가진 사람도 어느 정도 죽다 보면 어느새 타이밍을 알게 되고 길을 찾을 정도의 적절한 난이도를 갖고 있는 게임입니다. 그리고 게임성도 좋지만 그에 못지 않게 주위 풍경과 그래픽을 보는 재미가 있는 게임이죠. 


좋다고 생각한 부분

1. 진행을 포기하게 만들 정도로 어렵게 만드는 게임도 있는데, 
적어도 DeadCore는 그런 류가 아니다. 

2. 3D 플랫포머와 퍼즐을 결합한 게임들이 많은데, 
이 게임은 온전히 플랫포머만 집중하고 퍼즐/전투에 대한 요소를 제외했다.

3. 그래픽 출력에 대한 최적화가 잘 되어있고, 
주위 풍경과 여러 오브젝트들이 몰입도를 높여준다.


개인적으로 아쉬운 부분

1. 파고들기(일명 야리코미) 를 할 만한 요소가 적다. 
메인 게임 이후에 스피드런은 딱히 매력적이지 않다.

2. 로그(Log)만으로는 설정이나 세계관을 파악하기 힘들다. 
로그를 읽어도 게임에서 볼 수 있는 내용과는 동떨어진 느낌.

3. 엔딩이 어떤 상황인지, 무슨 뜻인지 전혀 모르겠다. 
캡션까지는 아니라도 음성이라고 나왔으면 더 좋았을껄

author: {'steamid': '76561198196055702', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1689011257}
review: simply amasing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139919686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1505169136}
review:
Pour avoir joué à pas mal de jeu de plate-forme depuis la NES, je peux vous dire que Deadcore est un très bon jeu en vue à la première personne et original qui plus est, il cumul les bons points malgré deux défauts.


Les qualités:
- Le jeu est beau, le style graphique est simple et original.
- La bande-son est excellente et colle très bien au jeu.
- Les commandes fonctionnent parfaitement et correspondent parfaitement au gameplay et aux parcours.


Les défauts:
- Pas d'indication sur le niveau de difficulté de certaines parties des niveaux qui son très costaudes voire particulièrement dures (vive le glichte).
- Ça manque de niveaux à mon goût, je m'attendais à un plus grand nombre.


L'histoire est assez secondaire et sommaire, bien qu'originale, mais l'univers de ce jeu aurait mérité plus de profondeur et il y a une carte à jouer la-dessus.


J'ai réussis à découvrir toutes les étincelles, tous les logs et toutes les musiques, il ne me manque plus qu'à trouver deux compétences pour le SwitchGun et c'est bon. Vu mon handicap et les conséquences engendrées, je trouve ça pas mal.


Globalement, je recommande ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105378027', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1655395823}
review:
Pro:
-Nicht zu schwer und auch nicht zu leicht (Es gibt natürlich Stellen wo man länger braucht).
-Für Jump and Run Fans ein sehr gutes Erlebnis.
-Man kommt schnell rein.
-Es fühlt sich gut an wenn man so weit springen kann.
-Sieht gut aus.
-Wenn man stirbt muss man nicht lange warten bis man respawnt
-Checkpoints sind fair gesetzt
-Es gibt immer paar versteckte Sachen zu entdecken.

Con:
-Für mich sind es zu wenige Level.
-Kaum Updates.
-Kann man leider gut glitchen

Für läppische 10€ ist das Spiel sehr gut. Und es sollte bekannter werden.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004562592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1489528888}
review: Mechanics are way too random at times and impossible to learn and repeat, so they require trial and error, a very bad design decision in a game focusing on speedrunning.  When there is no chance to memorize and improve there is nothing left but to pray that the gods of RNG will look favorably upon you.  Music is nice, and so are most of the game mechanics but the RNG makes it impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084993222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1557780105}
review:
Overall, fun to play. Some sections towards the end are quite difficult but I guess that's the idea. In the last level, each of the 3 sub-levels could have had an extra savepoint in the middle, otherwise I think the savepoint distribution was fair. The level design is clever and doesn't feel dragged out or repetitive. The story mode took me 10 hours to beat for the first time.
The "instant respawn"-key is a very good idea.

The soundtrack is fitting and creates a nice atmosphere in combination with the relatively simple, but pretty graphics. I recommend to play this game with headphones.

In scenes where you are falling down or are being pulled up by inverted gravity and have to look up/down to shoot enemies or avoid obstracles, the game's controls have a gimbal lock problem. I'm not sure how to solve that, but aiming is quite difficult like this. Other than this small issue, I found the controls to be precise and predictable.

In general enemies in some places feel a bit unnecessary, they add a hard-to-control randomness which sometimes leads to "just do the same thing again and hope the enemy is elsewhere this time" being a successful strategy. I find it especially questionable to have "defeated" enemies lie around as huge obstracles at relatively random locations, that is often more disturbing than the actual alive enemies.

On Linux make sure to install lib32-alsa-plugins as this is a 32 bit application, otherwise you will have no sound.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972321969', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1468081391}

author: {'steamid': '76561198092262367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1561953842}
review:
So, for everyone else complaining about difficulty, the learning curve becomes difficult after level 4 (because I understand that switching gravity is no joke), and the game can take around 4 hours and once you master it, in less than an hour; I love it, it's extremely well done, nice reactive movement control, there is plenty of room for shortcuts to skip puzzles once you get used to the environment, you can actually kind of fly, dash through the sky most likely, play with your momentum during mid air, which is more noticeable in the big final level.

This game is not just for fps speedrunners, you can take your time and that's what I did, I actually got 25 hours because I was afking, but completing the game with achievements (this game is my first, i'll tell you), takes around 15 - 20 hours top, also the achievements are not some grindy bullsh*t like in many other games, in fact they are challenging and you will get half of them during your first playthrough.

It's highly advisable to make speedrun maps AFTER de main story (getting all the songs is a plus but some during speedrun are just meh), also it's vital to learn how to use blast jump (however I  didn't know that there was a Blast upgrade until my second playthrough lol) it's as difficult as using "speed boost jump" from super metroid, timing your blast to the floor and jumping at the same time it's a bit ticky.

Oh finally the soundtrack... Sweet soundtrack for the most part, really atmospheric, I would recommend ascension (20 minute long song from level 5) at around minute 0:10:00, best part in the whole game in my opinion.

I hope 5-Bits games make another indie title as good as this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038085628', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1458771079}
review:
I love games like this, despite their occasionally infuriating nature.

Recommended to those who enjoy time trials and challenges such as Source engine surfing, bunny-hopping or rocket jumping. Though Deadcore doesn't offer the same mechanics exactly, it brings the same kind of feel and difficulty to a game that is more similar to Portal 2 (in style). Also some exploration is required for (full) completion as there are collectibles throughout the game and multiple paths to be found.

Something I noticed in the negative reviews was that the game was "hardcore" in difficulty and that sometimes failure was unexplained. I just wanted to say that firstly, the difficulty is no extreme when compared to the Source challenges described above but obviously don't expect to do everything first try. For me, having to have multiple attempts is part of the fun. It describes itself as a speedrunning game, so you would expect to have to figure out the fastest way to do each section. As for dying without reason I have no idea what they could be talking about. Red lasers kill you. Sometimes you get moved into them but you can plan to avoid those things (i.e. some enemies or obstacles). Everything is easy enough to figure out.

It's got a nice distopian theme that the 'log' collectibles help to build (despite the fairly unrefined writing). The story is only really told through these 'logs', and nicely leaves a lot to the imagination. Good music and visuals. The lot.

The main game only takes a few hours to complete - other levels are unlocked by finding 'spark' collectibles in the main game which will give you a lot more playtime and are better as time trial challenges compared to the main levels. After finishing these also, I was half expecting there to be a level editor but there was no such thing. I feel games like this benefit greatly from community made levels but unfortunately it was not the case here.

However I would say Deadcore was worth the money anyway for someone as described above [spoiler](as somebody who never really buys games unless they're on sale (I got it for £1.99))[/spoiler].

author: {'steamid': '76561197972209205', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1954, 'last_played': 1620460778}
review:
Van egy jókora torony akadálypályákkal körülvéve és az egész lebeg a felhők között, azt kell megmászni, de nem kézzel-lábbal, hanem ugrálva, vannak ehhez kihelyezve ilyen dobbantók vagy mik, amik magasra feldobnak. Vannak viszont olyan falak, amiken hatalmas kapcsolóval a fal felé irányíthatjuk a gravitációt, így fejjel lefelé is lehet közlekedni. Alatta lézerháló helyezkedik el, ami megsüt, ha ráesünk, de az akadálypálya is rendesen tele van lézerekkel. Van egy fegyverünk, amivel ki-bekapcsolhatunk dolgokat, így az ellenségeket is, de őket csak egy-két másodpercre, fejleszteni is lehet különböző eldugott kristályokkal vagy mikkel. Vannak mentési pontok, amelyek amellett, hogy halál utáni kezdőpontként szolgálnak, feltöltik a lőszert és magasabbra hozzák a lézerhálót (nem mindig jó ezekre állni, mert sok titkos részt elérhetetlenné tesznek).
A grafika nagyon szép, a zene annyira nem, de nagyon passzol a környezethez, 5.1 van, de többnyire csak az ellenségek vehetők ki belőle. Történet az nem nagyon van, inkább csak puzzle jellege van és nem is annyira gond kitalálni, merre kell menni, inkább az a nehéz, hogy sok esetben milliószor kell próbálkozni.
El lehet lenni vele, de azért lehetett volna több pálya is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002149638', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1474468393}
review:
Solid, fun, fast-paced FPS platformer. Recommended if you like trying over and over again to beat your own times. 

The single-player "story" is also a surprisingly engaging time. The whole series of levels are platform puzzles surrounding a massive tower, and as you progress, you end up climbing higher and higher, able to look down at the levels you did before. It's actually really cool, and the devs seem to have put some proper effort into the game's atmosphere -- it really sucks you in sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040934941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1457389035}
review: It's a fun and interesting game, but you can't beat the 4th level, because the gravity keeps breaking on you, and not keeping you on the level of gravity you need to be on to beat the level or to even progress....

author: {'steamid': '76561198074939767', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1521240494}
review:
A very fun game. A good mix of parkour and platforming with an FPS type feeling to it. It's challenging without being straight out annoying, and the level designs allow you to sometimes find your own path instead of following the meant one. Also, since there's no downside with death besides going back a little ways, it allows to explore. And it's a gorgeous game. 
However, there are a few con'. Some of the level designs require precision, while the mechanics aren't meant to be precise, making deaths sometimes a little too common. Because of this, you often spend more time looking at the ground to see where you're going instead of the amazing looking world. And the difficulty curve can be a little much at times.
However, it's still an enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125692588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1508180003}

Tiene diferentes mecánicas que irás descubriendo conforme juegas que harán que tu experiencia de juego no sea monótona. En definitiva, un juego muy recomendable.

review:
Very good game with very challenging levels after you get to chapter three.

Pros: 
Good graphics
Challenging gameplay
Unique parkour/fps style
Good value for money

Cons:
It could benefit in the long run from the inclusion of steam workshop so users can make their own maps and people can keep playing the game years after they bought it rather than letting it go as soon as they finish the campaign


Overall it's a very good game and I would recommend it to anyone with a bit of money sat aside.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972584572', 'num_games_owned': 1637, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1456094338}
review:
BEATEN (All 5 Levels) - 5 hours

Deadcore is a platforming-based speedrunning game not entirely unsimilar to Cloudbuilt.  You pick up some powers as you progress including:
- A gun that can turn some stuff on/off in levels.
- Double jump
- A super fast dash
- A few others

You dont need to speedrun it. In fact, you will likely feel accomplished just making it through most of the areas. 

Not a bad game at all. Pretty good fun in fact.

Cons:
- Can be quite difficult (and thus frustrating)

author: {'steamid': '76561198167571838', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1648836094}
review:
Il ne faut pas jouer tant que ça à Deadcore pour se rendre compte de la richesse de son gameplay et de son univers.

Dans un monde fait de cubes, onirique, surréaliste et plongé dans les brumes, on gravit une gigantesque tour garnie d'innonbrables obstacles dont on peut se débarasser avec le pistolet.

On franchit des hauteurs vertigineuses avec le jumper, on esquive les lasers, on désactive les pièges temporairement, on saute un peu partout, le tout dans un univers éblouissant aux graphismes sublimes sur une musique sci-fi très bien composée.

Le côté artistique est très bien travaillé, c'est le moins qu'on puisse dire : des graphismes épatants pour un jeu créé sous Unity, une bonne performance, un style graphique addictif, une bande-son travaillée et des effets sonores immersifs.

Côté gameplay, les sensations de vitesse sont très bien ressenties, on devient vite accro à toutes ces plateformes sur lesquelles monter et à tous ces engins à activer. On se désintègre, on réessaye, on observe son environnement pour trouver une autre sortie ...

DeadCore mérite plus de succès qu'il ne l'a déjà : si vous êtes fan de Portal ou même de Mirror's Edge, vous adorerez ce jeu. De plus, son prix ridiculement bas en fait un jeu accessible.

En bref, je recommande ce jeu. La bise !

review:
美术风格很不错，至少我很喜欢

但是物理引擎表示无力(全程在飘)，时不时给你飞个方块拍你熊脸也是有点小吓人。。

没有任何解谜元素，完全是找路，加上躲避一路上千方百计阻止你的各种障碍，还有这游戏很多场景能把你搞晕(第一关有个旋转的场景，把我绕的想吐。。)

话说这枪还能机瞄。。又没有敌人感觉有点鸡肋啊

虽然槽点这么多，不过就冲这美术风格，我就给个好评了！

author: {'steamid': '76561197996322466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1443843431}
review:
Brilliant graphics and gameplay that's οrgasmically similar to the Metroid Prime series.
Has some very fun gravity-warping mechanics.
BUT: The main flaw for my tastes is the steep difficulty and the nature of the difficulty.
Basically: I just couldn't get the hang of the rocket-jumping mechanic when it was introduced, and I gave up at that stage.

Also there's zero story if that matters to you. "Will you be able to reveal the secrets that lie beneath this fog-ridden world?" No, because there are none. It's a tower of blocks. The blocks can be fun, but the game's description alluding to lore is deceptive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074222798', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1621082069}
review:
!!! СРОЧНО БРАТЬ, пока скидка!!!

об игре:
Если убрать из PainKiller всех зомби, и сделать из локаций один сплошной лабиринт, получится очень похоже.

Однако мой мосг начал ломаться на уровнях с гравитацией, все что до них - тьфу. Нахрапом, за раз пройти не смог.

+ Куча секретов, начиная чуть ли не с самого начала
+ Сложная
+ Нет миниигр, дополнительных головоломок, итд. Есть только ты, пушка, и место, куда тебе надо попасть. Дальше думай сам

- Поначалу мрачновата, через полчаса привык
- Долбаная гравитация.

Превосходно для 75 рублей и крайне неплохо для полной цены в 250 рублей
9/10

review:
A great start and an utterly terrible finish. 

This game starts extremely strongly but fast, reactive play is soon replaced by a boring grind of trial and error. When the terribly implemented gravity puzzles came into play I knew there was no coming back.

Fortunately the game came with a timer so I can at least refund. A real shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094286575', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1496838415}
review: Un très bon jeu de parcours , une fois l'aventure fini , le mode speedrun est impec pour ceux qui recherchent du défi

author: {'steamid': '76561197967639159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1458013461}
review:
1 very good and 1 very bad review:

Good - If you've played jumpmaps on Quake (or perhaps surf CS) and Portal you gonna LUV this! 
The game "goes" as fast as you can manage it and I love that. There's a lot of side-jumping to find hidden items and you can also "glitch" a lot by jumping on edges. which actually makes the game more fun than feeling it's broken. 

Bad - Only thing I can't talk well about are the requirements, they're off the wall. I'm running 6core 3.2 CPU, 6BG RAM and HD 5500 1GB. But I can only play this game on LOW and on the absolute LOWEST resolution which sucks b*lls. At least the game runs smooth then and it looks like it's 10 years old, but I dont mind that much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983619842', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1563681332}
review:
[h1]"RUN,JUMP,CLIMB"[/h1]。単純に言えばそんな感じか。
あまりにもピュアにアクション性を追求したものであり、自分がゲームオンチかどうかはっきりとわかってしまうタイプのゲームである。
2Dのプラットフォーマ―ゲームをやりこんだ人なら時間を忘れて没頭してしまうだろう。

敵は兵士ではなくマップ中に仕掛けられたトラップだ。敵らしい敵といえば2面以降で登場する"どついたろかマシーン(仮称)"だろうか。
幾何学模様のような背景はとても美しくSSを撮るだけでもいい感じに画になるので楽しい。

このレビューを書いている時点で筆者は3面をクリアしたばかり。すでにrespawn数は200に迫り、そのうち100回以上は「触ったら死んじゃうレーザー(仮称)」で炙られている。最終面をクリアするまで先は長そうだ。

('16/02/10追記)
やっと全5面をクリアした。それまでのdeath / respawn数は677回に達し、見事「Digital BBQ」の実績を解除しましたとさ。めでたしめでたし。
ルールがシンプルでありながら、しかしそれゆえにトラップを切り抜けるためにわずかな狂いも許されない正確な動きやタイミング合わせなどシビアなゲーム観は往年のプラットフォーマ―そのものだった。あ、さっきも言ったなこれ。

銃撃戦に飽きて、広大な景色の中を飛んだり跳ねたり回ったり、ロボットにどつかれたりDigital BBQされちゃいたい人におすすめです('ω')ｖ

author: {'steamid': '76561198074240857', 'num_games_owned': 3163, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1590280347}
review:
[h1]Summary:[/h1]
Deadcore was a simple yet well crafted platforming game that required high precision and skill to complete. The game feels very polished and well rounded. The story is pretty bare, which is fine because that isn't the game's main focus at all. The main goal is to get to the top of the tower using coordination, puzzle solving, and some minor FPS elements to disable enemies or traps. The campaign doesn't take too long, however speedrunning the levels can get very addicting. This game uses tight controls and good level design (most of the time) to provide an enjoyable experience to the player, casual or hardcore.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*]Good graphics and world design to emmerse the player in the game. While it's nothing phenominal, it's definitely above average.
[*]The puzzles and level design provide for entertaining gameplay and feel very fluid despite being very challenging at times.
[*]Tight controls make the platforming feel fair and fun to play.
[*]Speedrunning modes to put your skills to the test. It compares you on the global leaderboard and on your friendslist leaderboard.
[*]The extra pickups are very well hidden and are a great addition for completionists.
[/list]

[b]Neutral:[/b]
[list]
[*]The music is decent and adds to the atmosphere of the game. While it isn't the best soundtrack I've ever heard, it definitely fits the genre and helps keep a steady rhythm while you're playing.
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]The enemy placement can be a bit frustrating in the final few levels.
[/list]

[h1]Overall:[/h1]
8.2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998056243', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1453853496}
review:
The game is locked internally at 50 fps. This means that even though your fps counter may show 60 (or whatever your maximum refreshrate allows), the game still actually renders only 50fps. The whole engine is locked at 50. If you play on a 60Hz screen, 10 frames will be repeated, creating a tremendously uncomfortable headache experience. The game is supposed to be fast paced. At the moment, you either play the game with the screen set to 50hz (or 100....if you are lucky) so that you can match the game framerate (you will have to deal with input lag at 50Hz).....or you don't.

I chose the latter. It is supposed to be a fast paced game, it would be impossible (or just uncomfortable, at least for me) to play it at anything below 60fps. Despite many requests from the users, the developers never tried to do anything since release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060355664', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1453862259}
review:
Before you decide to play this game you must ask yourself ... "Do I get angry/frustrated very easily?" If you answered YES to this question then stop right here and turn away slowly. If you answered NO to this question then get ready to die, then respawn, and then die again and respawn. 

This is one of the hardest games i have played in a long time. You have to watch your movements very carefully and watch your back at all times.. one wrong step and your repeating. If you have ever played portal, then picture if you will, one of the higher level puzzles, you have to jump and while your falling open a portal and then when you enter you have to open another to get higher just to reach your platform.. this is sorta like that but x10 lol .. This difficulty almost rivals Dark Souls in such a way that you almost want to go play Dark Souls cause it might be easier at times.

If you think you can handle jumping puzzles and shooting while jumping without being able to stop for more than a second then go for it i dare you.. No i challenge you to play this game and see how far you can climb the spires of DeadCore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969364344', 'num_games_owned': 1670, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1452923917}
review:
Platformer. Part zen, part reflex, part frustration. Besides making a mental map of where to go, the challenge is mostly in stringing together multiple split-second reflex actions. This is broken up by many easier parts, hence the zen. It's actually pretty relaxing, up until you get to one of those "do these six things in a row without screwing up once" parts.

I've been playing ~1 level per night. It's just the right size for me. I wish checkpoints were a little more frequent. It's by no means super difficult, but replaying some of the same sections over and over can get a little tedious. Usually it doesn't take longer than 15 minutes to get past a major challenge, but I prefer the more relaxed sections. If I want tougher platformer, there's stuff like Cloudbuilt for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008873552', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1440270308}
review:
If you were born sometime in early 90's or a little earlier, you were propably a teenager when the best multiplayer shooters and thir modding scene lived their golden age. Before the age of DLCs, stripped of modding support, where games were accepted and loved "as is" and it was just that, instead of continous tracking of the developers on various forums, having all kinds of outragous postrelase changes and hated additions, mandatory microtransactions or always online forcing for no reason... those were the days.

DEADCORE, is definitly a game that time travelled ahead of it's age. It's simplistic, pure, does what it does as is from the (virtual) box and have this great retro feeling lingering in it's atmosphere, while it takes advantage of some modern features is a good way (such as steam workshop integrated so downloading player created content is easier than it was back then).

GAMEPLAY is rather simple - it's a speedrunner puzzle platformer, much like Portal, only without portals. The gameplay is fast, forgiving in a just comfortable time period to achieve the feeling of progress, just to throw in the good old ruthlessly precision demanding sections every now and then. You will fail, you will die, and you will retry over and over again because it's fast, engaging and fun down in it's core gameplay. Retrying takes less than a second and you'll never face a painfully long to skip game over screen, and this paired up with the excellent fluid gameplay, the surprisingly artistic abstract level design (it plays a more functional part in the whole, so a portal-like minimalistic thing would work great, but still it manages to show some jawdropping backgrounds), the sometimes logic, sometimes speed and skill, but usually both demanding gameplay makes DEADCORE a worthy challanger to Portal and similar games.

Two negatives here, sadly strenghtening each other: DEADCORE, has no story. I'm not saying this is bad, because it doesn't needs one. Or a coherent universe, or characters and any kind of conversation, it's pure perfect gameplay only. Still, that is likely the first thing that keeps it back from being more widely known and appriciated for what it does. Second thing, is actually the same as the first - motivation. When you are in the game, it's absolutely fantastic gameplay hooks you in - but when you finally quit, you'll never really have any motivation to launch it again the day after. I'm totally in love with speedrunner FPS mods for various oldschool multiplayer FPS games like Quakes etc. and DEADCORE is excellent at that, but as a singleplayer game it lacks the motivation multiplayer games offer with the presence of other players (online leaderboards aren't that motivating for many). The puzzles wouldn't have a place here then because you'd see others doing it so it's instantly solved, but it and also lacks the minimalistic interaction or feedback with/from... anything (like GLaDOS) and the lack of either is really leaving an empty space that isn't filled and it really feels.

If these aren't a problem for you and you are looking for a great modern game that gives away this retro skillful smart speedrunner vibe, look no futher. 

DEADCORE, is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054539549', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1599665353}
review:
인류는 지구를 망치고 그 자신들이 망쳐놓은 지구를 버렸습니다.

하지만 다른 거주지를 찾지 못하자 잠시 우주에 머물며 지구를 개선하기로 합니다.

그래서 시작한것이 안티-라이프 프로젝트입니다.

그동안 쓸데없이 창조해낸 기계들과 인간이 살아간 흔적, 그 이외의 유기물 모두, 즉 지형빼고 전부 파멸시키는 계획을 세웁니다.

그 뒤 지구를 다시 채워넣는 계획을 한거죠.

거대한 기둥을 세우고 그를 기준으로 닿기만 해도 허용되지 않는 물질은 사라지는 장막을 펼칩니다.

지구의 밑 바닥부터 시작하는 플레이어는 이 프로젝트로 제거되는 하나의 안드로이드중 하나입니다.

하지만 이 안드로이드는 사랑하는 사람이있었나, 아무튼 감정이 있어서 반드시 살아남아 이 파멸을 멈추려고 합니다.

과연. 당신(안드로이드)은 그저 파멸을 막지못하고 죽을것인가요? 아니면 그래도 남아있는 지구의 생명체와 다른 안드로이드들의 삶을 이어줄것인가요?

그 결과는 당신이 가진 활성화 총에 달려있습니다!



P.s. 위 스토리는 픽션입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156840695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1605381478}
review:
I do have to praise the asthetics of this game. And the ending was kind of cool.

Now for the negatives (disclaimer: my computer is a few years old and is not a gaming PC)...

If you played Portal, and thought this would be more of that sort of fun (as I did), you should know that this game is not like Portal. In Portal, the levels were basically designed for you to succeed once you figure out the puzzles. In this game, there are more demands on the user to get the right timing, the proper precise movement/alignment, and to react quickly to everything around you. Also, in Portal, you would probably die a few times as you go through it, but your respawn checkpoint was always close so you didn't lose much progress. Not so here; completing a section requires a series of complex maneuvers where you can easily screw up one of the steps. I died a total of 1,034 times my first time through this game. So, if you enjoy a trial and error process where you constantly die, you may enjoy this.

I also found the game glitchy. Maybe it's the age of my machine, but there were many times the game would lag momentarily (consistently at the same places), and it affected the simulation enough that I wouldn't be able to complete my maneuver. Also, it seemed like sometimes my second jump wouldn't respond (and more rarely, even my first jump wouldn't respond). Also, the target areas seem very small, so you have to be extremely precise. Additionally, your gun projectiles seem like they're infinite speed (i.e., you have to click on exactly what you're trying to hit, not try to lead the target so that the projectile actually impacts the target when it reaches it on your screen).

All that to say, my experience was more aggravating than enjoyable. I hope yours is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987172955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1502920454}
review: Extremely frustrating. I ragequit frequently, often for weeks at a time. I'm glad I kept coming back, to it, though. When you finally get the hang of it some of the more annoying segments, it is a true joy to play. Upon beating the game, I promptly played the whole thing through again. Beautiful visuals, too. A high-quality platformer that I highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966616399', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1435526292}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028072765', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1451673874}
review:
It's a great game. I'm not a huge fan of platformers, but this one really took me for a few reasons:

1. The level design is some of the best I've ever seen. The early stages in particular are fantastic and the developers really use verticality to their advantage. This becomes less true towards the end (this might also be due to my lack of skill), but at the same time a form of backtracking is introduced that feels great, new, and allows a sence of freedom and accomplishment rather than the tedious slog that backtracking typically is.

2. The game teaches you how to play better. As someone who sucks ass, this is a big deal for me. The game can be frustrating as it ratchets up the difficulty, but it also helps me improve and get better, quickly replacing any frustration with a feeling of accomplisment. This is huge.

3. General atmosphere/aesthetic. So at first I wasn't huge on the visuals. But the way everything fits together, from the logs to the crunchy sound effects to the art style to the music to the third dimension and first person rather than 2d is beautiful.

4. You can go fast. Yay.

Really recommend this game. Glad I picked it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032074864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1624128470}
review: Really nice puzzle fps game, makes you push your limits and achieve what you were about to give up on moments earlier, or hours earlier lol, checkpoints are encouragingly placed throughout the levels, and scenery is captivating, I would pick this one up if you are into puzzle platformers for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968445072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1440092130}
review:
Es un juego más de habilidad y velocidad que de pensar o resolver puzzles. No es un Portal pero no le hace falta. Hay zonas muy difíciles que tendrás que repetir una y otra vez, acordándote de la madre de los que hicieron el juego. Siempre hay varias rutas para llegar a tu camino, por lo que si te atascas en uno puedes intentarlo por otro lado.

No hay mucha historia detrás del juego, aparecemos en el mapa y debemos ir avanzando y subiendo niveles. Saltos, piruetas, cambios de gravedad, andar por las paredes, esquivar rayos laser y robots que nos intentarán tirar al abismo, jugar con la supervelocidad, etc... lo dicho, un juego de habilidad. Si eres un poco muñones, dedicate a otra cosa. 

Juego para jugarlo con teclado y ratón. Y recuerda, mucha paciencia.

Nota: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198066644879', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1607828215}
review:
Игра на реакцию и внимание. Постоянно заставляет сосредотачиваться на дететалях,  в игре. Отличнчый FPS-платформер с исследование мира. 10 перезапусков одного момента из 10ти.
Чем то похоже на Portal, но очень отдалённо. Главная фишка игры - пушка, активирующая\деактивирующая механизмы, которые приходится постоянно наблюдать у себя на пути.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976202024', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1451349305}
review:
This is one of those "I really want to like this game, BUT..."-reviews

This game is basically a really funny fps-jump and run, but it lacks the most important thing: good controls.

The point is you have to be very precise in your jumps but you can't, because the controls itself are as precise as using one of those old Atari Sticks with even older boxing gloves.

At first I thought I'm just not good enough, but after a hundred "misjumps" I'm pretty sure it's on the devs... Try it for yourself: Walk to the edge of platform and watch yourself slipping over, it's just badly done!

And then on the second level there are new enemies introduced, which push you off the edge plus the platforms become really small... AND there are lasers (everyone loves lasers :) but they only kill you, enemies don't care about... Nah I'm done with this game.

If you like frustrating experiences (and I'm not talking about hard games like "Super Meatboy" which HAS precise controls and is therefore challenging...) go have a look! 
It's really a cool game besides the controls, but you know... ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028190887', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1451403144}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001637291', 'num_games_owned': 896, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1451247739}
review:
Hey look!  Another abstract platformer with terrible controls and boring visuals!  There are only about a million other games on Steam that are exactly the same, so we obviously needed another.  At least Deadcore does that One Unique Thing that differentiates it from everything else, right?  Right!?

Yeah, not so much.  The level design is ok, but other than that there's nothing in deadcore that we haven't seen before.  The worst part is the floaty controls...I'm sure you get used to them, but combined with a first person perspective makes jumping between platforms an act of guesswork at best.  The graphics do the job and nothing more, and yet somehow manage to tax my machine despite their incredible simplicity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001302734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1451225486}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986984910', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1451504810}
review: Do you like Portal? Do you like surfing in CS? This game is all about movimentation puzzles, it's astonishingly good, the graphics are quite nice, creating a futuristic setting, there is little to no story, it's all about completing trials just to show the world how good you are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066536204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1462000025}
review:
Fast paced fun. Air movement is a little too feathery, though. I kind of wish there was bhopping or something in the game instead of the dash ability. The lore is also pretty interesting. Like any good platformer, there's tons of stuff to collect. The game's environment changes each time you do a cycle and new paths are opened up. No two playthroughs are going to be the same. Since the game is quite difficult and the obstacles rely on actual gaming ability/reaction time, or just creative intuition to get passed them, I'm actual glad there's a checkpoint at every corner. 

"You see those ominous pillars in the distance? You can pulse bomb double jump + dash onto them."

author: {'steamid': '76561198078061590', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1451097215}
review:
Well, the trailer of the game made me think that this game would be awesome, but they bettrayed me. I was very disappointed with the game...
The graphics are good, the gameplay features are cool, the background story looks great... But the background story doesn't really affect the gameplay. It looks like it was something like "Hey, we made a great game. Let's just write some crazy stuff as the backstory". It isn't really connected to the game......
Also, the game most of the time was veeeeeeery boring.
Most of the game is just "press E in the right time", "shot the enemies and avoid the lasers", "jump on those platforms"... You don't need to think much to play this game. You just need to press the right keys in the right time.
Also, it doesn't have action, or any cool boss...

review:
If you enjoy challenging level design and aren't afraid of dying a few times. This 3d action puzzle platformer should be right up your ally. A added plus is the great replayablity and the fact that this game is awesome to speedrun. 

Pro:
Great level design
Multiple routes
Different puzzles
Good graphics
Crisp controls 
High replay value
Generous checkpoints 
(Speedrunning)

Cons:
not a good game if you easely get frustrated or mistake your lack of skill for the games shortcoming / fault

Rating: [b]Best game ever [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198042886155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1705195664}
review: Where portal 2 is a puzzle game with platforming elements, Deadcore is a platformer with puzzle elements. Great game even if you are not a speedrunner. I suggest playing version 1.0 to experience the climbing bug which enhance the puzzle aspect by giving you endless paths to take.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063051890', 'num_games_owned': 1037, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1450909417}
review: Good platformer. The game introduces new mechanics regularly which keeps it interesting. The 5 main levels took me about 4 hours, your mileage may vary depending on your skill. There's a lot of replayability and extra levels if you're into speedrunning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068357623', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1492302091}
review:
Now how can I review this game. It's a really good game that lets you practice speedrunning or even just enjoy. As you play through the levels you will notice that you can find upgrades to your "gun" (don't know what to call it). Many levels (if not all levels) you can just play and have fun. I have seen that many people compare this game to portal and that is not really correct. It gives you a portal feeling, so if you liked portal you will definitely love this game. In my opinion this game is seriously underated and deserves a lot more plays.

I'm giving this game a 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006205876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1459626236}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037586730', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 1082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1450631193}
review:
Deadcore is what Halo would be like if it were a platformer [and on PC]. First of all, I have to say that I really like the graphic design here, from the massive superstructures [nearly always a good thing], to the detail that is put into the design of the smallest entity in each level.

As a platformer, it plays very well. You get multiple paths to try and get to the top of the tower. You make use of various techniques you unlock [jumping, double jumps, gravity reversal, etc.] to traverse the monolithic environment, and avoid enemies by disabling them with your gun. This all comes together really well for a good experience. There are no real "puzzles" per se, but there is a challenge of finding the easiest way [or fastest, if you're speedrunning it], through an environment.

Unfortunately, there are "collecitbles", which after finding them hidden in the environment unlock new stuff, either things like extra ammo capacity or "logs". I don't mind the extra ammo type stuff being hidden, but I think it's a real downer to hide the logs, which are relevant for the story. There are a few that are easy enough to find at the start, to give you a general idea of what is going on, but I really think that the overall story shouldn't be hidden like that.

The game controls very well through a keyboard and mouse. At first I was concerned about a lack of controller support, but after having tried an xinput-keyboard mapper, I have concluded that is propbably a good choice. If you want to play this game at a high pace, then you really do need to use a mouse + keyboard [in my mind].

Overall a really good game as a platformer, and as a speedrunner it looks like a very good candidate as well. Well worth playng if you're into those things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056578040', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1466667251}
review:
랭커들 대단하다는걸 느꼇던 게임

그러나 내가하면 시발

점프게임 좋아하시는분들 추천

author: {'steamid': '76561197984348678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2274, 'last_played': 1470875748}
review:
DeadCore has what's probably my ideal scenario for a game: You fall through the sky and land near the bottom of an impossibly high, architecturally abstract tower, built out of moving and floating pieces, patrolled by mechanical sentries. You have powerful movement options and find tools to make them even more powerful. As you progress, you see flashes of words associated with your immediate task, seemingly the thoughts and warnings of people who have been here before you. Climb to the top.

This is platforming in its purest form - dash, double jump, avoid death fields, boost high up, create your own shortcuts, shoot down enemy sentries, and keep climbing. The movement mechanics are so robust they have a visual artistry to them. The music is a combination of ambient soundscape and thumping electronica.

What little context exists is abstract and light. You find logs with flavor text but they're all pretty interchangeable. DeadCore is just about climbing the tower and (optionally) collecting the sparks that activate something at the top. It's incredibly fun.

Note on speedrun mode: The game has been patched a few times to remove major climbing/clipping exploits, but several still remain. There are obscure ways to boost yourself from the bottom of a level to the top. Unless it gets patched again (which seems unlikely), don't sweat the leaderboards too much and just play it the way you want to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005555352', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1450583086}
review:
It's a Unity game, it looks like a Unity game with the choppy switch gun animations and the high resolution skybox that feels fresh out of a demonstration video, it feels like Unity in that hardware on the lower range will probably suffer. The backstory is a weak excuse to sprinkle collectibles around the levels (there's only twenty of them, they're text logs), and the plot is about as deep as the end sequence to Mass Effect 3. Speaking of three, that's about how many hours it takes to get the true ending from when you start the game for the first time.

This is the part where you imagine the stern face, the frown, and the shaking of head. This is then the part where you tell yourself, 'who cares! I'm going fast! Wheeee! There's times to beat, things to collect, one way to go, and that's up!'

As you should! Deadcore feels tight. The running, the jumping, the dashing, the rocket jumping, the platforming, racing along a knife's edge to some sick beats along the looming specter of some inexplicable tower, it's absolutely exhilarating. Once you get a feel for the game, once you learn how to get to the end of the level, well, that's where the racing starts. There's achievements, there's developer times to beat, your friends' times to beat, your own times- you will feel yourself getting better at the game and you might surprise yourself with how quickly you do.

A caveat, though- the game's kind of hard. It's very possible that Mr. Real Time Strategy On Weekends or Mr. Really Good At Last Hits isn't going to make it to the end. There's no losing condition, though, and with as 'short' as the game is, it makes it a very feasible goal. There's no grinding. There's no timewaster, no character progression. There's just you and your own skill.

Sure, maybe you can get the true ending in three hours, but there are completionist goals, and the brevity of the game keeps them refreshingly in reach. Again, it's not about putting the time in, it's about gaining skill, and pushing yourself like few games these days push you. And let me tell you, pushing yourself to make it to the top of the tower in under one hour... Mmmngh. Good feeling.

If you're a twitchy shootery kind of guy, or you dig fast paced platformers, and you think you'll enjoy finding the logs, music, and crushing time records, the game's definitely worth the ten bucks. If you're not, or not so sure of your skill, jump for it when it's on sale. It's popped up in a few game bundles already, so it shouldn't ever be too long between sales.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992002423', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1510803181}
review: I came into playing DeadCore with low expectations; the reviews I had read online indicated this game was "average", and only pandered to a small market of platforming gamers. My experience with it, however, has been nothing but positive. This game is SO FUN. Seriously. It plays like a fast paced puzzle platforming fps, so it touches a lot of different genres, and I think theres a little something for everybody here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025179007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1452921109}
review:
Absolutely puts other first person platformers to shame.

+Very tight controls and mechanics
+Challenging but not tedious
+Puzzles are fun and interesting
+Abilities unlocked and introduced in each open up tons of shortcut possibilities
+Very fast paced
+++If you fuck up you can go immediately back to the last checkpoint instead of waiting to die
+Visually stunning
+Great sound track, good sound design

-No Steam Workshop support. Let us play with these mechanics and assets man!
-Gravity shift zones can be confusing... there's a reason Portal 2 devs opted against using sticky gel

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198005613857', 'num_games_owned': 875, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1551435602}
review:
This game is great, I initially played the concept demo and loved that and when it came out I torrented it but soon decided to buy it if not for the achievments then at least to support the makers of such a cool game.
This game shows what can be done when a simple concept (first person platformer about climbing a tower with a focus on speed) is done well. The controls are tight working around the limitations of platforming in first person (as any half life player will be aware of) and using its strengths (shooting mechanics and air dashes). This combigned with great level design which encorages exploration and the taking of alternate routes reinforcing the ideas of speed all helped along with the scattering of collectables cleverly placed so that finding them is a fun and rewarding challange.

The music and visuals come together to give a great vibe and the first time you see the tower in all it's glory you will stop and stare. It looks like the cover of some wierd prog-rock album cover (looking at you Dream Theater) but a game.

Games like this truly showcase what the unity engine is capable of.

If your a fan of games where "iteration for perfection" is key and you like fast paced puzzeling where quick thinking can often save you after you make a mistake, I you like CS surf maps and climbing a tower this game is for you.


Mandatory cons section:
This is a FPS platformer, you have to be resonably compitent with first person games to get the most out of this without getting frustrated.
The story is a bit weak but it's such a small part of the game that you can ignore it (Mario's story ain't much to write home about either you know)
Performance wise I don't know how well optamized it is. I have a pretty stong PC and it runs smooth wiht one excetpion. My I recommend doing some research if you PC is below average, might be nothing.


Overall though, great fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995706132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1227, 'last_played': 1558952610}
review:
At it's core, this is a speed running game before it is a platformer. With sharp visuals, clean controls and a fitting sound track it's an easy game to lose time to trying to shave that short second, but beware, on your first playthrough be prepared to die ALOT.

The game relies on precision movement and quick reflexes and will punish you off you're off the mark. Look for checkpoints as you play through as they will save you a lot of time, and hence comes the risk when trying to cut corners; skip a checkpoint, and be punished if you screw up. This also plays into the routes, some are harder than others, some have fewer checkpoints, but if you plan to go for it, you can shave off minutes if you're successful. Due to this, it would be nice if they introduced a way to revert your checkpoint furthur, say, previous or 3 checkpoints before. It would make the overall game more casual friendly as some of these alternate routes, once you start on them, you're not going back... In this sense, the game pulls no punches. Shaving off minutes becomes really satisfying given how punishing trying to do so can be. Practice and memorise if you want to feel any real satisfaction, otherwise, this game is probably not for you.

My first playthrough was almost like Super Meat Boy all over again...

author: {'steamid': '76561198110041681', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1542936249}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977112148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1570460652}
review:
Dieses Spiel lässt sich mit nur 2 Worten hervorragend beschreiben. 

>> Sehr schwer <<

Aber dafür sieht es sehr schön aus :)
Und der Soundtrack - mmmh. Subwoofer voll aufdrehen ^^

Nach einer bisherigen Spielzeit von knapp 3 Stunden tun mir derart die Finger weh, dass ich eine Pause einlegen muss. Genug Zeit also, um dem Spiel einen Daumen nach Oben und eine klare Empfehlung zu geben.
Das Spiel ist auf Überblick, Timing und Geschwindigkeit ausgelegt. Haltet bei den Maps die Umgebung im Auge, seht Euch die Bewegungen der Hindernisse an und setzt das Timing fest, wann Ihr rennen, springen, katapultieren und etwas aktivieren müss. Dann nur noch den Geschosstürmen, den Drohnen, fliegenden Geschützen, und im späteren Verlauf vielleicht noch mehr, ausweichen und man hat es schon wieder zum nächsten Checkpoint geschafft :P
Die Checkpoints sind glücklicherweise großteils sehr fair platziert. Ich hätte mich gefreut, wenn sie einfacher zu lokalisieren wären, man muss nämlich manchmal nach dem nächsten sehr lange suchen, da nicht immer der erste Weg auch der einzige, oder beste ist. 
Viele Wege führen zum Ziel, ob nun durch eine Röhre mit Lasern hindurch, oder auch einfach oben drüber, manchmal sogar einen ganz anderen Weg, steht Euch völlig frei. 

Ich wünsche Euch viel Spaß ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198037811037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1448515174}
review:
DeadCore is a very back and forth experience, and not just because you'll be making baby-step progress while relentlessly respawning at checkpoints that are just a bit too far away. Many of the features and mechanics in DeadCore are rather self-defeating: it's a platformer that relies on extreme awareness of environmental hazards and body positioning, but at the same time, is a first-person viewed game where you can't see your feet. It's a game that is so conscious of the impending need for repetitious retrying and respawning that it mapped a quickspawn button next to 'use,' but it spreads checkpoints thin for the sake of exploration. Movement is typical WASD, allowing for a straight vector of movement at 45° angles relative to the camera’s center, but will frequently require you to run a straight line while aiming at targets outside such a range.

Point is, DeadCore's biggest enemy is itself. But getting beyond that, if you can get used to the quirks and have a high tolerance for the inevitable friction, all while surviving a skill-based game that takes no prisoners, DeadCore offers an engrossing aesthetic that is well-implemented and even more well-polished; thankfully, the game seeks to capitalize on a more zen-like experience, rather than the standard (and played out) frantic cyber-savvy motif. A simple, quiet package, DeadCore may very well frustrate you, but it will reward you greater.
