author: {'steamid': '76561198083068272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1462479011}
review:
I just finished Deadcore for the first time last night and I've already started a second playthrough to see if I can find all of the collectibles, get the second ending and earn some more achievements.  I'll probably mess with the speedrun mode for a bit as well.  So, my verdict?  Deadcore is a blast.  The game is a sci-fi styled puzzle/platformer/shooter where you're stuck in a sort of computer glitch/alternate dimension where you must scale a huge tower using quick reflexes and every ability in your arsenal.  If you mix Mirror's Edge, Portal, the movie Cube, Megaman and some other similarly themed games and movies, you will have Deadcore.  This is not a game for those looking to relax or have an easy go of things.  Your patience will be tested but there was certainly a sense of accomplishment whenever you'd complete a very difficult section and finally reach that elusive next checkpoint.  

The meat of the gameplay sees you jumping from block to block/platform to platform while dodging moving laser fields, robotic foes hellbent on knocking you into the abyss and every other oddity you can imagine.  There are disorienting anti-gravity sections that will turn you on your head, jump pads, gravity tunnels that send you hurtling towards danger that you must avoid and much, much, much more.  You get a few abilities like a dash to help you out as well as the Switch Gun that does everything from activating objects in the enviroment that you need to use in order to progress to stopping your robo-foes dead in their tracks.  There is a story and it's told passably enough through numerous data logs that you can collect as you climb this digital Tower of Babel.  Speaking of collectibles, there's plenty to find.  In addition to the logs there are also music tracks, Switch Gun upgrades and Sparks (that open up new pathways of travel) to find.  

Deadcore takes place in a pretty unusual setting that is brought to life thanks to some excellent graphics.  You'll truly feel the awe and scope of the situation you're in as you look up and see how far you literally have to climb to get to the next area.  Particle effects dazzle, threats are well-animated, dizzying gravity changes look awesome as the scenery flips every which way and the overall atmosphere is a slice of sci-fi goodness that looks simultaneously grand and opaque, all in the same breath.  It's not THE most beautiful game ever created as some of the enviroments can get a bit samey, but 90% of the time Deadcore is a pleasure to the eye.  The sound is pretty strong as well, if not quite as crystalline as the graphics are.  Robotic foes make c3po noises, your Switch Gun shots pack a fair punch and everything is perfunctory in terms of special audio FX.  Where the sound really shines is with the techno/industrial soundtrack that pumps adrenaline in the background; complimented by numerous dips into trip-hop ambience.  

Even if Deadcore packed a simply average presentation it wouldn't matter much because in a game as challenging as this one, the controls are the most important aspect.  MOSTLY, they are competently well done and accurate enough for you to do the job but let's face it...you're going to DIE and die you will as you struggle with all of your might to pass the 5 main levels in story mode.  Jumping, dashing, shooting the Switch Gun and avoiding threats works most of the time and pulling off a series of daring saves and escapes is satisfying and breathtaking to chain together.  The real big BUT here is that sometimes things just don't work as they should.  Movement is a bit floaty and even if your leaps and dives are dead on the money, you are bound to go sliding off your perch.  The game has its own physics to master. Sometimes the game requires lining up perfectly between several moving lasers and these segments are rarely passable on the first attempt.  In addition to the "float" controls, there are instances where your button presses won't register AT ALL.  My keyboard is new, clean as a whistle and generally in top-notch condition, but that didn't stop the f*cking Space Bar from not accepting my double jumps many, many times even if I waited a moment on a platform to make sure that the double jump ability reset itself.  Checkpoints are oftentimes pretty fairly located but there are several portions of the game where you'll need to cover a darn good chunk of distance to reach one and in these cases the ill-response of the controls will have you repeating these portions over and over and over again.  What makes it fun is the fact there is a Steam Achievement that can only be unlocked by dying a hilarious # of times.  I laughed to myself seeing this, saying, "Ha, even if this game is tough as nails, I'll never die THAT much."  I'm not sure what's scarier...the fact that I scoffed at the idea of dying so frequently or the fact that I reached the achievement before I totally completed level 3.  Good God...I died fast and hard!   But I kept trying and playing...

In terms of replay value, masochists like myself will find more than enough of it in Deadcore.  I'm already starting a second playthrough to see if I can grab all of the collectables at the very least and there is also a speed-run mode available where you can stack yourself up against the competition all over the world and try to best the developer's times.  This is one of those games  that I'll probably lose interest before getting every single achievement (I won't be good enough to get a few either I'm sure), but it's going to keep me playing long after a single completion.  In fact, I hope to get some more out of it in after writing this review.  There's not much else to say here.  This game was pretty darn great and worth the money I spent on it.  Though I hit on the controls fairly hard, I do want to enforce the notion that you will get better and come to get a grip on the movement in this game the more that you play.  I kind of disagree with the folks that say you can't get better at it.  I did.  It has its quirks, but I see them as masterable quirks.  

Let me break down as always into what I liked and what I didn't in a more quick reference style!  

Pros:

-Excellent graphics and visual effects
-Great lighting and particle explosions
-A small but useful selection of abilities and Switch Gun modes
-Fun level design with alot of different challenges packed into each one
-Decent sound design with exceptional music  
-Lots to see and do (collectibles, alternate modes, different paths, etc.)
-Controls are a pain but somehow become adaptable if you stick with the game  
-Interesting story premise

Cons:

-Controls are NOT for the casual gamer (I'm pretty hardcore...not the best, not the worst, so I had fun learning to get better at them)
-While the graphical sights are impressive, they do get samey as the game goes on
-Though the music was excellent, sound was rather humdrum
-Story itself becomes passe as the game progresses (perhaps ending #2 will shed more light)
-Enemies feel like an annoying afterthought.  They aren't particularly challenging as the platforming is the real challenge and they feel more like an annoyance than necessary to the gameplay.  
-For a game focused on speed, there are certain segments where you must sit and assess the situation even if you already know the level.  
-Sometimes the controls flat out don't respond

Overall, I had a blast with Deadcore.  I got more enjoyment out of it than Portal...just my humble opinion.  It's going to tick you off sometimes but every time I wanted to put the game down I found out that I simply couldn't for long.  It was fun more often than it was annoying.  The sci-fi setting was cool and when the controls were hitting their stride, there was plenty of satisfaction in pulling off several quick movements in succession.  Hopefully, a few of the games issues will be addressed and upgraded, or fixed in a sequel.  

Rating:  8/10

review:
Este juego es malvado.Divertido en un principio, te hace sufrir a partir del 3er nivel.
Esperá morirte muchas... MUCHAS veces.
LLegó un punto que decidí abandonarlo, en el ultimo nivel, porque no podía creer lo que tenía que hacer.
Volví al día siguiente, despues de ver un video en youtube como un maniatico completaba en 10 minutos lo que yo me tomé 4 horas de lograr, y cuando ví que era posible, fuí y lo hice.
A fin de cuentas, me mantuvo atrapado, y no es algo que muchos juegos logren.
Juego recomendado para los que les gusta sufrir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048998514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1446988443}
review:
FPS移動ゲーム
壁を走ったりはしないのでパルクールとは少し違うがゲームの内容はそれに近い

射撃によってギミックを作動させたり敵を一時無力化しながらダッシュ＆ジャンプで障害物を避けながら進むステージクリア型
一般的なFPSと違って攻撃的なAIをもった敵はほとんどいない
メインはあくまでも仕掛けを利用して障害物を回避するというもので、シューターよりもプラットフォーマーとかパルクールと言った方がしっくりくる
落下死の他、一撃死の障害物が多いので死にゲー、覚えゲーでもある
FPSだと思わず、高難度アクションゲームだと思っておかないと一撃死のトライ＆エラーに耐えられない

ストーリーは5ステージまでしかないが各ステージが十分に長いので問題ない


酔いやすいというレビューを見たので注意したほうがいいかも
ワシは三半規管が鈍感な様で酔うことはなかったよ
頻繁に重力を操作する仕掛けが登場するので上下の感覚がおかしくなるという感覚はある

author: {'steamid': '76561198177956261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1446098265}
review:
個人評分：7/10

畫面：遊戲畫面呈現科幻感。第一人稱的視角，各種高科技的機關，環視四周發現自己處於一個死氣沉沉的星球上。遊戲玩到中期，你會發現你所處的地方已經遠遠地離開地面。

操作：因為這款遊戲需要克服重重機關才能到達彼岸。遊戲越到後面就越難，當然考驗的時候也就到了。那是後你會發現自己慢慢地成為手殘一族。但是，相信我，你不是手殘，你需要的是冷靜思考還有永不言棄。[spoiler]（至今我還沒有到達。）[/spoiler]總的來說，操作不難。難的是不願放棄的決心。

連線：雖然有連線競賽，但是缺少夥伴。

有空就玩玩吧。低價買的遊戲，值得買。

author: {'steamid': '76561197982011454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1413741859}
review:
In my 3 hours of playing this I have learned 2 things.
1. Difficulty is fair.
2. If games can cause you to feel ill from motion sickness, you will need to have a liedown after playing this.

Controls are very responsive, nice visuals, nice music, fun gameplay with difficulty increasing in amounts I felt left you feeling rewarded after. My main gripe, if I had to list one, would be that it's very easy to "get lost", because the levels are so open and there (almost always) are different paths to the end, meaning you can potentially spend a lot of time banging your head against part of a level, while there is an easier path 'round the other way.

Would definitely recommend in a sale, very solid purchase and I'm unsure why more praises aren't sung on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163698206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1447236912}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist eine Granate von Shooter/Rätsel Spielen.
Ich werde einfach eine Pro und Contra Liste, um das ganze schnell und präzise darzustellen.

Pro: 
+ Grafik. die sich sehen lassen kann
+ Selbst auf "low Quality" sieht das Spiel immernoch gut aus
+ Viele und anspruchsvolle Herausforderungen
+ Verschiedene Möglichkeiten, Herausforderungen zu meistern
+ Viele sammelbare Objekte bspw. Textlogs oder Upgrades
+ Gute Steuerung und gute Erklärung der findbaren Ausrüstung

Contra:
- Story für mich etwas unverständlich und unübersichtlich
- plötzlicher Einstieg ins Geschehen

Insgesamt bekommt es von mir einen Daumen hoch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998118312', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1446415603}
review:
Rating: 9/10
Overview: First Person Platforming

The Good:

+ The story campaign features 5 levels split between checkpoints. Each level introduces a new mechanic adding a new layer to platforming. The levels feel like large obstacle courses that slowly ramp up in difficulty. Every level also  features multiple pathways encouraging multiple playthroughs.

+ Speedrun mode allows you replay the story campaign missions in addition to bonus levels that are unlocked by playing the story campaign to compete for the fastest times. You play these levels thinking how good you are only to watch  videos online and realize how little skill you actually have.   

+ Great controls lead to great platforming. The platforming is less about precision and more about timing. When to dodge lasers, when to jump, when to avoid enemies etc. Every new section is like a puzzle, figuring how to reach the end, how to get the timing down just right etc, leads to a lot of satisfaction. You will die A LOT but that isn't a bad thing because every death means you learn something new. Once you die you instantaneously respawn at the checkpoint so you never have to wait. This may not seem important but when you die very frequently it becomes important to get back into the game as fast as possible.  

+ Enemies are introduces in the later levels to add variety. You can temporarily stun them with you weapon or you can try to avoid them. 

+ Techno soundtrack fits perfectly with the overall theme of the game


The Bad

-The game has a bug that doesn't seem to remember your settings every time you start the game. You have to go back into settings for the game to recognize it. Some levels had a few random bugs making it almost impossible to complete.  
Restarting the level fixed these issues.  

Conclusion

If you are the type of person to rage quit, this game may not be the best for you as it requires patience, timing, skill and a bit of luck. An enemy in the wrong place can make a good run turn ugly very quickly. If you are willing to  put up with that however, you may find yourself playing one of the best platformers on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973786715', 'num_games_owned': 1942, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1446420256}
review:
I have over 500 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game. 

One Hour Reviews #42 - DeadCore

I used to play Quake III back in the day, and I remember this one level in particular, Q3DM17 : The Longest Yard, which my friends loved to play.  It was different from most of the other levels in that the level took place out in space.  It had these floating platforms, and on the platforms you'd find these bouncypads that would bounce you from one platform to another.  Well, in theory anyway, unless something went wrong, which in my case it always did.  Like I'd get shot in the middle of the air and it would alter my trajectory and I'd miss the landing and fall into the void.   Everytime I'd die like this I'd lose a point (the game considered it suicide), and often I'd end the match with a negative score.

Today I discovered there's a whole game that plays just like this Quake 3 level. It turns out I'm not very good at playing this either.

Each level is laid out with a series of checkpoints.  When you miss a jump and fall to your death, you'll zot back to the last checkpoint you went through (or you can just press R).   Since there aren't other people to kill, instead the game scores you by keeping tabs on how long you take to get to the end of the level.  In fact, the big part of what reminds me of Quake III so much is the sense of speed as you move and jump through the level, as the game encourages you to speedrun.

The first level is setup to introduce you to the controls and objects you'll find in the environment.  It starts with the basics of moving and jumping around, then introduces you to objects that launch you around, and then things that start shooting at you.  You do end up with a gun, but rather than using it to shoot people, you shoot objects to either activate them (like doors) or deactivate them temporarily (like turrets).

It sounds pretty basic, but the game gets challenging pretty quick.  Soon you are having to do things like shoot at turrets in the air so they don't knock you off course as you are jumping.  Or you'll end up on giant spinning wheels trying to get your aim right so you can jump to a nearby platform.  Then the game throws this weird looking windmill thing at you that you have to shoot to get the blades to stop spinning so you can move past.

If you aren't a fan of platformers or are a very casual player, you may be turned off by the difficulty in landing jumps and timing things right.  Personally I found the game to be challenging, but also rewarding as I practiced and got better at navigating the level.  It took me 25 minutes to get through the first level.  The best time is under 48 seconds.  That leaves a lot of room for improvement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008931531', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1470439287}
review:
I normally don't enjoy platformer games very much.  Part of the reason for this is that I tend to be absolutely terrible at them, going all the way back to Super Mario Bro's.  The only reason I even picked this game up was because it was on sale and I had just recently had a hankering to replay the Portal Games (the only platformer I had ever truly enjoyed) but this caught my eye on the sale page.  

DeadCore is not Portal or Portal 2 or Super Mario Bro's.  There is no real story even if there are supposed tidbits of information granted through an annoying "journal" style system that you pick up as collectibles.  There is no protagonist or antagonist either really there are enemy bots of sorts, but thats about it.  

So do I reccomend it? Without a SINGLE doubt.  Why?  Because it absolutely gorgeous, it is fun, it is challenging, and it isn't all that expensive for what you get.  Buy it at full price or wait for a sale and buy it then.  But buy DeadCore and play it. 

I hadn't really realized one prime reason that I always get bored with platformers and drop them without finishing them.  And that is because generally if you fail in a platformer, if you make one tiny mistake, they throw a huge failure screen in your face, taunting you with your lack of skill, and eating up a comparitively huge chunk of time.  DeadCore doesn't.  It instantly respawns you and lets you try again.  Your spawn points in the game are mostly close enough that if you die you get set back, but not so far that you want to flip a table.  The sounds are great, the game is beautifully artistic and has a very cool Tron sort of feel with the way that lighting is done, and I died 975 times before I made it to the top of the tower without realizing it.  In most similair games they would take between 10-15 seconds for the screen to go black, taunt you with your death, go through some sort of animation, then maybe put you back in.  That would mean 162.5 to 243.75 minutes of cut screen.  

Thank you DeadCore for not wasting my time... I can proudly say as a non-platformer gamer I've completed it and may play the additional content in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067090064', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1621031192}
review:
Сначала кажется, что это очередная поделка вдохновлёная Portal или типа того. Но стоит её запустить, а там УУУУХХХ, ВЖЖЖУУУУ и ЫЫЫЭЭЭЭХХХ. И понимаешь что она просто супер. Выглядит очень стильно, подходящая музыка, нарастающая сложность и постоянно новые элементы геймплея.
А так же реиграбельность на уровне. Есть разные пути прохождения и собирательные элементы.

10 москитов из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043272789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1443999868}
review: This game is brutal. You will find yourself dying hundreds of times doing a single set of jumps. The patterns are absolutely unforgiving to the extreme. You have to be perfect to get through the challenges. To get the best ending you'll have to play through several times. Things get easier once you get the hang of the game, but it takes a while, and its really tough. Ill recommend it, but be prepared to curse at the screen a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113329638', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1446979763}
review: Gioco che richiede molta tecnica, riflessi e precisione, è davvero frenetico e i puzzle sono in certi casi molto complessi e dannatamente snervanti. Ho molto apprezzato la possibilità di poter scegliere tra più percorsi oltre alla possibilità di poterne sbloccare di nuovi, le ambientazioni sono molto carine, in certi punti mi hanno ricordato il buon vecchio Tron. La trama è totalmente assente, la colonna sonora non è nulla di che tuttavia non è mai invasiva e non disturba. Unica pecca veramente negativa (secondo me) è l'assenza di conservazione della quantità di moto nei salti semplici: quando saltate dovete controllare costantemente la posizione del vostro personaggio anziché limitarvi a calcolare la rincora e saltare, tuttavia dopo un po' ci si fa l'abitudine. Molti lo paragonano a Portal, secondo me hanno in comune solo la categoria perché nella pratica sono davvero diversissimi... E questo secondo me è dannatamente più difficile. Lo consiglio solo agli amanti del genere veramente skillati poiché ci saranno punti in cui scorrerete non poche volte tutti i santi del calendario.. In compenso la goduria nel finire un puzzle è impagabile ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015796854', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1445258323}
review: Bought this game looking for a breezy, fun new look at DeFRaG. What I got was somewhat like that, but got steadily more frustrating the more the mechanics and ESPECIALLY the enemies got in your way. Towards the end of Level 5 I seriously wanted to punch my screen with how frustrating some of the elements were ("Oh let's climb some steps you while two boss mobs instantly one-shot you from across the platform!"). Unique concept, love the visuals, physics and movement were close to perfect, but it felt like the game couldn't decide on being a platformer or a shooter in the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035132532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1447582939}
review:
Honestly, I didn't like the way the gameplay felt at first but I'm getting used to it -it's not particularly welcoming to get used to.  Sections of the game feel very tedious to me and cross the line between too much punishment via repetition (the section where you have to climb a square tower and dodge blasters that keep knocking you off had me ready to throw my mouse.) -but then again I suppose that's half the charm of these types of difficult platformers -none the less it's pretty solid fun, great graphics.

I still think this game needs native controller support, but it controls nicely using a mouse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076934946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1462097615}
review:
一周目クリアしてからの感想。
やや複雑な要素もあるけど基本的には、
足場をたどってひたすらゴールを目指すシンプルなアクションパズルゲーです。
PORTALシリーズとかハマった人なら多分楽しめるはず。

ストーリーはあるような、ないような、微妙なところです。雰囲気ゲーです。
想像しながら進めると面白いかも。

クリアまでの目安は大体4～6時間程度かな？
詰まったりするともう少し時間掛かるかも。
最後に難所がありますが、まぁＦＰＳゲーに慣れてる人なら大丈夫でしょう。

クリア後のやり込み要素：
・タイムアタック
・別ルート・ショートカットの探索
・エクストラコースのタイムアタック
・隠しアイテム探し
ただし基本的なマップの総数は変わらないです。

正規価格だとちょっと高い感じはするけど、
セール時を狙えば5～600円で手に入ることもあるので、
その時には是非オススメしたい作品です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198075909530', 'num_games_owned': 1003, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1441654290}
review:
Top negative reviews for this game talk only about its supposedly too harsh difficulty, so I will only write about this part of the game here, as everyone agrees on that DeadCore is a great game, just too hard for some people.
Some say that this game is only for FPS speedrunners, others say that it's so difficult that it stops being challenging and becomes just irritating. I found both these claims not true. I never speedran an FPS and never played similar game to DeadCore (first-person platformer with emphasis on precision and synchronisation of jumps and precise shots). And despite that I finished DeadCore in less than 5 hours and had a great time. It was challenging and satisfying experience.

So I really encourage you to give DeadCore a chance. Given the game's low price and (if you don't like it) Steam's refund system you are not risking much. But there is a chance that you'll have a great time with this game, just as I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120630172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1443804908}
review:
Jogo absolutamente incrível, além de relativamente difícil!

Estava procurando algo como Portal, porém esse aqui foi muito além nos quebra cabeças e formas de passar determinado level.

No Single Player você faz uma espécie de Campanha que é bem direta, você começa em um ponto e tem que chegar a outro, o grande porém é que o jogo abre muito espaço para criatividade, por vezes você tem o caminho natural e se pegará inventando formas de passar certos desafios.

Há também o modo SpeedRun que é um mapa aonde tudo é rapido! você  tem que tentar ir o mais rápido possível para se colocar no ranking com outros players online, alguns desses mapas são alucinante pois você mal consegue parar para pensar, tem que ser bem atento e rápido pois são milésimos para resolver alguns puzzles nesse modo.

Vale muito apena para quem gosta de quebrar a cabeça pensando em como raios vou passar dessa parte! É ótimo tentar e tentar até conseguir desenvolver uma forma de continuar, muito bom!

Altamente recomendado para quem curte jogo rápido e de quebrar a cabeça, é realmente difícil em algumas partes, mas caso não conseguir passar uma parte, dê um tempo vá tomar um chá ou café e volte depois que você conseguirá passar tranquilamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077245678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1448859511}
review: Tight yet not too hardcore gameplay – or at least with a decent difficulty ramp, clever level design, and good-looking... DeadCore makes one feels vertigo. A unique first-person platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967449126', 'num_games_owned': 2389, 'num_reviews': 366, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1443637739}
review:
Great 3D platformer that encourages going as fast as possible. Some of the new abilities and techniques may seem overwhelming at first but stick to it, you'll figure it out quickly and it'll almost come as second nature. A lot of the jumps are skill based and require some quick thinkign and that's where this game shines. Flying through the air at high speeds avoiding all these obstacles gives you such a rush.

If you've played any mods or jump maps for classic FPS games like Half Life or Quake, you'll fit right into this game. The main story is only about 3 hours but you can really get a lot of value out of this game trying to climb the leaderboards for speed running time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981706607', 'num_games_owned': 4148, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1443322549}
review: Wow, I really sucked at this game.  Five levels of first person platforming, and I died in this game; a lot.  The levels are large and complex, and when you get to the areas with variable gravity, they can be vertigo inducing too. Add to that some unpleasant robots that can kill or, even worse, bounce you out of your path, and lots of massive drops and killer walls, and this game is brutal in its construction.  The idea that people can do speed runs on it just blows my mind.  It's a unique, gorgeously minimalistic environment and a fascinating challenge, but it's not one I'm going back to.  I'm just not good enough at it to try to find the bonuses I missed. But if you think you've got the skills for first person platforming and aerial challenges, this is a game that will take you on, chew you up, and spit you out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096005009', 'num_games_owned': 974, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1607, 'last_played': 1637181675}
review: Let me start by saying that I picked this game up because it was on sale and had good reviews. I am not a person that spends a lot of time in platformers and I looked down on speed runners. That being said, I've loved this game. It is what it claims to be: a FPS platformer oriented around speedrunning. The first time through this game, the frustration is real (taking about 6 hours). The eighth time through the satifaction is also real (Taking me 7 minutes). Replay value is awesome as you continue finding new routes and faster paths. I suggest playing through the patched version first and then switching to the beta version. Get involved in the community. most people seem willing to talk and help you through the game. Some of the best few bucks I've spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119166731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1498174819}
review:
So good!
Also heres a pear ginger upside down cake recipe for anyone who wants it!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Ingredients

3 medium pears
2 Tbsp. (30 mL) lemon juice
1 Tbsp. (15 mL) Becel® Original margarine
2 Tbsp. (30 mL) sugar
1/4 cup (50 mL) slivered almonds, toasted
1/2 cup (125 mL) Becel® Original margarine
1/2 cup (125 mL) sugar
2 eggs, beaten
1 Tbsp. (15 mL) grated lemon peel
1 cup (250 mL) all-purpose flour
1 tsp. (5 mL) baking powder
1/4 tsp. (1 mL) salt
2 Tbsp. (30 mL) 2% milk
1/4 cup (50 mL) finely chopped candied ginger
Preparation
Step 1
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Toss pears with lemon juice; drain, reserving juice.
Step 2
Grease 23 cm springform pan with 15 mL Becel® Original margarine, then sprinkle with 30 mL sugar and almonds. Arrange pears in circle in bottom of springform pan; set aside.
Step 3
Beat 125 mL Becel® Original margarine with 125 mL sugar in large mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Add eggs, lemon peel and reserved juice; set aside. Combine flour, baking powder and salt in another bowl. Stir 1/2 of the flour mixture into the batter, mixing well. Stir in milk, then remaining flour mixture. Fold in candied ginger. Spoon batter evenly over pears.
Step 4
Bake until golden brown, about 30 minutes. Remove to wire rack and let stand 5 minutes. Invert serving plate over pan and turn out cake. Serve at room temperature and, if desired, with caramel sauce.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961219398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1456002446}
review: Best description is Portal meets Temple Run, it's a first person platform puzzler with a gun you use on stuff. It's not always fast paced, but usually tense as hell. I'm surprised I don't mind dying as much as I do, cause it's just really fun and simple to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085980449', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1446554705}
review:
バンナムがSteamでパブリッシングしてるゲームで、そのうち日本で買えるものはF2Pのアレ含めて5作しか無いが、その貴重な5作のうちの一つ

とはいえダクソ2やProjectCarsと同様デベロッパは外部なんだがな！

とりあえず(多分)5面中3面までクリア、収集要素もあるものの現状あまり気にせず進めてる。

FPSスタイルで二段ジャンプや空中ダッシュ、ステージのギミックを作動/停止できる銃を駆使しながら謎の塔(?)を登っていくゲーム、

「人を撃たないFPS」という点ではPORTALに近いがあちらはアクションパズルなのに対してこちらは完全にアクションゲームであり素早いアクションやエイムが要求され結構な高難易度になっているが、リトライの待ち時間が少なく快適で、またレベルデザインがよく出来ているためギミックやアクションに慣れながら進むことが出来る。

ただ三面後半に高速で迫ってくる即死フィールドの隙間をすり抜けながら進むシチュエーションが結構あったのは頂けないかなぁ、FPSでイライラ棒とかちょっと無茶。

日本語訳はなく、日本語化も見つからなかったが、ゲーム中ではそもそも言葉自体ほぼ出ないのでゲームプレイ自体に支障はない、ただしステージ中で拾えるアイテムに文章が入ったものが有り、ストーリーを読み解くならこれを読むのは必須ぽい。


「酔う」というレビューも多少あるけど自分は酔わなかった、まあ初代Portal以外で3D酔いしたこと無いけど。


総括してセール値なら自信を持って薦められる良作アクション小品、定価でもまぁ良い気もするがこのペースでクリアできるならちょっとボリューム感に欠けるかな?

author: {'steamid': '76561198168725924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1493582771}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018580644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1447582204}
review:
Extremely fun, adrenaline-rush-inducing platforming fun.

People complain about microstutering, which only happens if you run the game without vsync at anything above 60fps. The devs say they are working on this. I'm satisfied with 60fps wth vsync, though. It runs fairly well other than that. 

Super neat art style. And some neat mechanics too. The dev calls it a "Platformer-FPS blending exploration and speedrun," and it just about perfectly pulls that off. Give it a try!

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198129016938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1632061131}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117088069', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1442834522}

author: {'steamid': '76561198103650955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1442674666}
review:
Let me start off by saying that the graphics are beautiful. the level design is great and it's a great idea.
But it has some major flaws for me.
Unlike most platformer games, I feel like it was more fair. It was based on how much skill I had. This game just kinda suggests how you play, and you need to play it like that. 
There aren't alot of checkpoints, especially when you need them. When it's easy, you get all the checkpoints in the world. But when you need to climb an entire 10 story building with turrets and jumpers everywhere, then you get one checkpoint: at the start.
The game goes from painfully easy and teaching you how to play, to crazy hard within the first 10 minutes. There is a harsh learning curve that just doesn't feel fair.
The main reason I don't like this game is because the sensitivity is waaaayyy to high. If you barely, just barely, tap the S button while you're going in midair, you'll completely stop. Then, if you tap A again, then you'll go flying forward. It's especially annoying when the platforms are tiny (which is a lot of them) and you can't land on them because it's too sensitive. You can't even turn it down in the settings.
Not controller compatible, but that's not much of a problem.
And everything that you deactivate with your gun comes back alive within seconds. It's especially annoying when you're climbing buildings and there's a bunch of turrets. You keep having to shoot them over and over, because they keep coming back to life. I shoot it, jump to the next platform, and then have to shoot it again because its come back alive already.
6/10 it's a fun idea, relatively similar (though far from as good as) Portal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026139285', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1442601985}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070388094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1483475368}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070958597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1450518784}
review:
和传送门唯一的相之处就是主角都拿着不能杀人的枪
如果你喜欢玩i wanna 系列游戏的话，推荐这款游戏～
目前玩了三个章节，难度还可以，不过已经有鬼畜的兆头了
1.操作：需要适应主角位移的惯性和速度，刚进游戏的时候把握不好，最基本的跳台都不好跳，习惯之后其实有种飞起来的感觉233
2.游戏性：目前来看除了基础教学，后面很多地方有岔路，目测一周目是没法拿全收集要素的，主线故事就隐藏在收集到的文本中
3.游戏比较虐心不太适合操作不好的玩家，如果对自己的方向感和操作没有信心，你要有打不通的准备，另外这个游戏虽然主体考验跳台和方向控制～也需要射击的精准度，玩久了比较耗神，只有bgm没有语音剧情和cg略显单调
好想@散人＝。 ＝ 适合抖m的游戏～

author: {'steamid': '76561198076660958', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1442554384}
review:
Also, das Spiel ist schön gemacht, sieht gut aus, netter Sound, nette Grafik, alles super - ABER: Es wird sehr schnell extrem schwer! Und wenn man um jeden Speicherpunkt eine halbe Stunde kämpfen muss, macht es irgendwann keinen Spaß mehr. Insbesondere die Bots, die einen jagen und herumschubsen, machen einem das Leben echt schwer. Man hat oft nicht einmal die Zeit, sich umzugucken, WAS mann denn überhaupt machen muss, bzw. WOHIN man muss, da wurde man bereits wieder von einem Bot in die ewigen Jagdgründe geschickt.

Vielleicht mag ein jugendlicher Dauerzocker diese Reflexe haben, die man für das Spiel benötigt, für mich ist es praktisch nur frustrierend bis unspielbar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986578211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1442579250}
review:
I admit it, I'm too clumsy for this game. But I'm an addicted gamer, and I want to finish what I play.
Such an exciting game, it really is.
But also one of the most utterly frustrating gaming experiences of my past 20 years of gaming, and I can't tell you how filled with pure hatred I am for the developers. They're all talented guys, probably with the reflexes of a Ninja.
I want to finish this game so badly. But there's no slightly easier mode, no "you've died a million times at the same spot, here's a little help" sort of thing. This is more frustrating that talking to my stubborn fascist parents.
I can't in good consciousness recommend this game, yet I had a fantastic time with it. But it's too hard, it will fill you with hate and it will take 10 years off of your life expectancy, if you're an old slow fart like I *apparently* am. Thank you, 5 Bits Games, for making the first game in 20 years that makes me feel I should probably take a look at Backgammon, fine Whisky and arthritis pills.
Don't play this game, please. But if you do, you might just love it, as I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058997305', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1482948317}
review:
A platformer for the twitch-shooters, DeadCore features perfect jump controls and levels that are just frustrating enough that you'll keep retrying one jump for 20 minutes. It also features a special gun that can activate and deactive platforms, boost pads and other stuff. You can also unlock other moves, such as Dash, but I haven't prgressed that far.
[b]PROS[/b]
[list]
[*]Simple concept done very well.
[*]Looks great.
[*]Awesome music.
[*]Doesn't get repetitive.
[/list]

[b]CONS[/b]
[list]
[*]Can be frustrating sometimes (the tunnels when you first get Dash has me stuck for 20 minutes).
[*]Sometimes you feel rushed, as though you aren't allowed to explore.
[*]If you aren't a speedrunner, not much replay value.
[/list]

[b]THE VERDICT[/b]
Get it if you like plaformers, this is a great one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198100501677', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1442495454}
review:
听说和传送门比较相似 我就去试了试
然而 结果
sad
[spoiler] 顺便一提这是第一款把我玩晕的游戏  [/spoiler]
这款游戏根本不是解密类游戏 而是找路的游戏
通关时间用了4小时20分钟（未集齐星火）
过程中也没有任何东西陪你聊天 趣味性和传送门比起来也差了许多
全程几乎没有任何解密类元素 无限Retry也只是为了能碰碰最好的运气罢了
传送门你需要真正的思考你该如何到达下个地方 这个游戏呢 90%的地方你知道路 但你还是只能无限的rrrrr 只是因为障碍物会不断的攻击你 你需要获得最好的运气才能到达下个检查点 所以这个过程真的很想很想很想让你砸键盘 甚至放弃这个游戏
因为实在太单调了
而解（zhao）密（lu）的过程中你甚至不知道任何剧情 没有任何的互动 只能通过日记零星的片段来判断发生了什么（虽然到最后我也不知道发生了什么
而游戏最有趣的地方大概也只是通关后找星火日记和跑道的时候了 大概是因为在相同的关卡你能走不寻常的路吧
不过也不得不说 设计人员脑洞也是够大的2333
[spoiler] 集齐了星火的我最后从章节选择里又玩了一次最后一关 结果过关后只有restart level没有next level 怒删	[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198062154352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1591385711}
review:
Speedrun a jen speedrun, o ničem jiném tahle hra není, jen co nejrychleji doslova proletět kolem. Je to však úžastně návykové a pokoždé když dokončíte kolo, bude se snažit vylepšit svůj stávájící čas i o jednu blbou vteřinu. 
DeadCore se mi ihned zalíbil, krásně se kombinují vaše skilly s okolním prostředím a do toho hraje svižná hudba jenž vás nutí nestát hloupě na místě. 
Jestli se vám líbil Mirror's Edge, tak bych s nákupem DeadCore neváhal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994393659', 'num_games_owned': 1325, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1482593533}
review:
DeadCore zapowiadał się bardzo przyjemnie, pachniał Portalem nastawionym trochę bardziej na platformowe skakanie.
Niestety po kilku planszach przyjemność zastąpiła irytacja i przekonanie, że gry z widokiem z pierwszej osoby nie nadają się na zrecznościowe platformówki. W Portalu mieliśmy większość elementów podanych na tacy, a naszym zadaniem było poukładać je tak aby przejść dalej, tutaj niestety często po sekwencji skoków i uników jesteśmy rzucani w miejsce którego nie było widać i mamy sekundę lub dwie na zorientowanie się co mamy zrobić, spóźnimy się to musimy powtarzać cały fragment. Bardzo szybko logiczne odnajdywanie drogi zostało zastąpione bezmyślnymi, niekończącymi się próbami pokonania drogi między zabójczymi polami siłowymi, bez widoku ciała jest to robione zupełnie na wyczucie bo kilka milimetrów w złą stronę oznacza powtarzanie tego fragmentu. System zapisywania też nie pomaga, czasami punkty zapisu mamy po kilku prostych platformach, a gdy dochodzi do naprawdę trudnych sekwencji, na które składają się skoki, uruchamianie przycisków w locie, przelatywanie między polami siłowymi, nie mamy żadnego punktu zapisu.
Gra tylko dla ludzi którzy zjedli zęby na Dark Soulsie i popili Super Meat Boyem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060867822', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1451432186}
review:
I picked this game up on sale, expecting to spend maybe an hour jumping around on platforms killing some time..
4hours 10minutes later i ended up completing the game, in one sitting. (Very rare thing for me.)

It just completely blew me away. And i came back the next day, to start doing speedruns and finding the last sparks i was missing from the initital run.. I am now considering buying 3D glasses for my 3D monitor, to play my first ever 3D game.

Absolutely recommend !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035441627', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1510483255}
review:
SFチックなブロックとレーザーで構成されたステージをチェックポイント目指してジャンプするFPS。
ジャンプタイミングやAIM力といった技術よりも、同じ道を何度も通って何度も失敗しても折れない心を要求される。

ワープホールを開けられないポータルシリーズのようなゲームをイメージするとわかりやすいと思う。
ただ、最初にも書いたようにポータルのようなパズルというよりは、順路やギミックを覚えるゲームになっている。
その分ギミックをどう超えればよいのかという"詰み状態"になることはあまりない。しかし、各チェックポイントの配置されている空間は同じであるため、正規ルート以外を意図せずにせよ通ることが出来てしまう。
出来てしまうというのは、それを運が良かったととらえるか、進んだのか戻ったのかわからないといったマイナスにとらえるか、いろいろあるからである。

ところで、ほかの方のレビューに3D酔いするといったものがある。
メジャーどころからマイナーどころまで、リアル系からスポーツ系まで結構な数のFPSを遊んできたが、3D酔いしたのは初めてである。
重力能力を使うあたりから3D酔いする可能性が高いと思われる。

参考動画(微ネタバレ注意)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u_uVJibBw9E

author: {'steamid': '76561198101828351', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1498556281}
review: Beau graphisme, jeu intéressant , je recommande

author: {'steamid': '76561198082778525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1442014362}
review:
Nice change of pace type of game from gun blazing to speed running platform. Great graphics and quite challenging right off the bat. The only thing that is annoying is the sense of 'footing' doesn't seem to exist, like when you look down you see yourself to see how much you're standing on a platform without falling off the edge. Its like playing a character who is totally invisable with a floating gun as if you are playing a ghost, but still able to fall. Plus it get a little slippery if you try to stop and theres also when trying to jump on another block while still running forward against the wall you can end up gettng hooked on those frame so that adds to the annoyance, not sure if its part of the mechanics but it does make the game very difficult.
Of course I'm not much of a FPS player but I can feel more sense of the character playing Halo than this, but you get what you paid for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165518734', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1494161494}
review:
這遊戲真心太難了！第1次玩前做好心理準備會狂死，因為機關設置太令人無語。除了天煞的難玩之外，這遊戲相當過癮：
--------------------
+高科技的視覺特效
+遊戲節奏很快
+很有趣的跑酷。
+遊戲關卡還算耐玩

author: {'steamid': '76561198054548888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1442152641}
review: Only buy this if you're a hardcore fan of this genre. I expected, going into this, that it would be something I could pick up and enjoy in my downtime as a casual game: it was not so. So unless you specifically love "speed-running first person platforming shooters", then don't waste your time or money on this game because it will be fun for a whole 2 minutes while you learn the basic controls...that don't even work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044327706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1442511851}
review:
Коротко о главном: есть пушка для активации/деактивации различным элементов на уровне, 2 ноги, даблджамп и рывок(dash). Ваша цель любой ценой(и желтельно как можно быстрее) дойти до вершины башни. Головоломок тут нет, пара путей прохода того или иного участка с разной сложностью, но перед тем как пройти ряд преград вам придется заранее продумать, что и когда вы будете делать.
Картинка замечательная, музыка просто великолепная, пейзажи очень атмосферные, но в то же время не отвлекают от игры. Рекомендовано к покупке!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965330005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1447969062}
review: I'm hating on all of my friends who could have advised me this game but didn't and kept this jewel for themselves. You know who you are. And in turn, to everybody else: this game rocks. It's hard, it's fast, levels have lots of glitches and alternate routes that the designers may or may not have put there on purpose. It's the bastard child of Tron and Mirror's Edge and I'm going to marry it when it's legally eligible to do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109087083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1489370199}
review: Beautiful art design and graphics, great music, interestion story base, flawless idea... but too fucking hard. WAY TO FUCKING HARD! I've put some good hours into it and I've hit a point that honeslty is impossible for a lot of gamers to get past. Levels 1-3 cake walk, Level 4 interesting, Level 5 all the sudden fucking crazy. The learning curve on this game is unforgiving and relentless. Its not worth getting. Just watch some youtube or broadcast clips and look at some screen shots for the visual effectls. Other than that, FUCK THIS GAME, the developers need to make the game longer or with more modes and for THE LOVE OF JESUS FUCKING CHRIST ALMIGHTY make the game less fucking frustraiting. DO. NOT. GET. THIS. PIECE. OF. SHIT. GAME. Have a great day :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002013090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1442086004}
review:
Жутко раздражающая игра. Поначалу завораживает скоростным геймплеем, но чем дальше - тем меньше игра прощает ошибки. В результате, чтобы пройти небольшой участок уровня, приходится дрочить клавиатуру 20 минут кряду. Естественно, лучше потратить это время на что-нибудь более полезное.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121154389', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1442256929}
review:
yeni bir oyunla herkese merhaba. karşınızda Deadcore
hopla, zıpla, yarış, yetiş...
portal oynayanlar bu oyuna bayılacaklar, yeri gelecek klavyeyi parçalamak isteyecekler. ama her bölüm sonunda ellerindeki kramplara ve terlere rağmen içlerinde kelebekler uçuşurcasına mutlu olacaklar.
portal benzeri oyunumuzda elimizde çevreyle etkileşimli bir silah kullanıyoruz. zorlu parkurları bu silah sayesinde geçiyoruz. her bölümün birden fazla çözümü var.
eğer oyunda biryerde takıldıysanız ve geçemiyorsanız mutlaka etrafınıza iyi bakın. başka bir yol bulabilirsiniz. oyunun tam çözüm videolarını myoyuns youtube kanalımızdan takip edebilirsiniz. 
bulmaca ve platform oyunlarını seviyorsanız kaçırmayın. mutlaka alınması gereken bir oyun olduğunu düşünüyorum.zaten çok cüzi miktarara satılıyor.
herkese iyi oyunlar

author: {'steamid': '76561198011065664', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1599355941}
review:
どうも操作しづらいと思ったら足場の端っこが斜めになってるような感じで、着地できたと思ってもずり落っこちるようです。
なので足場でもなるべく真ん中にいないと危ないです。

アクション得意な人にもおすすめできるかどうか微妙なところです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198121466153', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1529884405}
review:
Sehr schönes Jump'n'Gun.

Der Grafikstil hat mich von Anfang an gepackt. Die Atmosphäre unterstreicht das Spiel perfekt.
Sowohl gechilltes Gameplay, als auch Speedrun Modus sind vorhanden. Das Spiel erlaubt, sich die Gegend wunderbar näher anzuschauen. Durch die verschiedenen Modifikationen lassen sich vorallem später, aber auch am Anfang schon der Freiraum, auf Abenteuerliche Wege zu gehen, die weder zum Ziel noch zu Bonis führt.

Für Sammler gibt es jede menge zu finden.

Was ich am besten an dem Spiel fand, ist die Freiheit, den Parkour zu lösen wie man möchte. Ob man den vorgeschriebenen Weg geht oder mithilfe von gekonnten Sprüngen, Sprints und Blasts sich einen eigenen Weg durch die Hindernisse bahnt bleibt einem selbst überlassen.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad steigt kontinuierlich, manchmal als ungeübter shooter Spieler auch mal frustrierend. Aber nach kurzer Überlegung findet man eventuell sogar einen anderen Weg, an die Sache heranzugehen.
Aber selbst für langsamere Spieler ist nichts unmöglich was das Spiel bietet, auch wenn der erste Eindruck eines neuen Abschnittes öfters mal "Was zur Hölle haben die sich dabei gedacht?" war.

Von meiner Seite aus eine klare Kaufempfehlung.

Ein Spiel was meinen Ehrgeiz gepackt hatte!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042139224', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1467569471}
review:
All right. So there is something I need to immediately put out here. This game isn't fucking Portal, nor is it a "spiritual successor" by any regards. Those that say this are people who obviously haven't played the game or looked at the screenshots on the store page. This is a game that I can "recommend", but only for those that don't mind difficulty. If you're hoping to sit down and get through this game for the first time in one sitting, you are doing nothing but lying to yourself.

Now we got that out of the way, I can answer the question "so what is Deadcore?" Well, it is an FPS with heavy platforming elements that has a hard requirement for twitch-like reflexes. The art style of the game is very cyberpunkish and often makes me think of a "Tron meets Blade Runner" kind of thing. It looks amazing in motion, which is what you'll be spending most of the game doing. Yep. Moving. A lot. Most likely trying to dodge the rude obstacles that want to ruin your day.

Not really that much more to say about it. Other than it is a game meant to be speedran.

Good luck!

review:
Simile a Portal ma senza portali, è un platform molto difficile, dura sulle 6-7 ore  in base alla vostra abilità. 
E' molto snervante e frenetico, c'è il respawn instantaneo utilizzabile quando sbagliate.
Non ha una storia ma si prova una bella sensazione nel finirlo.
A me piace molto questo genere di giochi, gli do un bel 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198084329921', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1441982113}
review:
Рекомендую только любителям хардкора. Когда проходишь, проходишь, проходишь и сдох вместе с тем, что проходил. И ЗАНАВО! Терпеть не могу контрольные точки.
Игра интересная, но головоломка. Не потому что логическая (она не логическая), а потому что она ломает голову своими КТ. Блин, какой идиот их придумал первым, надо вернуться в прошлое и медленно пытать его: Взять хардкорную игру и поставить в ней толкьо одну контрольную точку начало. Я не любитель хардкора, потому, хоть и рекомендую, но играть в неё не буду

author: {'steamid': '76561197966085533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1442183021}
review:
Frustrating and unforgiving but once you get the controls and pace its smooth and fun gameplay with various routes to find and challanging timing. Except all the fallling, always annoying and for some reason the audio clips most of the time on my 11" macbook air, but im still amazed so many good games can even run on it. Non violent games are my favourite but there are so few good ones, and not enough mac games  ported on steam. 
Non violent, challanging, steep difficulty curve, and fun. 
When a game makes you need a break beacuse its so frustrating and your stuck, thats a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003010934', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1441584016}
review: I really wanted to give this game a good review, and recommend it, but I can't. The gameplay really dragged on with the only change as you progressed being the frustration of the obstacles. For about two hours I had a lot of fun with the fast gameplay and the gorgeous graphics. However, that is really the only good thing I can say. Th difficulty curve was harsh and unforgiving. About and hour and a half in I hit a point where it became more frustrating then fun. The enemies don't make it harder or more interesting, just more annoying. the story is only told through logs, and I think if it was presented through a driven in-game story the game could have benefitted. The game also feels like it drags on. after two hours I would look up and feel like I was only a quarter of the way up the tower, which was really disheartening. Do I really want to keep doing this same thing for the next 5-7 hours? The answer was no. So I stopped playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095982888', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1626026008}
review:
DeadCore, tamamen kurgu bir ortam üzerine kurulmuş, futuristik yapıya sahip, parkour-fps oyunu. Türünün en iyi oyunlarından olduğunu söylebiliriz. Çünkü SpeedRun tadını çok iyi şekilde size yaşatıyor. Oyunda zamana karşı yarışırken gerçek hayatınızda zamanın nasıl geçtiğini anlayamıyorsunuz. Başarılı yapımlardan biri olduğunu, parasının hakkını sonuna kadar verdiğini söylebilirim. Önerdiğim oyunlar arasında başları çekenler arasında :)

NOT: İncelemeyi değiştirme kararı aldım çünkü oyunu bir süre daha oynayınca çeşitli hatalarla karşılaştım. Mesela Duvar kenarlarında dururken haraket etmeye kalktığınızda dışarıya doğru fırlayabiliyorsunuz. Kendinizi ileri doğru hızlı fırlattığınızda duvar birleşimlerinin arasına girebiliyorsunuz. Bazen double jump yapmayabiliyor. Oyun ara sıra böyle saçmalayabiliyor ve bu tarz oyunda böyle saçmalıklar resmen oyununuzu bozuyor. Bu yüzden önerdiğim bu oyun hakkında ki düşüncelerim orta karara kaçıyor. Yani düşünün ona göre alın. Böyle saçmalıklar olmasa efsane bir oyun. Değerlendirirken bunu da hesaba katmanızı öneriyorum. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072270350', 'num_games_owned': 1262, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1440972666}
review: Buggy, unresponsive controls make this game frustrating to play, games being overly difficult wouldnt make me rate it thumbs down, but this game is difficult due to controls not responding in a way you would expect. playing several times and finding bugs in where you can sit allow you to pass the game, but any game where you have to explore bug spots isnt one worth playing in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020705409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1440929746}
review:
Buen título de puzzles y plataformas en primera persona.
Asciende hasta lo más alto de la torre utilizando toda tu habilidad, velocidad y puntería, mientras esquivas trampas, lasers y robots.
Varios caminos a elegir, cada uno con sus ventajas e inconvenientes, muchos coleccionables para reunir, algunos potenciadores y sobretodo, muchos desafíos, que te exigirán máxima concentración.
Quizás, ésto último sea la peor parte del juego, ya que, a veces el éxito dependerá más de la suerte que de tu habilidad y acabarás por repetir un punto de control hasta la saciedad.
Para terminar, el diseño de los mapas es muy bueno y da mucho juego, además de presentar unas vistas preciosas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985067247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1454191454}
review: Feels good to play, floaty enough. You can upgrade stuff. I like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996979035', 'num_games_owned': 942, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1440731105}
review: Portal meets Mirror's Edge in a Tron environment. This is a very unique platformer that feels great every time you find that shortcut in the path. I've played about an hour and found that around every corner is something different. I had fun and probably won't play any more in the near future simply because I don't feel like taking the time to test my skills (because this game certainly would). If there were a Portal-like narrative, perhaps I would progress for the story's sake. But if you have the time and inclination, by all means, buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994932851', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1440701579}
review:
Très bon jeu, dommage qu'il n'y ait pas une véritable histoire à la place de l'enchainement linéaire des niveaux.
Chaque niveau dispose de plusieurs embranchements, ce qui fait qu'on peut constamment découvrir de nouvelles portions du jeu. Bande son calme, on finit même par l'oublier. 

Point notable, c'est la première fois que je vois un jeu également pensé pour le speedrun (présence de cette option dans le menu principal). Ca fait plaisir.

Le jeu égale pas Portal ou Talos Principle mais reste quand même très très bon, bien que court globalement (et encore heureux pour les speedrunners).

author: {'steamid': '76561198041948102', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1632367554}

Fast-paced, quick thinking, smooth graphics and textures, lots of replay-ability. Would definitely recommend this game. 

No story but once you start playing you will see you dont need it. 

Would highly recommend using a keyboard and mouse.
